Reviews.Title: “Always great service”
Reviews.Author: Jack0726
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Copley Place, and had another great stay. The price is on the higher side for a hotel, but about average for Boston. Great customer service as always. I spoke with Steve at the front desk re: construction noise and he was very interested in making sure I was taken care of for the inconvenience. The best thing about this hotel, is that the quality is the same every time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patosyg
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great.Seemed to be right in the center of Boston,connected to a mall, with a bar. The only thing was they had a very busy weekend and double booked everyone so we had to wait till late afternoon to get our room. Also it was surprising how most of the bars in boston close at one being from detroit was very surprised. The only way the hotel had and effect on this aspect is their bar closes at one also and they dont let the the liquor store delvery place deliver to the hotel.If they allowed the store to deliver it would have benefited us a lot.Over all beautiful hotel ,great location ,with helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “BLACKOUT March 15, 2012”
Reviews.Author: flamingob
Reviews.Content: Called the hotel because we couldn't get through all the traffic and were told that a manhole blew. Took us over an hour and almost not allowed in to parking garage once we were within reach. Just wish the Copley concierge had informed us of how serious the situation was. Wasted lots of time in traffic and then on the T trying to find dinner because everything in Copley, Prudential, Newberry St. were closed. Couldn't take a taxi to dinner because of the traffic. Had one night to spend with our college age kids, but wasted time in traffic, on T, and walking around cables and generators. We would have changed hotels without hesitation if we were informed of the situation. Also, couldn't use the pool.

Reviews.Title: “A shining star in a dark night and day”
Reviews.Author: SandraCollins
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night stay at the Copley Square Marriott. I arrived on Tuesday, about an hour after the power went out. Quickly staff were trying to meet the needs of guests. Snacks and glow sticks were distributed. Grant it the cold showers were not comfortable but the helpfulness and friendly manner of the staff made a difficult situation that much more bearable. The hotel provided free meals and bottled water for two days. Housekeeping maintained their schedule. Charging stations were set up for people to charge mobile devices. The staff always had a smile on while trying to accommodate everyone. Don Dobson-one of the elevator operators had a warm smile and pleasant conversation while transporting people up and down the many floors. Marriott's response to the situation made me feel safe and secure while visiting a new city. I will definitely choose Marriott when traveling in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Linrose94
Reviews.Content: On the 27th floor, beautiful refurbished room, beds very comfortable; also immaculate. Staff excellent! Stayed during the blackout and you couldn't ask for better assistance and concern. Will most definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Worst case scenario!”
Reviews.Author: callia02
Reviews.Content: The Marriott property is expensive even at Convention rates but I could have been at a Motel 6 or hostel with the my experience this week. First of all, the power went out which meant cold showers, dark rooms and walking up 14 flights of stairs. Next, the lack of communcation on the part of the staff was unbelievable. We had no understanding of what had caused the power outage, when we could expect power to be restored (basically were told 4:30 then 8pm then 12midnight, etc...) to no avail. The staff gave out water and glow sticks if you happened to be "hanging out" in the lobby that also had no power or internet. If you left the hotel you had no idea about what was being offered guests. One surprise was that now that the light is on, I realize that the granola bars given to me were EXPIRED (1/12). I guess since it was dark we shouldn't notice, right? The noise in the hallways was loud as well as from the stairwells and outside. I would recommend the Hilton if you come to this location. Although Marriott may have a good name nationally (better than the Hilton chain which can be quite variable), the mgt at Hilton worked to have generators restore power, internet, hot showers quickly AND put guests up at an alternative Hilton locations (with free transportation) that had power. You might wonder what the guests at Marriott were given for the trouble? A $100 discount TOTAL for 3 nights stay (~ $33/night) on a $237/night room rate. Even with power this hotel is not worth it. Yes, the location is convenient to the convention center, but this property does not live up to the chain's reputation. The one positive is that the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling room and superb location at any time of the year”
Reviews.Author: stgregorygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed last weekend at this hotel. It has a super location especially during a Boston winter. You are connected to two upscale shopping malls and restaurants by enclosed walkways. You are in Copley Square and in easy walking distance of Trinity Church, the Boston Public Library, and Newbury Street shopping. It is a great location for visitors. We are locals and we so enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room appeared to have been recently updated. The carpeting was spotless in the room and throughout the hotel. The bedding and bathroom were also spotless. I am picky about air quality and I had no trouble with too much heat or dryness in the room. We were facing Huntington Avenue which is a busy street. It provided great views but it was somewhat noisy at night. Staff at the hotel was friendly and accomodating. We had the shopping package with valet parking and a $25.00 Amex card. Given the cost of parking in the area, we found this to be a very good deal. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: MJ525
Reviews.Content: Took a quick trip with my wife to Boston for her birthday. We have tried a few hotels in the city. This was our first stay at this location. The hotel is freshly renovated. We arrived around 11 am on a Friday. The hotel staff checked us in and gave us a nice corner room on the sixth floor. We were hoping to get a higher floor but were happy to get in so early. The hotel has a nice bar(Champions) on the second floor. Reasonable prices for food and drinks for a bigger city. The hotel is in a prime spot in the center of town with lots of bars and shops and places to eat within a very short walk. There are two different shopping malls on either side of the hotel. If you get a chance, go next door to the prudential center and eat lunch at The Top of The Hub. It is a bit pricey but the service and views of the city can't be beat. Parking is a bit steep at about $35 a day. I want to say valet is $45. The beds are the super comfy as always with a Marriott property. The corner room sacrifices space but with the king bed you also get a sleeper sofa. The bathroom was tiny. Staff is very helpful and knowledgeable. With the new renovations and the location in the city, I would love to stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rc02110
Reviews.Content: The room had recently been remodeled and was neat and clean. The staff here were very pleasant and helpful. The location in Boston is perfect for shopping as well as sightseeing. Highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “I think on this hotel when I think Boston”
Reviews.Author: Anne H
Reviews.Content: I have had fantastic times at this hotel, with wonderful rooms and wonderful shopping area, as it is on a huge mall at the middle of Boston. Quality of service, rooms, decoration, is excellent. Location is very convenient as you are in the center of the city and you are close to the Boston Commons, theater, concerts, etc. I always go to this hotel, repeat all over and over again. I also stay there when I go for dental meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in a Good Part of Town”
Reviews.Author: memoreks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February with my wife and 6 year old. The hotel is around 15 minutes taxi ride from Boston Logan Airport, and is in a good location in Boston. The hotel is 38 stories, with the Concierge Lounge on the 28th floor. Initially we were given a room on the 28th floor, which I requested, but when we arrived it turned out these rooms were not yet renovated, and were very tired looking. I asked for a different room and was given a much nicer, recently renovated room on the 24th floor, where we stayed for a week. The rooms are reasonably spacious, with the usual comfortable Marriott beds. I found the rooms a little noisy, with the doors between rooms letting sound through from adjoining rooms, and the window letting a bit too much noise through from the outside for my liking, despite being on the 24th floor. I spend half my life in a hotel in London and it is much quieter than this. However the staff were helpful and courteous, and the food at Champions, bar one night, was very nice. For Europeans travelling to this hotel, bear in mind that typically the US does not provide free alcohol in the Concierge Lounge, and this is no exception. The food from the Concierge Lounge was reasonable, but not exceptional. For tourists the hotel is good. The Boston bus tours stop right outside, and tickets are available from the lobby. The Concierges are helpful and highly knowledgeable of the area, perfect for Boston n00bs like us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights 02/21/12 - 02/23/12 in room 2001. It is conveniently located to multiple shopping areas via sky-walks so you do not need to go outside during inclement weather. Lots of stores and restaurants, plus Newbury Street (outside) is a short distance from the hotel. All of the hotel staff were friendly and helpful; parking valet, check-in, restaurant, housekeeping etc. Our room was very clean and quiet with a great view of the city including the distant harbor. Only negative comment is that the water temperature in the shower was just lukewarm, it never got hot. Maybe there was an issue on our floor? I forgot to mention it at checkout. I would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Michelle C
Reviews.Content: I spent several weeks here in January and February on a business trip. The location is great because the hotel is connected to one shopping mall and another is across the street. There are a number of restaurants nearby as well. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating when we asked to switch rooms. The rooms are in the process of being remodeled and we stayed in one of the remodeled rooms. I found the rooms to be just average even after the remodel. Overall it is a good hotel for business travel, but if you are looking for better than average hotel rooms I would look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Okay not what it use to be - stayed 2/4/2012”
Reviews.Author: MAWilbur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot in Boston Copley square. It is attached to shopping by glass hallway which is great for all types of weather. I did like that they gave us "connecting" rooms, we had come in overnight for my daughters 16th birthday so it was great in the sense that the girls could shop (though very expensive shops here) and did not have to go outside, this is a very upscale mall and very safe. The only resturant is Champs - a SPORTS bar - so sick of sports bars - NO nice restuarant attached but plenty in the area. The lounge at this hotel use to be unbelievable, they had some of the best bands - I know four couples who actually booked bands that they had seen from this hotel. It was a very classy upscale place to come as couples but that is gone - sports bar took over most of that floor and wireless cafe for Starbucks coffee drinkers - so sad - NO entertainment -. If traveling on business stay here. If coming with girl friends go somewhere where they are closer to bars/resturants w/music, there's Copley Hotel accross the street, the Lenox not far. Sad - so much gone from the area. The Palm resturant was just gone, the Fairmont Copley restaurant closed for renocvations, Morton's Back Bay closed the week we went for good - you would have to go down to the Sea Port area for that. If coming to Boston the SeaPort area is the new and upcoming end of town, Mortons, Delfrisco's, Legal Seafood test kitchen, etc.. in the spring/summer that end is where the concerts are at the outside Pravilion.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: court123s
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been going to this hotel since I was a kid. They often offer reasonable rates and the location can't be beat. They have the Copley Shopping Center connected to it and all the Prudential Shopping is connected. They have a great sports bar in the middle of the hotel, good place to go watch the games. Also an outstanding breakfast buffet. Very short walk to Newbury Street and wonderful restaurants. The rooms are very nice, and the beds are cozy. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-Definitely stay for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: CTmom311
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was excellent. The room was clean and average for a hotel room, but the view was amazing!!! The hotel is conveiniently located to EVERYTHING and I loved how you can access it from the mall. We got the "stay for breakfast" package and it was well worth it. Breakfast was excellent with so many choices. The best part of all though was when we went to leave in the morning and found our car battery to be dead, the staff at the front desk and at the door were amazing. Mo, the front doorman, helped us to get out battery charged and we were on our way.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good.”
Reviews.Author: PartimeHolidaymaker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Feb 6-10, 2012, having got a fairly good deal via Olotels. We had been at bit wary staying in a 38 storey hotel as we normally go for smaller, allegedly more friendly hotels. No need to worry here though, as we received very good service from the offset and a new large room on the 8th floor. As we were on our first visit to Boston, we were a bit nervous, having heard how Bostonians can be loud and abrupt. Certainly wasn't the case at this hotel, or in Boston in general. The front of house girl was very friendly and helpful in dealing with our reservation. In fact everybody from the bell hops up were always very friendly and approachable. The hotel itself was situated on the edge of the Back bay area- just great for seeing all the sites around this lovely city. We pre-booked a Olde Town Hop On/Hop Off bus tour- always the best way to explore a new city. One of the stops was actually in the entrance bay to the hotel! We also pre booked a bus trip to Wrentham Village Outlet Centre, with Boston Common Coach. Picked up and returned at our hotel foyer. We had a transit style minibus with 7 in total traveling, with a helpful driver and plenty of room for shopping bags Don't listen to any negative reviews about Wrentham- if you are looking for bargains make the trip- really good discounts on cheaper than UK prices! Not many bargains to be found around Boston city centre, that we could find- apart from Marshalls, in Bolyston street, but Wrentham is a much better experience! At the end of our trip to Boston we got the Amtrak train from Back Bay station (just through the attached shopping mall and over a road) to Penn station, New York. Would really recommend this journey along the New England coast- a good way to part of the country. Boston was great to see at this time of the year, mostly because we were very lucky with the weather (dry, sunny and cold when we were there- ideal for all the walking we did) and as it was `off season`, there weren't so many tourists about. Great hotel and great city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “My usual place in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ct3408
Reviews.Content: The staff is consistently good at this location, including very friendly club lounge, though club is tight. When I returned to my room and found my laundry bag was never picked up, I was rather upset as it was Friday and I had no clean clothes. This was an important moment for me. At first I was told there was nothing they could do, but the bellman sent the bag out and I had everything laundered within a few hours. This was amazing service and I am very pleased that the hotel took such care of me after their error. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Great Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: santafegal54
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I planned a stay in Boston for a conference that was taking place at the Westin Copley. This hotel is connected to Copley Place with easy walking distance through the connected passage ways, so it was ideal. What struck us most right away was the courteous valet who helped us find a very reasonably priced self-park option rather than hotel parking. He picked up right away that we were concerned about spending. The gentleman who checked us in was very personable and eager to make sure we had the best room - 26th floor Room 2606 I highly recommend - one below the top floor and overlooking the Charles River. Room was very clean, newly renovated and very comfortable beds. We heard some noise from the other room through the walls, but overall, can't emphasize enough how convenient to Prudential area and service minded this hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Chilypepah
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying st this hotel this past weekend for a symposiam with work. The service was great, the food was great, the room was great, and the view from the 19th floor was fantastic! This hotel is located within walking distance of some of Boston's best shopping and restaurants. This beautiful hotel has been recently remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for work or touring! Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Boston for work. Our office is in the Prudential Center. I stayed at the Marriott Copley Place, which can be reached via skyways and the mall. No need to bring jacket to work. This was not my first visit or stay at the Marriott. This trip, I made an effort to "see Boston". One night I walked to the Cheers bar (approx 20 min walk). I went out for dinner at a place in the South End (3 blocks away from Marriott) called Giacomo's, per recommendation by consierge. Excellent neighborhood Italian, incidentally. Another night, I went to a Boston Bruin hockey game - caught the subway right near the hotel which drops you off right next to arena. Marriott Copley Place is a great place to stay - high quality rooms, Starbucks on 2nd floor, easy location. If you are in Boston, this should be high on your list of places to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with the Sports Bar”
Reviews.Author: lostmyluggage
Reviews.Content: Met up with some friends at the Sports Bar inside the Boston Copley Marriott Hotel last night. We used to love going to the Marriott when they featured live dance bands, but then some big wig decided they would make more money by having a sports bar which operates all day. True, they probably make more money, but they lost something which is a rare find in Boston: dance music for all ages. That being said, we decided to meet up at the Sports Bar. It was nearly desserted and deadly quiet. I opened the wine menu and saw that the only white wine they had that wasn't horribly oaky was $14.00 per glass. When the waiter brought my wine, he seemed positively embarrassed, probably by the price of the wine. My chicken wings were caked in congealed grease. We won't be going back any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Being remodelled - good thing”
Reviews.Author: ValVil
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel we were greeted by union members picketing the hotel for not using union labor to remodel the hotel, which is how we learned they are remodelling. No problem...we get angry when people try to influence businesses to make business decisions that go against basic business principles. But we really are here to review the hotel...and the main point is that this hotel, which we have stayed at a few times over several years, is starting to need some updating. It is still a comfortable hotel, better than the nearby Westin where we also stayed recently, but in some areas such as the bathrooms, the hotel is not up to current standards of quality. The rooms themselves are better, and one notable feature is the speed of the Internet connection...it was better than most chain hotels provide. We did not experience too much of the hotel's service on this trip, but the interactions we did have were all handled very professionally and to our satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “What's to Think!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lola S
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel are very professional, courteous and attentive. it is worth staying whether I redeemed my Marriott rewards or pay full price. The facility has a gym,mini gift shop, concierge level, breath-taking Charles River view, sports bar,sushi and the mall. The shopping mall offers all price point levels from budget-minded consumers to sky is the limit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: Chorini
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to Boston, I have stayed at the Marriott uncountable times over the past 15 yrs. My company always use this hotel for their employees on business'trips. And happy am I because of that! The location is so so so good, everything is right on your doorstep. The view from the rooms on the higher levels are magnificent. I have nothing to complain about this hotel. In fact, the rooms have just been done, and the beds are so comfortable! The staff has always been so lovely and helpful. The rooms are immaculate, and if you are missing something, just let them know, and they will bring it to you. Starbucks is located on the 2nd floor, very convenient. This opens at 06.00AM. There is also a huge and very good supermarket just across the road, Shaws, and this is open 24/7. I would come here if I was visiting Boston on my time of leisure. Definately.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but you need work-arounds”
Reviews.Author: PAMan804
Reviews.Content: I stay here every year for a conference, and I look forward to it. However, you need to know how to work-around some serious issues. For example, the first night I was awakened by loud & sharp street noises that penetrated the 20th floor. Things like truck horn blasts at 4 AM, sirens, etc. The walls are paper-thin, so normal noises from surrounding rooms get through and so do the slamming of each nearby room doors. But, putting the fan for the heater on high drowns that out (messes with the room temp). First morning my shower drain was slow and the shower was cold. In the afternoon the maint. engineer arrived, apparently summoned by housekeeping (this is a sign of a great hotel). I asked him to address the cold water, and he did. Nice. Lobby bars are always fun. Champions is a great sports bar and a nice place to watch the Patriots playoff game (unless you were a Ravens fan).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and/but very busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: redcarnations208
Reviews.Content: Location is good but I prefer another hotel a block or so away called The Colonnade Hotel | 120 Huntington Avenue | Boston | MA | 02116--rated very well on tripadvisor so check it out. Boston Marriott rooms are only average but access to two shopping malls via a catwalk across busy Huntington Ave will keep you cool on hot days and warm on cold days. The lobby is hectic and confusing and hotel personnel don't seem to notice guests unless you walk up to the front desk. For the money, check out The Colonnade where the pace is relaxing, personnel receptive, and the rooms are more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel, in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: tuckertwo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Copley Place recently with friends for a long weekend, and we each enjoyed the hotel. Parking is steep, and the hotel is located on busy Huntington Ave. The location of this Marriott could not be better as it is quite central and near many T stops, however I feel that the hotel only compares average to it's great location. The rooms were nice, (nothing too over the top), clean, and exactly what you expect from the Marriott name. We had a noisy batch of neighbors one night, and called the front desk to complain, the staff was prompt and friendly in responding to our call. On a side note-in order to call the front desk be sure you are pressing the right phone button-it can be a bit tricky! We did not take advantage of any of the other amenities, except the lounge (which tends to be packed, and the appetizers are HUGE...so take note and plan accordingly!), so I can't comment on those. We will stay here again if the need arises to be in the Back Bay area again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but nice location”
Reviews.Author: snj1027
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel location but the rooms are average. The bar attached is nice and also having the mall right there is nice. The elevators are slower than what you would expect. The staff was nice and the meeting room facilities were good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Fer13
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice experience at the Marriott Copley Place. The room was very nice and the location was very convenient. We were close to everything and we were able to walk where ever we needed to go. I was there for business and the conference area left a lot to be desired, but the staff and the accommodations were very nice. The price is quite steep, but I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall Stay”
Reviews.Author: dnumgis02
Reviews.Content: As a platinum member, we had a high floor with a "corner" room with decent views of the city. All in all it was a very good stay that we've come to expect from full service Marriotts.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: whizzymum
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in this hotel, central location. The rooms are standard Marriott decor and the staff pleasant. Great base for shopping and touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: johnfi
Reviews.Content: Stayed New Yearâ€™s Eve 2011 for Boston First Night and hotel was busy but is a great location to the sights and shopping. Ask for a high floor room the views are excellent overlooking Boston and the Charles. Elevators can get a little busy around peak times but not too bad. Rooms are standard Marriott dÃ©cor, a little dated but not run down and clean and in good shape. Smaller bathroom and good MarriottBed that was very comfy as always. Champs bar/restaurant was busy but good breakfast buffet. This hotel will be a great place for business travelers or vacation travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jfulginiti
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on New Year's Eve. The wait to check in was horrible - over an hour. The line snaked around the whole lobby. I understand that it was a holiday and the hotel is in a prime location, but they were not even fully staffed at the front desk. A small sour note to begin our stay. We got a corner room on the 28th floor with a great view. The room was spacious and well appointed. We had no ice machine on our floor and had to ask THREE different housekeeping employees where the closest one was (no ice on the floor above or below either. Wierd!) We visited the lobby bar after enjoying First Night festivities and also ordered room service. Both were very good. You can't beat the location. Copley square and Prudential mall are great. It's a short walk to Newbury Street where we had dinner reservations at Stephanie's on Newbury. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week for a business trip in Boston. This was my first stay in the city, and the hotel couldn't have been better placed. The hotel itself is attached to a very nice shopping mall, and the back bay area has a large selection of restaurants and shops. The rooms were fine, the beds were comfortable and the walls seemed to keep out any noise from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The best Location in Town”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler21nj
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is at the best Boston location to tour the city. I am a platinum member for Marriott and was treated to a suite and great buffet breakfast. Gym and pool were great. I will be back with family again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: eggtmt
Reviews.Content: I have stayer here twice in the last few months. The location is excellent. Boston is a walking city and you can walk to all areas of the city from here. There are also 2 T stops within a block. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. All the staff were very friendly. This is a good choice in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: wsmithatc
Reviews.Content: Stayed with another family and they gave us a suite and adjoining room. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: Ally021
Reviews.Content: Nothing negative to say about this hotel. Our room was on the 25th floor with a view to the river, it was newly refurbished and extremely comfortable. The hotel is attached to 2 shopping malls and is situated between 2 T stations.This subway system is so easy & cheap to use for travel all over the city. It's within walking distance of the chic Newbury St which is great for shopping and dining and Boston Common and the beginning of the Freedom trail. Have stayed in Boston a couple of times now and in my opinion this hotel can't be bettered for location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with an excellent weekend deal.”
Reviews.Author: travelingfool987
Reviews.Content: It is in the heart of the best shopping area of the city. Pool, fitness center are excellent. Once you arrive you need not put on a coat until you lerave. Everything one could need is right there. We had a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room”
Reviews.Author: foodlovr22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for five nights while he attended a training for his work. The room was very big (actually a handicapped accessible room) and had two great windows with pretty city views. It was one of the quietest city hotel rooms ever.....at the end of a short hallway with only one other room nearby. The top floors (19-27) have all been remodeled and even though ours was not the decor was fine and the bed very comfortable, with crisp clean linens. Maid was very accommodating as we needed extra coffee. The central location makes this a super place to stay within walking distance of almost every area of Boston....and the Old Towne Trolley comes right into the hotel area for a very easy ride. The Prudential malls and shops and great restaurants make even bad weather very nice. We had absolutely no issues with elevators waiting no more than twenty to thirty seconds for one. Overall a great stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a conference”
Reviews.Author: 123hat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in the hotel. The location was excellent for walking but spent most time in doors. Overall, everything was good and would stay here again for another conference.I would look elsewhere for a vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay...BUT”
Reviews.Author: marya009
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat if you like to dine and shop! The bed and pillows were my favorite part...so comfy and clean. We had an OK stay here...I was in Boston for a baptism and most of my family stayed at this hotel. The first night, my in-laws said that the hotel had given their room away, and were awoken in the middle of the night to other guests! They had a room key to the room and my in-laws had to kick them out of the room! We did contact the manager of the hotel, and they were very apologetic about it....but STILL! Would I stay here again? Yes, because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Good service”
Reviews.Author: MrGoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location for both work and play. There is a big 24 hours supermarket just across the road from the hotel. Service staff are all extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “R&R”
Reviews.Author: BlueRobin
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with friendly, accommodating staff. We stayed for three nights over the Thanksgiving holiday. It was wonderful. The gym and pool are probably the nicest I have seen in a hotel. The location was great. You have skywalks to the Prudential shopping center and the hotel is attached to fine boutique shops. Two tube stations are close to the hotel. Food was very good at the hotel restaurant and reasonably priced. Room service was quick and the attendant was very helpful. Yes valet parking is expensive, but that is the norm for city parking everywhere in the world. The staff was extremely friendly, talkative and helpful. We went away for Thanksgiving break and some rest and relaxation. We were not disappointed. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravcl
Reviews.Content: I don't think this hotel meets the stars it claims or basically delivers as promised. Its in the centre and thats about it. I stayed on 30th floor and all three nights there was some whirring noises on the floor above. The bathrooms were poorly equipped and anything requested came in a quantity of 1. I mean the hotel charges so much so surely they can be generous with bath supplies and tea facilities. BTW there were no such things like vanity kit, shower gel, shower cap, shavers etc etc....so this is where it ends for me. And with all this poor service, no doubt the cleaner leaves the envelope for a tip.....

Reviews.Title: “Superb gym/pool, wonderful walking location”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaJune
Reviews.Content: With a son living in South End and his office in the John Hancock, the location of this Marriott was perfect for us. Since the valet parking is expensive, we used the T or walked, waiting to rent a car on the day we left Boston. I won't repeat the excellent reviews below, but do want to give a shout-out for the high-quality fitness center at this Marriott. As Rewards members staying 7 nights over Thanksgiving, the receptionist was gracious in finding an upgraded room for the 3 of us. Our original room was 2 doubles for 3 adults, and she upgraded us to a Hospitality Room (double size, with DR table and plenty of seating) with a queen Murphy bed + a rollaway for our adult daughter. We did hear the baby/children across the hall (did they open their door? or was this just sound under the doors?). Fie on the loud, obnoxious local Union protestors crowding the street outside.

Reviews.Title: “Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: Kevin E
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel for a 4 night stay to see Boston and go to TD Garden to see the Boston Bruins Hockey... Upon checking in to the hotel we were told most services were closed for the day due to the holiday which was fine since we were tired. Then we had been told there was a 99Percent chance to have a new renovated room which fell through for whatever reason.. So up to the 35 floor to a very actual nice room we settled down and had to call housekeeping for towels and bathrobes and we should have just wiped with wet one's there was no water pressure at all and lukewarm water.The next day we were gone mostly and upon coming back to our room we ordered room service which is what broke our back... We ordered Scrod not Scrod with 10 hairs in the lemon juice when I called down to room service the waiter was non caring and when I requested a F&B supervisor I was told one was not on duty... We ended up fighting our bill and left that hotel.. I will never return to that hotel I should have stayed @ Long wharf and never used this hotel.... The only good thing was the checkIn clerk Angela who gave us a great room view despite being a old room and the checkout clerk who was also great. But that is no way to run a hotel and am sure they didn't care because I work for Marriott... Horrible stay.

Reviews.Title: “Vey nice stay”
Reviews.Author: bertandernie101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and were very happy with our choice. The hotel was centrally located and connected to the shopping malls without need to go outside. Rooms were huge, were clean and very comfortable. Staff were very attentive and you never had to wait to be assisted, there were a lot of staff there to help, whatever the issue. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to explore Boston or anyone visiting on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: MrFrump
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a solid property. I wouldn't say it stood out in my mind as exceptional, but it was clean, comfortable, and the staff was pleasant. Convention traffic tended to cause the elevators to get very backed up, but that's normal. The bathroom was a bit small, but since it was just me, no big deal. I found it convenient that the hotel is at the crossroads of several indoor malls, so it made getting around easy, even if the weather was questionable.

Reviews.Title: “Great shopping with a conference hotel attached!”
Reviews.Author: CleopatraBunny
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference so didn't have a choice on hotels but was pleasantly surprised by both the location on top of two high-end shopping centers (Prudential Center and Copley Place). Rooms were standard but clean and the housekeeping staff always greeted me with a smile and hello when I passed in the hallway. Concierge lounge on floor 28 was small with standard appetizer and breakfast fare. They did have crab cakes one evening which ended up being dinner for me that night. Location is just 3 blocks to Copley subway stop so great for using public transport around town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Californian382
Reviews.Content: This is a great location. The second floor flows directly into a shopping center on the same side of the street and the Prudential Center (across the street) is accessible via an enclosed aerial walkway. There is a very busy Starbucks on the second floor and a large supermarket across the street. There is a T station close by. The rooms are spacious and equipped with refrigerators and are up to the usual high Marriott standard.

Reviews.Title: “great view, great location”
Reviews.Author: PJ_SYD
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in mid-September. Hotel is enormous, excellent location easy walking to shops and restaurants around Back-Bay, the South-end and Newbury St. Directly connected 2 several shopping malls too. Check-in was smooth and very friendly. Our room was spacious and clean and had an amazing view over the city and Charles river. Small bathroom and standard room amenities - your typical business hotel. Beds were comfortable and hotel also offered free-wifi in the lobby and other public areas. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel, my only negative comment would be the room decor was very old fashioned and in desperate need of an update.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay.”
Reviews.Author: CCesario63
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was pleasant. Room a bit tight for 4 people. Great location for both shopping and dining. Located near the T which was great. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hassle free, comfortable stay in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Atl30309
Reviews.Content: I arrived very late at night and was met by very pleasant, competent front desk staff who had me to my room in no time. The room was very clean, convenient to elevators and offered a pleasant view. Everyone I came into contact with associated with this hotel was pleasant, helpful and smiled. I have no criticisms of this hotel. It was an excellent hotel and a hassle free experience..

Reviews.Title: “Double Dipping Bookings”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne T
Reviews.Content: Stayed November 11th in a "wedding block" room-no particular complaints as the room was fairly quiet, adequately appointed, although it was difficult to shut out city lights and attain a level of privacy, and despite temperature controls, the night was chilly and there was no extra blanket in the closet. The real issue was that we stepped out for breakfast the next morning from 8:30-9:30, and, although we did not check out and were not planning to do so until close to the 12 PM check-out time, our room had been cleaned and given to another couple in the hour that we were out! When I explained this unfortunate situation to the manager at the front desk, and described how four people were made exceedingly uncomfortable (we used our key card to re-enter the room and were aghast that a couple was occupying it), all I received in the way of a response was a perfunctory "I'm sorry". Am I cranky or this this situation absurd and unacceptable? The short stay was $319.31 including tax.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Copley Place location in Boston is very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Marialba
Reviews.Content: The hotel service is good and the rooms are nice. The hotel is located across a subway station. The trip from the airport taking the free bus and the $2 subway takes less than an hour, so if you don't have a lot of suitcases, you can save some money in transportation cost. The hotel is linked to a huge mall with great restaurants. You don't have to go outside at all to go shopping or eating out...very convenient in snow season. As far as restaurants in the mall, I recommend Wagamama (great food, worth the noisy atmosphere at times), Cheesecake factory and PF Chang's. Right there in the middle of the mall you can buy tickets for several tours around the city and they pick you up in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SLCTraveler84111
Reviews.Content: Visited November 8-13, having stayed here several times in past years. All in all, it's a great hotel. The rooms are adequately sized and very clean. Housekeeping was very good. The location of the hotel is terrific; part of the Copley complex and connected to Prudential Center. Dozens of stores and good restaurants (Cheesecake Factory, Legal Sea Foods, PF Chang, a good food court) are steps away. The hotel's own sports bar, Champions, was always busy and appeared very, very popular (it certainly was lively!). The service staff was helpful. As a Gold Level Marriott Rewards member, I believe this hotel a very good choice. Is it perfect? No. The rooms are clean, but somewhat dated (smallish bathrooms and standard sized tub/shower combinations). The hotel is remodeling floors one at a time. One morning their work woke me a bit earlier than I would have liked that day (8:15 am). Yes the concierge lounge is closed Friday afternoon to Sunday night, but most lounges are. Yes room service dishes seemed to hang around longer than most, apparently because retrieval is directly handled by room service and not by housekeeping. Yes, several times I had to wait two minutes or so for an elevator to the 28th floor. That said, I found the positives far outweighed any negatives. The location simply cannot be beat. The gym was particularly nice, with good, well maintained equipment (and plenty of it), and a nice pool. The lounge was very nice and I did not find it overcrowded. Housekeeping did a good job keeping my room clean. The in-room climate control worked well - so if I wanted to lower or raise the thermostat, it worked fine. It's not the Ritz nor the Mandarin Oriental (nearby) - and it doesn't carry their steep nightly rates. I have not stayed at the Westin nor the Sheraton (both also nearby), so I can't compare it to those hotels. But don't let the naysayers frighten you away. It's a great hotel, and if you have time to work out, do some shopping, eat at Legal or the Cheesecake Factory, and then enjoy a very short walk back to your room, you'll fully appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch stay in every way!”
Reviews.Author: swoolfrey
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Boston, November 12th, with my girlfriend to enjoy a birthday getaway and as a long time Marriott Reward member, I decided to use my points at the Boston Marriott Copley Place. This one night stay exceeded my expectations, and my only regret was that we couldn't have stayed longer to enjoy the exceptional service provided by this property and staff! Let me explain ... Although reservations were made weeks before, I phoned the front desk the Thursday before our arrival to request an early check in, and arrange for a birthday cake gift to be delivered to our room. The Marriott associate politely explained that my request for an early check-in would be noted, but could not be guaranteed due to the fact that the hotel was booked the night before yet assured me that cake would be waiting and asked what flavor was preferred. Nice touch! As we were driving into Boston on the 12th, approximately 30 minutes from Copley Square, I phoned the front desk and inquired about the early check-in since it was well in advance of the 4:00PM standard check-in time. The voice on the other end recognized my name, and responded "This is Grace, we spoke earlier this week. I'll contact housekeeping and see if the room you have been assigned is ready, otherwise I'll find you another room." I thanked her for her assistance. Upon arrival (2:00pm), the lobby was a flurry of activity and being a Elite Rewards member, we stepped up to the Elite check in and found that our (high floor, riverview) room was awaiting us. Way to go Grace!!! After a short wait at the elevator (yes there are different elevators for different floors of the hotel - this is NOT uncommon for high rise buildings, so those who reported this as confusing, I must disagree), we found our way to the 32nd floor, and found that our room 3232 was a spacious, nicely decorated, two room (LR/BR) suite with wonderful views. Additionally, all of my profile requests were honored - extra towels, refrigerator. Way to go GRACE!!! Shortly thereafter we heard a knock at the door, and housekeeping delivered two white, fluffy, comfy terrycloth robes. Another nice touch! After getting settled and having some time to relax, we decided to explore Boston, and found that the 2nd floor of the hotel was directly connected to the Copley Place Mall, with plenty of high end shopping. Another nice benefit was that this mall was connected to the Back Bay "T" station, which meant public transportation was available without having to step outside. The hotel also had a enclosed skybridge over Huntington Ave, which connected to the Shops at Prudential Center, where you could find even more retail and dining! At this point it was obvious to use that the Marriott Copley Place got it right with Location! After taking in some shopping and sharing Oysters at Legal Sea Food, we returned to our room to get ready for dinner and discovered an 8" chocolate cake! It was exactly what I requested. Since we had reservations at Top of the Hub , we decided not to ruin our appetite and resisted the temptation. Although after dinner, we did slip into our robes and enjoyed the decadent birthday treat. Candles and matches were delivered with the cake also; this tells me the kitchen also knew to pay attention to the details. Yet another nice touch! After an excellent day and a wonderful night, we slept comfortably. Room darkening shades allowed us to sleep in much later than we should have, but I can't blame Marriott for that. Having a Starbucks in the hotel allowed us to enjoy SMC, sit and watch the world go by. One final request to have check out extended by one hour to 1:00pm, was met with a smile and agreed to. Since we weren't ready to leave Boston, we left our bags with the bellhop service while we took in more of the city. After plenty of walking and enjoying ourselves we returned to the hotel, retrieved our bags, and retrieved our car from valet (both hassle free) and set out for home. We loved our time in Boston, and realized a big part of that was due to the comfort and quality of our stay at the Marriott Copley Place.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: CaribeAzul1
Reviews.Content: Problem #1: When we arrived at 7 PM, our concierge level room was not available anymore. No problem, they said, we'll give you concierge access. Apparently they gave access to everyone at the hotel during a convention using an inadequate facility. There was no room to sit, not enough food, you had to deal with a mob of people, plus they were closed two of the five days we were there. Ok, we had to live with that. Problem #2: Over the weekend, new neighbors moved in to the room next to us. The screaming started around 10:30pm, followed by people trying to come into our room through the connecting door, and then the front door. It took two calls, and a threat to call the Boston police for the front desk to respond to this abuse that lasted until well passed 1:30AM. We were trapped in our room, afraid for our safety. This was not acceptable. We were up most of the night, having to get up for an early flight. We will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “not my favorite marriott hotel”
Reviews.Author: MIAMISHEILA
Reviews.Content: We waited over 2 hrs in the lobby for our room to be available when checkin time was at 4pm. Front desk help were snooty and couldn't have cared less. Finally got to our room around 6pm, but someone had smoked in it, so now we needed to change rooms again. They also had messed up our reservation dates. As a loyal Marriott rewards customer, this place was a HUGE disappointment. It is too big and impersonal. Room service dishes were left in hallways for 4 days until I called the front desk and complained. Only saving grace was the hotel's prime location. If given a choice, I would NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hynes convention site”
Reviews.Author: TCCMD
Reviews.Content: As a 24 year elite member of Marriott I have been in a lot of Marriott Hotels around the globe. I had never stayed in this hotel, so this is my first impression. I was put on the Concierge level. One very big gripe I have when a hotel has a lot of convention guests like me during this visit, is that they close the Concierge Lounge and all services associated with it from FridY pm until SundY pm. We are business people at a convention. We are paying the rate, but not getting the service we are paying for. I could care less about the fact the wonderful personnel who take care of the Congierge Lounge need a break on weekend. Use it to train others. The least you can do is to open it and allow access to coffee and soda pop and water. Is that too much to ask, cheap hotel owners? Now that that's over, know that the location is superb, particularly for shopping and getting to the Hynes without going out in the elements. The fitness, swimming,spa area has been renovated and is greAt. The rooms are just OK and haven' changed much in the last decade. One of my other peeve is the lack ofnsheets and blankets. You get a comforter which seems to work very well for my spouse, but I have to throw it off as being too hot about 4 times a night. That is why I really stay away when I am alone on trips from Marriott's and got to the lower brands, as they are more comfortable regarding bedding for men who tend to have a very different temperature desire when sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for business, nice gym”
Reviews.Author: cmckayboulder
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a convention and was very happy with it. The room was fairly spacious for Boston and very clean, excellent hot water and the housekeeping was very efficient. The hotel has a great gym with a very nice pool as well. My only suggestions for improvement would be to improve the WiFi speed (unusably slow when the convention area is full) and offer a lobby bar that does not have sports TV playing at all times. Otherwise a great location, walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaB70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days and 4 nights during for a professional conference that was also at the hotel. The staff was friendly, the room was great, and the beds were super comfortable. There were some great facilities right in the hotel. During my time there Boston was very cold and showy but we didn't need to go outside because the hotel was connected to two shopping malls. If we didn't find what we needed in one area, we just went to the other side, all without stepping one foot in the cold weather. The next time I go to Boston, I'm definitely going to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thespottedtraveler
Reviews.Content: I am staying at this hotel for 9 days... 5 days into it and all I have to say is that it is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The beds are comfortable, towels soft and the water pressure good. I stayed on the 37th floor with a bay view, and I recommend staying on the higher floors, its beautiful. The hotel has a starbucks on the 2nd floor and is connected to 2 malls with a grocery store across the street. There are safes and refrigerators in the room. The buffet breakfast is well worth the 21.95... yep its pricey, but the food ranges from smoked salmon to made to order omelets and includes coffee and juice. If you want to drink in the bar, you will find the service excellent and the drinks strong. Get a seat early if a local game is on because the place gets full fast. The staff of this hotel is excellent and the service is about as good as it can get. If you need a place to stay for business, this is it!!!!! ONLY downside: no free internet costs 12.95/day

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, just in time for snowstorm”
Reviews.Author: anyta277
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights there in October of 2011 for a professional conference.The room was not too big, not too small, everthing what's needed for a good rest and a little bit of work: no note pad and pencil though (yes, some people still need them), not to many pillows (I hate them, they take so much space). Housekeeping was good. One strange thing: the door to my bathroom did not close because it was warped. The hotel is a little bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay when in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Earthbound-Traveler
Reviews.Content: As an Elite member I sometimes get upgraded. This trip was no exception, I was upgraded to a suite. The room was spacious and clean. It had a great view of the Carles River, The executive lounge has an adequate breakfast, but is small by most standards. The hotel staff was wonderful. The Champions restaurant staff, not so much. We were seated and it was at least 15 minutes before someone came to take our drink order. It was not busy, it was 4 pm in the afternoon, on a monday. I counted 7 bartenders/waitstaff standing around bs'ing with each other. Someone need sto give them a kick in the pants.

Reviews.Title: “Coping at the Copely Marriott”
Reviews.Author: David4advice
Reviews.Content: This hotel is attached to the Prudential Center and all the associated shops. It's a great location, especially on cold snowy trips. There are an abundance of restaurants within an easy 3 minute walk. The staff is so efficient they may at times seem unfriendly. The rooms are small, clean but a little worn around the edges. This hotel has all the Marriott features you'd expect and the beds are really comfortable. It feels like a convention hotel and there are lots of non-hotel guests milling around if you like people watching. At times the hotel lobby and 2nd level lounge is too crowded and filled with tired shoppers looking for a break.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: tylertx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Marriott Copley Place for 5 days for a meeting. The staff was great and the location was fantastic. Great on sight sports bar/restaurant in Champions, it was the perfect place to watch The World Series. The room was very nice and well maintained and house keeping was great. I would definitely stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: At some point in the 70's this may have seemed nice. Sadly 2011 standards make this a Motel 6 at the very best. I truly would rather be there now.

Reviews.Title: “Average in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: kid_at_heart17
Reviews.Content: Copley is the most touristy spot of Boston. With that said, of the myriad of hotels around the Copley area, the choices are abundant. The location of the Boston Marriott Copley Place has been it's prime reason for being filled with guests day 365 days of the year. It's connected to the Prudential building at Copley Place and the the Westin Plaza. It's right smack on Copley where it's a short stroll to most of the best places to see in Boston. The T is right at it's front and back. And even on a day when the weather is at it's worst, you can always run home to the Boston Marriott at Copley because it's so accessible to wherever you're coming from. So that's the good side. Now the down side. If there's a pet peeve I have, it's carpeting in a room that doesn't offer complimentary slippers. It's unhygienic to have a room covered in dark-colored wall to wall carpeting and there are no complimentary slippers. You can't see all that murk, mug and dirt covering the floor. While I understand they vacuum the carpets each day, it's still not good to have the floor covered with carpets unless you're offering slippers. There are no added bathroom amenities. With all the other hotels offering better amenities, it's sad that the Marriott has simply Body and Bath lotion, shampoo, conditioner and soap. This is also the first time that I've stayed in a hotel that has an envelope in the room for maid service. While it may not be mandatory, it's such a turn off that even the maids require a tip nowadays. Leaving an envelope in the room for tips for a job that is part of the job description is bad taste. The concierge is cold. Very very cold. They're not the kind of people you would want to ask for help or directions or anything at all. To say they are "impersonal" is being kind. The hotel should be more family and tourist friendly. But you won't get much help from them. Internet connection is $12.95 a day and they offer no packages for 3 or 5 or 7 days usages. Unless I was living inside the hotel room, this is a complete rip-off! Many hotels all over the world offer internet service for FREE nowadays. The hotel is expensive enough as it is and charging for added internet connection for a few hours at this rate is outrageous. Finally, Marriott should strip down the pictures it posts about hotel rooms. Don't get deceived. This is NOT what the rooms look like. They are old, weary and are (I believe) being renovated still. The elevators are enough proof as to the age and state of the hotel. It's too bad that a hotel in this location with this name, sadly has not lived up to expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: LaSigona
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the marriott copley place for 4 nights while here for a conference. The hotel was very nice and clean. We arrived early and were checked in in record time. Our room was on the 30th floor and had a nice view of the city. The location was the best part- we walked everywhere from the hotel. It was also attached by sky bridges to the copley place mall and the shops at the prudential center with many restaurants/bars nearby. The shaws grocery store across the street also has a liquor store inside. It is extremely convienient to the Hynes conference center, but my conference was at the BCEC on the waterfront so i traveled by shuttle. The only downside is the price but all hotels in boston (especially in the fall) are super expensive. The conference discount made it worth it. Valet parking at the hotel is also expensive but if you look online you can find a coupon for 25 dollar overnight parking at the prudential center. The room was very quiet as well.

Reviews.Title: “Designed with meetings in mind but in a mall in the centre of town!”
Reviews.Author: Pi31415
Reviews.Content: A large (but not quite anonymous) hotel with everything the business and tourist traveller needs - including an ok sized indoor pool. Rooms are clean but not large, nine lifts service guests with the first five floors devoted to meeting, eating or heating (exercising)! Very convenient for all the usual outlets and the transfer to the airport via the 'T' is easy enough. Would be happy to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Marriott Copley Place - Boston”
Reviews.Author: CptCelt
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a stay at the Marriott Copley Plaza in Boston after a Red Sox game in September. We had a nice dinner, after game snack, and a great breakfast the following morning. It's a nice hotel in a great spot in Boston (Back Bay), an easy walk across the street from Back Bay Train Station and close to the "T" for an easy trip to Fenway Park and other attractions in Boston. Lots of great restaurants nearby and a short walk to great shopping and the Boston Commons along with many major historical sites. Close to the Prudential Tower and shops as well as being colocated with the shops of Copley Place Mall. Duck Tour "boats" are across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: Wanda110
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and really loved it .The Hotel is attached to a very smart mall,plenty to see,eat, and three T stations a short walk away.Also great if it rains.We had two big comfy beds,large tv,coffee machine,nice bathroom with lots of towels and pleasant toiletries, and a river view from our 34th floor.We heard no noise from other guests.Pool was small but ok for a quick swim,gym looked quite large.We ate in the quiet part of the bar area twice and found the prices fair,and food good,you can still watch the game on the tv screen without the commentary.We thought the staff were very helpful and friendly as if they valued your custom,not at all snooty as some hotels are.We didn't take a laptop,but free internet is available for 15 minutes in the library 5 mins walk away,and it is a beautiful building worth seeing .You can do airline check in at the hotel on the 2nd floor for free.We booked through airline for the best price,but Boston is a very expensive place to stay.We returned for another night after our tour of New England and really looked forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: aitchjbee1154
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Great location with easy walk to transportation system in Copley Place. Rooms well proportioned with nice bathroom. Bed very comfortable. Great views from 26th floor room. Lobby service adequate but impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, but rooms are expensive.”
Reviews.Author: mcglamarous
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and got a good deal via priceline. It was conveniently located about a block from the T subway as well as to some great shopping and easily accessible to good restaurants. Old town trolley tours also has a desk in the lobby so that was easy to book and get on/off the trolley. The room was clean and comfortable and we had nice view of city. However, I would not have paid their regular price of $299/night as there was not much included such as free internet or breakfast. Even the "bath and body works" shampoo/cond./lotion doesn't make it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dallan77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for six nights . Lovely place very central with good shopping malls and restaurants attached. Only downside no free internet in rooms it was $13 a day . Free wifi in lobby and 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced but great location”
Reviews.Author: Wala69
Reviews.Content: The location saves the review in this case. The hotel is way overpriced. The convention discount in our case was better than other I see but still, you pay much more than for better hotels in bigger cities. Room service was OK. They cleaned the room and so there was no complaint in that direction. Check in was slow but OK. The Concierge had no idea about anything in the area. She picked the restaurant that was first on the list and it was not a good one. The location is nice as it is in downtown with the mall, restaurants, train station and convention center within walking distance. Internet was free for us but parking was crazy. Valet and self parking was the same price which was funny. If we did not had to stay there due to the convention we would not have.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & nothing special - you can do better”
Reviews.Author: availablename
Reviews.Content: Basically, a convention tied me to this place, otherwise, I would have stayed elsewhere. For a small-ish dingy room (no view) with nothing but a $7 bottle of water and a bottle of shampoo that wasn't even replaced regularly, the price - $530 a night, $350 with the convention "discount" is insane. And yes, they charge for internet in the rooms - $13 a night. There's free wifi in the lobby and on the 2nd floor, if you're not too annoyed by having to reconnect frequently. They don't have any of the basics (no DVD players to rent, tea bags but no kettle, meaning your tea will have to be made from hot water from the coffeemaker...which tastes like coffee, etc.) here - just bare bones. Decent nachos at the Champions bar on the second floor, but not much else to recommend the place. The gym is okay too, but like I said, for that price, lordy, you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CT_MikeB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Copley Place over a Saturday night after taking Amtrak up from Connecticut. THe hotel is basically right next to the train station. The room was great, consierge was very helpful. There was a Starbucks right in the hotel and there was a wondeful mall attached. The greenline and orange line are both nearby. Overall it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but cold pool, slow elevators, no fridge in room. Wouldn't go back.”
Reviews.Author: Rita J
Reviews.Content: Our group included two adults and one 7 year old. The hotel was comfortable and clean. The central location was great and we enjoyed being able to walk to the Prudential Center Mall without leaving the hotel. Our only complaints were: - We chose the hotel bc it had a pool which is a huge treat for our 7 year old. However, we couldn't enjoy the pool bc it was very cold. I guess that's ideal for real swimmers who want a workout in a lap pool. Not great for kids and their parents who want to splash around. Next time, we'd go for a place with a smaller, warmer, more family friendly pool. - There was a large bank of elevators but only two or three seemed to be operational. Therefore, there was usually a 3-5 minute wait for an elevator and they were very crowded -- like a sardine can. Not fun for us or other passengers when getting on dripping wet from the pool, or smelly and sweaty from a workout. It was strange bc there were so many elevators; we couldn't figure out why they only had 2 or 3 in service. Also escalator to ground floor was not working so you had no choice but to use the elevator from the second floor where the restaurant, shops and entrance to mall is located. - Missed having a fridge in the room. There IS a "cooler" that looks like a mini-fridge, but it is not cold. There was a note in the room that said it would keep things cold, but wouldn't chill something not already cold. I found it kept nothing cold. Perhaps that's a cost-cutting measure for the hotel? - Restaurant was good but pricey. Really good breakfast buffet, but for a party of two adults and one child, it was a whopping $50 bucks! It should either be free or discounted if you're staying at the hotel, in my opinion. Save your money and grab something at the Starbucks if you want to eat in the hotel. -In sum, we would try something more family friendly next time.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: catsaresmarter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights attending a work conference. It is a fantastic location. Within walking distance of lots of eateries, shopping, night life. The beds are SOOOO comfortable. Great view, Great service. My only complaints are the valet parking is VERY expensive ($44/night) and they charge for internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: Ok I wouldn't say this was the best hotel I ever stayed in but it is a good place. If I had to split hair I would only say the older woman who checked us in could of been a bit friendlier. But I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a Zoo”
Reviews.Author: ElmCityTraveller_11
Reviews.Content: So we went up to Boston to see the Red Sox. We pull up at the valet, no valet parking we're told. The place was a zoo. There were hundreds of people in the lobbies both on the first and second floor. I had to walk from the other garage with my luggae, because as usual, they overbooked. The rooms have been chopped down by a third. I am so done with the Copley Marriot. I have stayed there over the years many times, but never again. Not for $329.00. Goodbye Copley marriot. Oh and the Sox lost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, OK styling, rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: bergcarrie
Reviews.Content: 4 Stars for: Fitness Facility, Location, Business Office, and lobby area. 3 Stars for the rooms. They are the old style Marriott and need updating as far as design. 2 Stars for Concierge Lounge. The staff up there was not friendly. As a frequent Marriott user, you do get used to the friendly concierge lounge staff. This is first time I did not leave a tip for them. Disappointing. Hotel staff is generally very friendly. Easy to help with luggage, hailing cabs, etc. Location is everything with this hotel. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: dseres
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great! We arrived at 11:30 a.m. on Saturday and we were able to check in right away which was nice since we took a train and wanted to put our bags away and get ready for the game at 4. The train station is really close too. The walk to Fenway was only about 15 minutes. Duck Tours are right across the street and was a lot of fun. Took a short walk to the T station for a quick ride to Fanuel Hall. The hotel is connected to the mall and there is a Shaws market right across the street too! We had the best time and can't wait to go back. The only real negative is the price to park your car but all the hotels in this area charge. Also the only free wifi is in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay at the Marriott Copley Plaza”
Reviews.Author: TrusyTravelor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property some time ago for a convention and my girlfriend and I decided to return to Boston for her birthday, so we chose the Marriott. I had mentioned to her from my previous trip that we may have to wait in line at check-in, but not so. Tanya was very helpful in assisting us upon check-in and the minute she found out the purpose of our visit, she upgraded us to a corner king on the 27th floor overlooking the river which was a great room!!! She didn't have to do that but that added touch made our day. Once we actually entered our room a nice fruit platter and champagne arrived at our door!! Thanks again Tanya. The room was very clean and the bed was wonderful? Can guest actually purchase these beds? The sour spot of our stay was when we went to the concierge desk and requested assistance in storing some bags. He pointed over to the bellstand and that was the end of that.... I actually had other questions that I would have liked for him to entertain, but after that, I chose not to bother him... The bellcaptain Ron was not only able to multi-task in storing our luggage but he gave us excellent recommendations for sea food and other tourist attractions and even offered to make the reservations for us!! Another staff member who made our day! Thanks Ron! Last time I was at the copley I ate off property but this time we had breakfast every mornings in the Champions restaurant, and it was quite good. They have a large breakfast buffet and a-la-carte offerings as well. Overall a very pleasant stay and we look forward to returning. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveler231232
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. And it is convenient to everything is Boston. The rooms live up to the Marriott standard and the views are amazing on the higher floors of the hotel. We were on the 26th floor. The only reason we didn't give them 5 stars was the parking. You have to park in the Copley parking garage that is attached to the hotel that is also for the huge mall thing. It was definitely confusing and the doorman didn't give us a lot of explanation of the best place to park when we pulled in. It is also $35 per 24 Hr period which is to be expected in the city. It is only about a mile walk to Fenway. We walked it and it is a super easy walk and everyone has to walk a good ways to the game.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: beachtravelerrrr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an extended weekend and enjoyed being near the Copley mall and centrally located in the city. The rooms were nice and we were taken care of on the concierge floor. Parking is expensive but hard to find elsewhere near the hotel. Walking through the mall at night while the stores are closed is calming and relaxing. The hotel has a pretty nice bar in the lobby where they have lots of sporting events. Would recommend it if you want to be in this area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bewhirly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights while on holidays with my girlfriend. It is a well appointed hotel in a great location near Back Bay. Itâ€™s very easy to get your way around Boston from here either walking, taking the subway (with a stop only a short walk away) or getting a Duck Tour from across the road. There isnâ€™t much more to say really, itâ€™s a pretty standard hotel with professional staff that will ensure that your stay in Boston is enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: redheadMA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights for work. Beds were comfortable and my room was super clean. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and kept my room sparkling clean. The water pressure wasn't great, and the water quality made my hair dull. Freebies in the bathroom were great. I loved the lotion. If you ate not a gold club member they do charge $12.95 a day for Internet. Rooms aren't cheap, discounted rates was $229 plus tax. Request a room on a high floor. There are sine good views. Concierge desk left much to be desired. visited it three times and got lousy advice from two concierges that seemed bothered I was asking. The third time I needed to buy a stamp and the act of making change perplexed this woman. She short changed me by 16 cents but I was in too much of a hurry to even argue with her. The concierge desk was very disappointing and actually the front desk interactions were not great. So in short, good rooms with comfy beds in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: Eebs
Reviews.Content: I had to make a last minute trip to Boston and got a fantastic rate through Priceline. The room was beautiful, with a lovely view of the harbor and river. The staff could not have been more helpful and cordial. If you need a later checkout, just ask. The location is great, for shopping and sightseeing, within a fifteen minute walk of the historic South End, and many fine restaurants. (Make reservations, even on a weeknight!) I didn't have time to use any of the gym facilities or try the restaurants in the hotel. Make sure to chat with Tony, who is the day valet parking director. He will tell you just where to go, and make you feel welcome. (The $44 for 24 hour parking is a good deal in Boston, where there is NOWHERE to park.)

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Copley”
Reviews.Author: Plant2
Reviews.Content: Boston Marriott Copley is an excellent hotel in the Back Bay. Hotel staff were attentive and pleasant. Room was large and beautifully furnished view were of historic Back Bay and Copley Square and with an high price mall with Ferragamo Cristian Dior shopping boutiques. Champions a great sports bar and lounge with at least 40 TVs and the ultimate 200" HD projection screen a superior place for sports viewing with friends or family

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Amigo7
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline and paid $160 for a standard King room. The room was clean and more than suitable for what we needed. No in room safe or mini fridge. The staff was really friendly and the concierge was knowledgeable and always willing to help. Not a super-fancy place, but nice for the average person that appreciates location and a clean safe place to stay. If this is your first time to Boston and are concerned about location - you can't go wrong with this choice. If you don't mind walking, everything is close enough - even Fenway Park. Both the Orange and Green line subway stations are really close too (less than 5 mins) and are very easy to use. The location is safe and we had no problems whatsoever, even when we walked back to the hotel from Faneuil Hall at 1:00am on a Friday night. This was our first time to Boston and having this location was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a night away in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Nanandwill
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my boyfriend. As a Gold Marriots Reward member I was upgraded to a suite. When I asked about the concierge level the front desk employee told me it was closed on weekends and gave me two $10 gift cards to the Starbucks in the lobby. The bed was very comfortable which is important to me. Great location if you are visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but NO wireless internet available in hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: MSplit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a business conference, so was very frustrated that no wireless internet was available in the rooms. Wireless internet is available on the first and second floor common areas of the hotel, but you get kicked out at 2am. Internet can be purchased in your room, via an Ethernet cable, but only one laptop can be hooked up at a time. But rather annoying to have to pay for the internet on top of the expensive hotel rates. Otherwise, decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen H
Reviews.Content: Special Thanks to Nick for providing exceptional customer service for our little celebration gathering on Sunday, September 4th.
