With no notice, Nick provided our group with some special ad hoc room service.....sooo nice with a little extra special touches. Thank you Nick for helping to make our stay at the Marriott Copley Place special!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. That's about it”
Reviews.Author: awmlasasso
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after being recommended it for its location. It IS in a great location but for the money there are a lot of other hotels in the area. The room was an average marriot room. It was quiet and clean and perfectlty...average. I wouldn't go back for one reason alone. The hotel desperately needs more elevators. Each time we knew we had to go for an elevator we knew we would be waiting. My guest even had to use a bathroom in the starbucks bc the elevator took so long...and when he came back....I was still waiting for the same elevator. Do your research and stay in a hotel in the same area but not here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: anniversaryinfl
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great hotel and very convenient to everthing. We had a baseball special package that included tickets to a Red Sox game. If you are going to have a special like this you should not provide god-awful seats like we got, I would have paid more for 'average' seats. Also, for what we paid for a room and $40 dollars a night to park our car I would surely think you could get wifi in our room, most lesser hotels provide this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: bude
Reviews.Content: We received the deal through priceline for $135, very excited about that! The location is awesome especially for a family with three girls and my husband simply wanted to be near Fenway. We ate at Champions bar and had a great meal at an affordable price, without a wait. They didn't even bat an eye when I paid with a debit card, check in was ridiculously fast and we ended up on the 25th floor with a city view. The rooms were not as large as some we have had in the Boston area and a little dated but they were in great condition and exceptionally clean. Which is all we needed. Our youngest enjoyed the pool. Boston is a great walking city, with excellent shopping. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “DECENT HOTEL IN AN UNFRIENDLY CITY”
Reviews.Author: OULUVINCHICK
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying although I am a born & bred Okie....I have been a Red Sox fan my whole life. So, I always wanted to go to Fenway for a Red Sox/Yankees game. At 47, my husband finally made that dream come true. Glad I went, but will never go back. This hotel was o.k., but NOT as great as the price shows they are. We have traveled a LOT in our marriage & Boston has to be the most rude people we have ever met. We got royally screwed right off the bat by a cabbie. He made us pay more than what the meter showed....has anyone ever heard of that?? The only folks more rude than Boston people were the Yankee fans that were there. I am so glad I got to live out my dream...glad I got to see the Green Monster....glad I got to chant "Yankees Suck" while wearing my Ellsbury jersey in Fenway Park. But, sometimes things are better as a fantasy than a reality. Wish I would have realized that about Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Quick family stay over holiday!”
Reviews.Author: I_love_trips
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on the back end of an east coast trip to experience Boston with the kids over 4th of July. This hotel was busy! We were able to check-in early, which was nice. Rooms were smallish, but didn't spend much time there. Staff was very helpful...a trainee was checking us in and seemed bit confused, but then someone came over to help her and all was good. Right across street from Duck Tour check-in, which we had reservations for. Shopping/restaurants in both Copley Place and Prudential was steps away and convenient with the kids. Loved the Vineyard Vines store there too! Concierge was helpful and recommended a good spot for fireworks viewing so we didn't have to sit all day on our blanket! Gave us good directions to walk to Fenway too. Parking was expensive, but expected. Next time, we'll plan to return car to airport after check-in and take short T ride back. Overall another nice Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dell08
Reviews.Content: The taxi from the airport was around $35 and well worth the money as our flight landed around 9pm and we didn't care to use the metro at that time in the evening. Check in was very quick, but the receptionist could have been a bit more friendly. Our 2 queen bed room was clean and to the typical Marriott standards, although it was getting close to requiring a make over. We thought the fridge in the room was a great addition but we were very disappointed when we found that it wasn't connected - why? Our room was on the 21st floor with great views over Charles River. It is a very large hotel and some other reviewers mentioned that the lifts are slow. We didn't particularly find them slow; it was just the number of people trying to use them. When the lift door opened whoever was standing closest got in first, and if you were the furthest away, even though you where there first, you would lose out. We found this a bit rude, but nearly everyone did it. We did not use the sports bar or the restaurant but both appeared very welcoming and well used. We used the Starbucks on the first floor a few times for breakfast and it had everything you would normally expect from this franchise. The hotel is well located close to Copley square and the metro. The hotel is also connected to two shopping malls, which would be very useful in poor weather. Newbury Street is around 2 blocks away and there are a lot of shops and restaurants in close proximity. The Duck Tour terminus is across the road from the hotel and other tour companies have stops very close to the hotel. We used the Super Duck tours, which consisted of a 2 day hop on, hop off bus tour and a one off boat tour. This was very enjoyable and a good way to see around Boston and hear about the history from the knowledgeable drivers who doubled up as tour guides. We would certainly use this hotel again, but would also investigate hotels around the Quincy Market area as it appeared to be a good place to eat in the evenings and people watch whist being entertained with the many street acts.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it and can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: kristacarol
Reviews.Content: We had the best time ever in Boston. This hotel was right in the center of everything. The rooms were nice and clean. It's worth the price because the continental breakfast was really good. They had everything,waffles,eggs made your way,french toast,oat meal, bagels, pastries. Everything. It seemed as if every thing we wanted to do and see was about a 20 minute walk. The T was fairly easy to figure out, thanks to so many Boston folks who were more than willing to help. Everyone should visit Boston! I loved it so much, I wish I lived there!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: QcAlber
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean and spacious. Concierges are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Bed way too soft.”
Reviews.Author: LisaaVA
Reviews.Content: The beds and pillows were too soft. I suffer with lower back discomfort and this bed made me very stiff. I could barely stand up in the mornings. If you have back problems, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Reeisabel
Reviews.Content: We decided to celebrate our 5th anniversary in Boston. Friends recommended we stay at this Marriott. It was indeed in an ideal location, walking distance from many tourist spots as well as close to the train station. The hotel was very clean and the service was execellent. We asked for an upgrade to a city view room and were accomodated to one. Our standard room was comfortable, a bit on the small side but expected in a city room. The bathroom was small, but clean as well. The bed was a bit soft for our preference and so were the pillows. The breakfast buffet was reasonably priced and delicious. Again, the service was excellent. We would stay again and definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Big Corporate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: A very friendly bellman greeted our shuttle from the airport for a nice welcome to the hotel. Front desk service was fine - cordial and efficient. On the day I checked in there was a cloying, sweet smell in the hallway to my room, like spray deodorizer or something... but no odor in the room. Nice view from my room on the fifteenth floor. Sleeping room was nicely furnished with a large flat screen TV, comfortable arm chair and hassock, a desk and chair, and a king size bed. No complaints - pretty much generic Marriott decor. Some problems with the HVAC were addressed quickly and effectively by a hotel engineer. Not enough electrical outlets (or not accessible enough), like for the iron. Room service for dinner was good - Boston baked schrod and Boston cream pie for dessert. This is a big, high volume, corporate hotel... always busy, but always able to handle the business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , heart of boston ...”
Reviews.Author: Global2011
Reviews.Content: Amazing location ...clean rooms , close to the train station and connected to prudential building thru a sky bridge . We dids not have any meals in the hotel so cannot comment on food . We visited the harbor area thru train which was very short ride . Theatre district is nearby and lot of nice touristy stuff around . Indoor Pool was nice and small ...my kids had a great time . They have starbucks on site so you don't have to go far for your morning coffee . I would recommend a stay here definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, Best beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: sweetz_21_83
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. Perfect location, nice staff, clean modern rooms. The beds and bedding were phenomenal. Concierge staff recommended great restaurants. It's a bit pricey, but everything in Boston is. Got a great deal through Priceline name your own price. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but what's with no wifi in rooms”
Reviews.Author: TOfamily269
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree with a lot of the other reviews, that this is a good hotel with a good location. Being close to transit , shopping and a grocery store are all very handy. I found the room to be quite small, but not at all in need of updating. I found the house keeping staff to be very good. The pool is good for a city hotel, and although we didn't use it ,the fitness centre looked large and well equiped.

Reviews.Title: “Great stock standard Marriott- NO WIFI IN ROOMS!”
Reviews.Author: JW75_11
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay, hotel covered all bases except the Wifi issue. They have free wifi on the first and second floors but that didn't suit my needs as i needed to work. paid about $12 to get internet in my room which i thought was abit steep, oh and worth mentioning (....seems to be the norm in Boston hotels... but worth mentioning) parking I paid $35per 24hrs (not the valet service that was more I believe) Just something to remember when working out cost of hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: luxk69
Reviews.Content: Excellent location as reviewed previously but expensive. Even parking at 44$/day was overpriced. As parking downtown is only available in public parking lots, recommend walking and leave your car at public parking next to hotel at 36$. Food available in 2 adjoing malls. Rooms are nice but a bit old fashioned, need remodeling, especially concierge lounge.Recommend for location if you can get a good deal on room rate.

Reviews.Title: “First-rate in every particular”
Reviews.Author: Kyhistorian
Reviews.Content: My son, a college senior, and I have just returned from Boston. We used Priceline, specifying "Back Bay/Copley Square" and were fortunate to be assigned to the Marriott. Our stay there could not have been better. The hotel is a modern high rise that is connected by skywalk to the Prudential Tower shops and the Prudential stop on the T subway system. The area is absolutely safe and comforting for out-of-towners (like us) unfamiliar with the city. Directly across from the hotel is the embarkation point for the Duck Tours, which every tourist will want to do. There are excellent restaurants (including Legal Sea Food) in the Prudential shops and within walking distance. Taxis are always available right at the door. On the hotel's second floor there is a bustling convenience store and Starbucks. When you check in, ask the clerk for a room that overlooks the Charles River. We had excellent views of the sailboats on the Charles as well as MIT. We stayed five nights and felt we needed at least three more to do justice to the city. When we return, it will definitely be to the Marriott Copley Place.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but somewhat overpriced”
Reviews.Author: BandBtraveller
Reviews.Content: Just across the street from the Amtrak Station, the Marriott Copley Place in Back Bay is an ideal location for business travellers. The hotel is within steps to the Copley Place mall with shops and a supermarket. It was quite an enjoyable walk to the Copley Square and the bustling Boyston Street lined up with restaurants in the evening. Room was clean with comfortable bed but the decor was a bit old fashioned. Tried to book the hotel for other times but price had gone up considerably. Can get better deals at the Fairmont Copley or other brands in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, awesome view”
Reviews.Author: mssha44
Reviews.Content: Nice room, stayed on the 25th floor and the view was amazing. Beds comfty, and had a fridge, safe, and coffee maker. The pool and jacuzzi were a treat. The old town trolley stop is right in front of hotel, which is convenient. Nice location if you like to shop otherwise a little out of the way for historical spots and waterfront. The t station is a block away so not such a problem. Definitely enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place and location for a family trip!”
Reviews.Author: MontrealDave
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Boston, this place is ideal for families and couples. I've never been to Boston for leisure so this was our first trip. The location of the hotel is amazing. Centrally located in Copley square with walking access to almost everything! The hotel is very clean, quiet (on the floors) and very secure. If you park there, there's a $44 daily parking charge with in/out privilege which is very useful. The lot is in the hotel and totally secure. I forgot something in the car and the attendant wouldn't let me go get it, he brought me the car. There is security everywhere, a guy carrying a case of beer through the lobby was stopped and routed elsewhere. My son left the iPAD on the bed (instead of the safe), and was still there when we got back. The rooms are clean and quiet. Tip the help, they work hard to make your stay enjoyable. The gym and pool are first rate. Location, across from Copley/Prudential mall. You can walk across the skybridge to the mall, there is a good foodcourt + Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen and a huge Shaws supermarket so if you want to pick up some food and not spend on restaurants all the time, it's right across the street. Across the street is the Duck tours stop, a must if you want to see Boston, Newbury, Boylston streets for shopping and eating and close to Boston Common. This was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: Proflyn
Reviews.Content: Very impressed ... Quick check in ... Polite employees ... Nice facilities ... Attached to Copley Mall ... Good fitness center with plenty of cardiovascular, pool, jacuzzi. Comfy beds ... Roll away for 3yr old son came right away. Coffee maker and fridge in Rm. Very easy for family travel ... Can catch duck boats right outside, sky observatory in mall (great views of city) and Top of the Hub Restaurant (also in mall) excellent food & service with great view. Only bummer ... No shuttle to airport. Overall great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: swiftfireman
Reviews.Content: Relatively clean chain hotel walking distance from Fenway park. It's in need of updating and remolding in the hallways and some rooms, though most of the facilities seemed updated and clean. Service was avg with nothing standing out. A bit pricey due to the location near decent chain restaurants and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely hated it”
Reviews.Author: Douglas M
Reviews.Content: We payed $400.00 a night for what they called the deluxe suite. It consisted of two full beds and a bath room. The beds were extremely soft and our backs were in pain every morning. The coffee maker did not work and if it had it would only make one cup. The satelite TV would lock up several times as you were watching a program. The refrigerator/cooler was only a place to store your drinks and you add ice to keep it cold. You could rent movies from the tv which stated movies from 3.95 and up. My wife and I never found one less then 13.99. Had a air in the food from the hotel restaurant. Definitely a place I would not reccommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Center of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Leawooddoc
Reviews.Content: Great location for a premier property. We had a king room on the concierge floor which had breathtaking views of the city and Charles River. Most importantly, the room was secure and very quiet. There was terrific shopping as the hotel is at the junction of two excellent malls. The more unique Newberry Street shopping was also very close by. There was an excellent buffet breakfast served on the second floor of the hotel. The best of Boston dining was within walking distance. The lobby was very Euro modern and the staff very welcoming. i would and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Is location more important than quality or value?”
Reviews.Author: DeansDesk
Reviews.Content: Hard not to like a hotel connected to not one, but two high-end malls with luxury shops, upscale dinning and an easy foot commute to the beautiful Back Bay of Boston. Of course, if room quality or bang-for-your-buck matters then location isn't about to fix any of that now is it? I like the open atrium feel to the lobby and mezzanine level bar/lounge (Champions Sports). Nice feel to it, modern setting that blends the best of a sports bar (TV's, sight-lines, comfort food etc.) without the closed in, loud, man-cave feel of many such places. Service was good, food was below average, drinks were above average. Starbucks is also attached, which works out well too. Pretty impressive look and feel to this area of the hotel. Unfortunately........ Rooms are smallish, bathrooms dangerously so. If I had three legs I could have put one each in the sink, toilet and tub/shower at the same time without pulling a hamstring. Bed was comfortable, TV modern, desk area workable. Like many, I was turned off by the lack of wireless internet in the room and the gross daily charge to be connected by a cable. Bush League. The half-moon shaped landing area's of each floor may look cool but they present a challenge for elevator use; six elevators in two groups of three that are a good 20-25 feet away from each other. You need to hit the button and guess which bank will provide your lift. If you guess wrong you need to hustle over to the opposing set of elevators and hope you make it before the door closes. Easy for young folks, tougher for seniors. If you are staying in this area, I wool choose any number of alternative property's. Taj would be my #1 choice. If you are a Marriott person and/or need malls attached you could do a lot worse than this location.

Reviews.Title: “Updated decor, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CherylGLBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at few years ago and although the location was great, it seemed worn out and in need of an upgrade. For that reason, we stayed in alternative hotels when in Boston. We were attending a wedding nearby and, because we had Marriott points, decided to chance it. I'm glad we did. The staff was warm and friendly; the lobby nicely decorated. Our room was lush: comfortable bedding, very roomy, and overlooking the Charles River as a bonus! We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bebmay
Reviews.Content: Great location & close to everything. High prices for parking your car, so take a cab or the T if you can. Also, be sure to drop bags OFF when arriving...or else you will park the car and have to stroll luggage throught the mall. We enjoyed, would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location, great lobby”
Reviews.Author: luf2travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property with my husband, the trip was part business and part fun. The hotel lobby is very nice, most likely new. The hotel is open on the 2nd floor to a shopping mall and via skywalk to another mall and then the Hynes Convention Center (if you are staying @ the Marriott for a convention and need to carry things from hotel to conv. center, it's a bit awkward but everyday walking back and forth is fine). The location of the hotel is great because there is so much around-Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs, lots of other restaurants, plus a T stop is nearby. I only had a a couple of issues during my stay. First, two separate visits to the concierge's provided two incorrect answers-not cool when you get off @ the wrong T stop. Housekeeping missed my room one day so it wasn't cleaned when I returned but after a phone call, it was taken care of. Parking @ the hotel is crazy, $44 a day for valet. I googled around and found a garage about 1/3 of a mile away for only $19 a day, saved a lot of money. I never once needed the car while I was there so it worked out perfectly. The rooms are nice but you can tell they're ready to be renovated. The bathroom tile looked older but was still in good condition. When staying in Boston, I would definitely want to stay in this hotel again, it was in such a great location-Fenway within walking distance, perfect!

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: idoltraveller
Reviews.Content: Supreme location. I got a really good deal through a bidding site. The $7 bottles of water in the room and the annoying internet fees were a minus (also no wifi, just ethernet). Plus: Nice rooms, big beds, good pillows, clean, lobby with a lot of energy, good bar and loads of good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Boston in Grand style”
Reviews.Author: mggaro
Reviews.Content: THe Marriott Copley Place is in the perfect loction to see Boston. You can walk everywhere, including Fenway Park, Boston Common, the North End, and there are a bunch of tours that leave from this very location. Catching the subway, or the "T" from here is easy. Plus, it is attached to an indoor shopping mall! The rooms are wonderful and the food and service is great.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is ok... just ok”
Reviews.Author: JonAntony
Reviews.Content: as this was just a business trip the hotel did suffice. The decor is tired. it is very generic. on the upside it is well located

Reviews.Title: “Typical big Marriott hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nailcutter
Reviews.Content: Typical large Marriott hotel. Room average size and small bathroom which is typical for the older Marriott's. Fitness center very good with an indoor pool. Nice lobby with a Starbucks. They gave us a nice $10 voucher for Saturday breakfast as a platinum member. Buffet very good at Champions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel especially in the winter”
Reviews.Author: jeff2120
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention in January. This property connects to a mall which connects to another hotel which connects to the parking garage. So, in the winter you can park in the garage and wheel your stuff through the mall (if you are cheap like me and don't do the valet) to the Marriott. It's also a convenient way to walk a few blocks without going outside. Location is good, close to Freedom Trail and easy subway to basketball/hockey arena. Rooms are nice. I had one wall that was just a window overlooking the city - nice. Pool was excellent and workout room overlooked it. Good service at desk and good sports restaurant. Also had a good price for the convention. Only downside was elevators are slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: skilikeagirlUtah
Reviews.Content: Went with my daughter to visit some colleges and stayed at this Marriott. We took the T (subway) almost everywhere and we were able to get to all colleges very easily. The only problem with that form of transportation was it was almost always packed. The Marriott also was conveniently attached to an indoor mall with an assortment of brand name shops and food options. This also included a Starbucks located on the 2nd floor. The actual hotel was good as well. The rooms were a little dated in design and a little small but we had a fantastic view overlooking the river. We could even see the MIT dome. Finally, the service was good. The people at the front desk were informative and kind, such attributes seemed to be consistent throughout the hotel staff. Only, I never got a paper outside my door. It might have been because I booked it through getaroom.com. In summary, there was nothing special about this hotel nor can I say there was any problems with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,very nice rooms, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: cptravelmaven
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property twice. For someone that does not know Boston well, it's a great place to stay. The property is huge and Copley Place is a landmark so even if you get turned around walking, someone can always point you back in the right direction to the hotel. There are restaurants of every type within walking distance or a short cab ride. We ate both off and on-site. They actually have pretty good food on-site. If it's freezing when you visit, just go to one of the bar on site...plenty of food..yes quality food or junk food, a dozen flat screens and the most talkative, lively people ever. I loved my room, and am thankful that I was upgraded to a higher floor so I could enjoy the view. My room wasn't huge, but I had plenty of room to be comfortable. Sometimes the rooms can be VERY expensive, but it also depends on the time of year and the day of the week you're checking in. But this is a quality hotel so it many people believe paying a little extra is worth it. Attention shopaholics: While I am not crazy with spending money all the time one of the BEST things about this hotel is it's attached (via indoor catwalks) to TWO indoor malls. One is a midpriced mall the other mall is very high end. So you can catch a bargain or wield your black card with ease. Don't want to spend $$$? Use both malls to get some great walking exercise. It's air-conditioned in the hot summers and heated in the cold winters - and very safe at night. The staff were very professional, but genuinely nice. If you stop at the concierge desk and tell them what stores you plan to visit, you might luck out and get a coupon. Be sure to check out the theater district. That was a lot of fun and there are some great shows. I didn't rent a car either time. With moderate traffic it took about 20 minutes one-way. Supershuttle was cheaper than a taxi, but neither was very expensive. Of course if you are in a hurry or don't like sharing a ride either rent a car or take a taxi. I imagine though, that parking at the hotel isn't cheap. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. walk to Fenway”
Reviews.Author: JohnP23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice, celan and convenient. We walked to Fenway Park. Walked to the mall across the street and walked to the restaurnat sin the neighborhood. Loved it Ask for a water view!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent for a Full-Service Marriott”
Reviews.Author: FLJ021251
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at the Marriott Copley Place in Boston. I travel almost daily and usually spend approximately 100 nights each year (Platinum) at a Marriott property. One of the things I like best about Marriott is that it matters not if you are in Baltimore, Birmingham or Boston, there is usually consistency. I did not find the level of consistency I have come to expect at a Marriott. The Copley Marriott is very busy with a combination of vacationing families, convention attendees and business people. However, the location is excellent for shopping, sight seeing, or dinning out. The front desk and bell station seems to be poorly organized and checking into the hotel was difficult. While it was not busy, at check-in, it was understaffed leading to delays. Also, although my profile states a WSJ is the be delievered to my door, this did not happen, evern with reminders. Extra towels were not left in room as requested. At check-in I was told the club longue was closed, however it is open during the evening. Wirless InterNet is available only in lobby or 2nd floor. The staff was very helpful with information, but you have to ask for help. Parking is very expensive ($44.00 USD per day). Better to take a taxie or walk to locations. I would probably stay here again, but a few minor things needs to be improved. Boston harbor is really too far away and buildings block the view from hotel rooms for it to be appreciated. Better to ask for a high room on the river side.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: BethNJ
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is nice. We only saw the lobby and our room, but it was clean and nice. The hotel is attached to a mall, and has a walkway over to the Prudential Center (and another mall). Lots of great restaurants within a few blocks. The T stops within two blocks as well. The first thing I wasn't impressed with was that they charge $12/day to use the internet in your room - NOT WIRELESS. There is wireless internet in the lobby, thanks to Starbucks, but not nearly as convenient. Issue two - the mattresses on the beds are either never rotated or not changed out often enough. The side towards the side table had a huge dip. I kept rolling into it even when I tried to sleep where the mattress was not worn out. Issue three - the air conditioner would not stop running after the second day there. Maintenance would have fixed it but we were leaving the next morning anyway and didn't want to bother with it. Issue four - when I reported the mattresses and the air conditioning, the response I got was "Oh, sorry about that. Hope your stay is better next time." ARE YOU SERIOUS? With that kind of response, there won't be a next time! Issue five - when leaving the hotel, we clearly needed some assistance. There were no less than four people in SUITS (one I'm sure was the manager) standing right in front of us. We stopped, looked around, looked at them...no one said a word to us. Seems to me that if you have a guest looking lost or like they need help and you are just standing there not busy, you should at least ASK if they need help. Especially if they are standing right in front of you. We finally had to ask the concierge for help. Not one of the suits could be bothered to stop their personal conversations. Overall, great location and nice enough hotel. But if it were me, I'd go across the bridge to the Marriott over there (Long Wharf) - much nicer! And there the T stop is at the front of that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: benhochschwender
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel that has a mall attached to it. The mall is nice and big and has many restuarante options. The rooms are nice. The pool is also pretty large.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LuiToronto
Reviews.Content: The Boston Marriot Copley is a great hotel. The rooms were always kept very clean and are quite spacious. The staff was helpful whenever questioned. It is close to so many attractions such as the Public Library, Boston Commmon, Fenway Park, Newbury Street and amazing shopping. The subway ("T") is a 5 minute walk. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there once again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: virtue37_4
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel via Priceline for a really fantastic rate. I am a Marriott Rewards member, so I contacted the hotel before we arrived to request a room with a nice view. We had never been to Boston before, so we were looking forward to touring the city. Upon our arrival, we discovered that our requests were honored. We were upgraded to a high-floor room. The hotel lobby was clean, light, and airy. Service at the desk was great. Valya, our front desk assistant, was so kind and courteous. She was very helpful. Our room was on the 37th floor, and we had a corner room with a view of the Charles River. What a beautiful view!! The room was clean, with a comfy king-sized bed. We also had access to the concierge lounge, so we were able to enjoy free beverages and snacks. There was a mini-fridge in the room for us to keep things cold. I used the pool area, which was very clean and enjoyable. We loved the location since the Old Town Trolley had a reservations desk, and a stop, right at the hotel. If you book with them, you get a discount on Fenway Park tour tickets. Nearby, we enjoyed dinner at Atlantic Fish (which was great), and a stop for the T was a block away. I would absolutely stay here again. We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Location--Fenwaytastic”
Reviews.Author: Bakowoman
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this Marriott five times in the last two years when vacationing in the area and as a treat following our son's graduation from Officer Candidate School in Newport, R.I. It is a large property and the location is convenient for doing tourist attraction activities. In our case one of those activities always includes a trip to Fenway which is about a twenty minute pleasant walk. The rooms and amenities are consistent Marriott quality. We've developed a favorite floor (not particularly high) and general area (not exact rooms) in the hotel where we like to stay. For the most recent visit I made the request for this area for the two rooms we reserved. The request was made at the time of the reservation and then reconfirmed with the reservation reminder and concierge "special request" on line service. When we arrived we were disappointed to find that we were located in two separate areas of the hotel neither of which came close to meeting our requested general area. One room was acceptable but the other on a different floor didn't even come close to meeting our approximate location and view. I wasn't prepared to look at the top of the air conditioning/heating system on the floor below for our 4 night stay and especially at big city Marriott prices. The staff at the check in desk was helpful in making the change to a more desirable location. The lesson for me is not to expect reservation requests to be honored even at a Marriott and be prepared to check out the room and request a change if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynCarolT
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot for the heart of Boston. It is a huge hotel and I typically stay away from these properties; but I have to stay it was enjoyable. I loved that I could walk right across the skywalk to tons of shopping; and at night walk to great bars and restaurants. Great, happening bar and hopping lobby. Very friendly staff.......My only gripe is the "carpet cleaner" smell in the hallways and particularly in my room. If I had a longer stay, I would have brought it to their attention, but a little perfume did the trick.

Reviews.Title: “great service and great views"”
Reviews.Author: prs174
Reviews.Content: Busy hotel in a great location. Service was impeccable. Room was standard marriott fare, clean, functional but on the 38th floor overlooking the city and the river. fantastic! I also treated guests to a room for a night, and the marriott staff took greta care of them. For a very, very busy hotel, I thought the staff did a superb job. Very nice exercise room; good access to fenway, the "T".. all in all a great place to stay in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: momdaughtershar
Reviews.Content: This hotel has such a great location, accessible to all but not in the most touristy neighborhoods. They bend over back wards to be accomodating. The rooms are very clean, beds comfortable, and check in easy and pleasant. My 4 yr old loved the indoor pool and only wanted to return to the hotel. The concierge were helpful and gave good advice. This hotel is worth the money, and I will stay again. It was our second time.

Reviews.Title: “Would be all 5's except for internet access”
Reviews.Author: shelb724
Reviews.Content: I just stayed there because I got a great AAA rate. I usually stay in Brookline to see my daughter but this was a lot less than Courtyard there. Everything was fine except for the Internet access. I did not like being attached to the desk in the room and I sure did not like not being able to use my iPod in my room. Also it got so crowded and noisy with everyone else in the lobby and Starbucks using their laptops etc. Other than that it was really nice. Especially when I had asked for early checkin (at about 11:30 am). That was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “went to red sox game”
Reviews.Author: wheelz51
Reviews.Content: hotel was very nice ,super clean,. we have stayed here before, will stay again,

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel, Need to update internet”
Reviews.Author: nikkerrigan
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms with friendly and helpful staff. The reception area has finally undergone a makeover and they have got rid of the sports bar which was by the entrance. The only thing that this hotel needs to sort out is its in room internet. Priced at $12.95 for 24hours. The only access you have is by cable. No wireless is available in the room. It is 2011 isn't it?? I had constant problems connecting to the internet and finally had to spend an hour on the phone with the technical team. I was pleased to see the charge removed my bill by the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Sad property for Marriott brand”
Reviews.Author: TeresaB25
Reviews.Content: I typically select Marriott for the great predictable offerings. This is an aging property so that could explain the lack of WiFi above the first few floors and the painfully slow elevators to the concierge level on 28. That does not explain the sloppy housekeeping service in our room or the indifferent concierge. My colleague tried to get assistance with dinner reservations and was offered PF Chang or Cheesecake Factory rather dismissively when she asked for seafood suggestions. When I asked for directions to the Museum of Fine Arts, he waved in the general direction without looking up and mumbled "more than six blocks, less than ten" in response to my inquiry as to how far it would be to walk. Hardly a friendly welcome. Nice wine for a fee, weak snacks, but great breakfast in concierge level gathering area. Next time I must attend a meeting at this hotel, I will stay next door at The Colonnade. Too many nice spots in Boston to spend this much money here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: mike39517
Reviews.Content: Heart of Downtown and close to everything, good food close and just a small ride to see the Red Sox

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: vg411973
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in town to see a Patriot's game. This hotel is the absolute best location in Boston, adjacent to the train station (perfect if you are arriving by Amtrak, which we did). The hotel is also adjacent to the train station where you head out to Gillette Field. The hotel is large and connected to a mall, which is convenient and also gives you a good amount of restaurant options without having to actually go outside. The guestrooms are fine, nothing special but clean and decent size. The hotel lobby bar itself was great, a sports atmosphere with tons of large screen televisions. I would definitely stay here again, especially if going to a sporting event.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Fantase62
Reviews.Content: My two teenage boys and my husband recently stayed here for two nights with rooms reserved on Priceline. The price we paid was great, but if I had paid full price I would have been very dissatisfied. The rooms were a bit dated and the bathroom extremely small. The plumbing in my boys' room was not working too well. The bath amenities were very nice. I wonder if it was because we reserved through Priceline that the room was not as nice. Our mattress seemed a bit "tilted" and was a bit uncomfortable. The workout room was expanded since the last time we had been there. Very clean and lots of machines to choose from. The concierge was very helpful with a breakfast suggestion. As most mention, the location is perfect. You can walk around the mall, catch the T or get to where you need to go pretty easily.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Ashley Z
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Copley Place was the perfect hotel for our first vacation to Boston. It is close to both the green line and the orange line on the T (subway system) and we were able to walk right to Fenway Park. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable. We also utilized the Concierge Desk several times and they were very helpful with giving directions! Even in the mayhem of the Bruins Parade, the Marriott maintained great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellotcities
Reviews.Content: Clean, Perfect Location, Friendly Staff. Got a corner room , wierd shape but a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: PaulEBNJ
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a conference. The rooms are great and up to date. They seem larger than the regular Marriott hotels. The staff here is very friendly and willing to help. They make you feel like a welcome guest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: neffair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott for my college reunion. The staff were efficient, friendly and accommodating. Our room was spotless and quiet, and we had a view of Boston Harbor. It was a 20-minute walk (or less) to many of our reunion events. All in all, an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “The second time around wasn't as great...”
Reviews.Author: architecta
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Copley Place is an average hotel, our first time staying there in 2010 we managed to finagle a concierge level room on valentine's day weekend and had an enormous king corner room with some fabulous views and concierge wine/snack access. This trip we got neither. Booked a king room and wanted the same as before (concierge level, etc) but were informed that it was closed during the weekend (what?? Isn't that a huge PLUS? I mean we were willing to pay more...). Our room was on a lower floor and they had nothing to upgrade us too (oh well) and it was actually quite small, especially the bathroom. The bonus is that the bed is really comfortable and since it's was incredibly (INCREDIBLY) windy outside and cold that weekend we were able to use the elevated walkway to go directly to Copley Plaza if desired. I don't want to say I will or will not stay there again, I think i'll just shop around a bit more next time. And Marriott, please consider having concierge level perks open on the weekends!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, not sure why there are bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: ticket14
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Marriott properties. They are my first choice. We had a great stay here. We had a regual room on the 31st floor. Waited a few minutes for an elevator, but did not experience any long waits. No waits to check in either. Bar was great, ate most of our meals there. Staff was great throughout. While the room could use an update, there was nothing wrong with it. We paid $335 a night via marriott.com. We were there to see the Cubs at Fenway, plus Harvard and MIT were graduating. So I didn't think the room rate was unreasonable. I do think that would have been high for an average night. Do not be scared to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location predictable experience”
Reviews.Author: 2Dine4
Reviews.Content: The best feature of the Marriott is it's central location close to high end shopping, Fenway Park, and other attractions. So much is within just a short walk and elevated covered walkways connect the hotel to nearby buildings. The rooms are small by Marriott standards, the bathrooms dated but accommodations are functional. Service is friendly, especially doorman, valet parking attendants. This is a large convention and meeting hotel so common areas can feel rather impersonal and busy. We found the casual restaurant acceptable. If you are accustomed to similar menus at many Marriotts, the offerings at this location differ slightly. For lodging a serviceable location, not a destination hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great view, good service”
Reviews.Author: mlnjordan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copley in adjoining rooms with our four teens - we had a wedding to go to and they were not invited, but we felt comfortable with them shopping and dining at the attached mall while we were out. The rooms were nice and the view was fantastic. The kids got ice cream from room service and the service was prompt and the portions were huge. We had a great time at the indoor pool, too. We're going back in June.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: CHB13
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at the Copley Marriott. Easy walk to the theater district. Connected to Copley Square Mall. Lots of area restaurants. Beautiful view of the Charles River/Cambridge/Prudential building from 25th floor. Great buffet breakfast included in room rate. Very comfortable bed which offered a great night's sleep. Only drawback, I was stuck in elevator #1, but hopefully that is fixed now.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: kdchoonoo
Reviews.Content: After staying at another hotel the first 3 nights of our trip and having terrible housekeeping, this hotel was terrific. Housekeeping was wonderful about leaving enough wash clothes. We had an excellent view from the 26th Fl overlooking the river. Not crazy about the restaurants close by but it's easy enough to hop on the T and get to a nice pub. Just a short walk from the hotel and you can visit the Boston Publice Library, take a walk in Copley Square or just a bit farther and you can find yourself in the Beacon Hill area and the Boston Public Gardens. Concierge was always friendly and helpful with recommendations or directions. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Tiny Bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Shelbs97
Reviews.Content: This is actually the second time I've stayed here, this time was for my bachelorette party. The Marriott most definitely has VERY comfortable beds and pillows, so I was happy when we pulled up in front of it (I didn't know where we were going.) The rooms are nice, although smaller than an average hotel room. One of our rooms (we had 2 adjoining) smelled like it used to be a smoking room, it definitely didn't smell nice. The bathrooms are VERY SMALL and VERY outdated : ( It took forever to check in. There was no line and it still probably took a good 15 minutes to get our rooms assigned. I love that there's a sports bar, a Starbucks and that the hotel is directly connected to the Prudential. It's in a great location. If it wasn't for the small bathrooms, this place would be the perfect place to stay in Boston. They were very nice to let us check out at 1pm instead of noon, so we could go grab lunch before dragging our things back to the cars. Valet service was prompt on a Sunday at 1pm as well.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: notravelsurprises
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a meeting, which was held at the Sheraton, which is connected by a skybridge and a mall. Staff by phoneand in person were unusually friendly and helpful. I contacted the hotel directly to negotiate a rate that was acceptable to the bean-counters at my company because I wanted to avoid the Sheraton, which had bedbugs last month, according to several reports on the Internet. Room had a wonderful view of the city. Beds were very comfortable. Hotel adjoins a mall with lots of shops and restaurants.Everything in room was in working order and was clean. Besides the adjoining mall, lots of restaurants and shops within an easy walk, including Filene's Basement and Marshalls. Plenty of stuff to do here, but the room was quiet. Ask for a high floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, gret location, BUT outdated.”
Reviews.Author: blondy3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while attending a conference. You cannot beat the location. It's perfect & close to the T (subway system), restaurants, shopping & some historic sites. From the 2nd floor of the hotel you can connect to 2 different shopping malls. We ladies there for the conference especially liked that. The whole hotel was very clean & the service while checking in was exceptional. However, I must agree that the rooms are very outdated & smaller than I expected. The A/C worked great & everything again was very very clean. The beds were pretty comfortable too. If they would spruce up the room furnishings & make it more modern except of 1990s, the hotel would be perfect. The lobby & other areas of the hotel were very modern. Only the guest rooms were outdated. I would still recommend this hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “How this hotel justifies its rates beats me”
Reviews.Author: VisaCollector
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel, but definitely not worth what they charge for the room, even at a discount the rate was much higher than what I'd expect to pay for this kind of room and service. The standard price of $320 is about $120 too high. The quality of the rooms really doesn't stand out over much cheaper hotels and actually some aspects of the room such as curtains that fully close would be available in most budget hotels, but not here. On top of that they charge extra for basic services like in-room internet. At these rates I would expect it to be free. There is free internet in the lobby, but it is nice to read your e-mail in the privacy of your room rather than in a public spot. Dining options in the hotel are limited and actually quite poor, luckily there are plenty of better restaurants close by. The location is pretty good and the staff are friendly and helpful, but that doesn't justify the rates they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Out of date”
Reviews.Author: Swl781
Reviews.Content: Only Internet connection in rooms is Ethernet wired connections, no cables provided. Can't use my wifi iPad except in the lobby. They do have a large lounge, which they cleared out at 3:00 to set up dinner service. TV has very few HD channels. Rooms are fine, location is great, but I could pay $150 less and get wifi and breakfast. Marriott should be ashamed of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and unpersonal”
Reviews.Author: Flobar71
Reviews.Content: Very well located. Rooms are big but cold. Beds are ok. The bathroom in my room was old and needed some refurbishing. Nice staff at the breakfast. A very big hotel with nice facilities but a product of mass consumption

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, dated hotel with lackluster service”
Reviews.Author: CDNTravellerGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is straight out of the 70's. Rooms are dusty, decor is old, yet prices remain high. As a frequent business traveler who stays in many hotels, this hotel was unimpressive. Worse is the service provided to platinum/status members of their frequent stay program. I asked for one hour extension on check-out on a Friday and was told to call back the next day. In fact, they told me to assume that I couldn't. Definitely do NOT stay here. Do yourself a favor and stay at a Starwood property--the W, the Westin, etc. They are a brand/chain who know how to treat customers.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: sway76
Reviews.Content: My friends and I only stayed for one weekend night for an evening out on the town but our stay was a pleasant one and we will definitely find ourselves back here again in the future. We requested a room on a high floor, preferably with larger square footage, and were given the handicapped accessible room on the top floor. We were also informed up-front that the room does not have a tub but that was an acceptable trade-off for us. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the room smelled fresh. The decor was nothing memorable but seeing as to how we weren't there to sit in our hotel room, it wasn't really an issue. Hotel management here is above average. We had to change rooms after finding out that a water main leak had affected the entire floor (water was coming out brown from the sink and shower) and they gave us an identical room a few floors down along with compensatory gift vouchers for the buffet breakfast the next morning, which was excellent. The gym/pool on the 5th floor was an added bonus. The fitness equipment was new and well maintained with every cardio machine equipped with its own personal tv monitor (you can obtain a complimentary headset from the onsite attendant). The pool is comparatively small and overrun with children (maybe this was a weekend thing) but the whirlpool was nice and large. Location-wise, you can't beat this hotel. It is connected to the Prudential Center and Copley Square (shopping & eating to your heart's content) and only a few blocks away from Newbury Street. It's also about a 1 mile walk to Fenway Park ($6 cab ride) and the surrounding Boston area bar/club scene. Parking tip: Parking overnight at the Marriott will run you $44 but if you park at the Prudential Center next door and print out the parking coupon from their website, it will only cost you $25 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was staying in 1998”
Reviews.Author: cotejeffrey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. The lobby is loud. It stunk like beer because of the sports bar attached to it. I can't even believe that there isn't wireless internet. I have a MacBook Air, so I couldn't plug it into the antiquated modem they had set up. There are no blackout curtains in the room, so I was up promptly at 7 this morning. The elevators took forever, and if you were going down you had to stop at least 3-4 times to pick up more people. I haven't stayed at a Marriott in years, and I won't be staying at another one any time soon. What a horrible experience. The room was clean. That was about the only thing I was pleased with.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SBKM
Reviews.Content: I guess I just expected a lot more from a Marriott. No complimentary breakfast. No wifi (seriously, what is up with that, it is 2010). There was a coffee maker in our room, but it was missing the cup that you put the coffee pod in. We left a note for the cleaning service that we needed another coffee pot, but they didn't replace it. Beds were uncomfortable. The room was clean, and we never had a problem with noise, but that was about the only good thing. Also, the location was very convenient for us.

Reviews.Title: “A standard Marriot, well-run”
Reviews.Author: Georgemia
Reviews.Content: Property is in good shape, well-kept. Great elevators! No kidding, fast, minimal time wasted waiting. Breakfast served in dark, awkward rooms used as a "sports bar" at night. As the sports channels have nothing to do all morning, informercials for penis enlargement pills were displayed to all, fortunately, in Spanish. The terrace on the same landing would be much more pleasant. Quiet hotel, and connection to the mall by aerial passage kept me out of the freezing weather.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice, but Expected a Little Bit More”
Reviews.Author: mainelydmj
Reviews.Content: We were a large party, 4 older teenagers, 2 young children between age 8-11, 4 adults (3 were women). We had a 2 room suite and adjoining 2 bed room (this room was handicapped with no tub). Positives: *Comfortable beds! *Staff very receptive and accommodating to requests, from extra towels, linens and just trying to figure out how to get to where we needed to go. Even the staff handling our bags were fabulous. *Concierge level amazing with offerings. *Connected to the Prudential and over 300 shops. *Valet parking. *Amazing view of the Charles River and Hancock Building. *I will certainly stay here again. *Lots of closet space. *T to Prudentail vs Copley stop so you can stay inside vs walking outside. Neutrals: *Small bathrooms with sink in the bathroom. Though functional, despite several women and girls having to get ready at the same time. *First fridge smelled like sour milk and made all our snacks and beverage smell. Though a replacement was obtained quickly. *Housekeeping overly wanting to get into our room. We put up the do not disturb sign our second night. *No table and chairs in living room area. Negatives: *Valet parking cost $44 a night. *Torn wallpaper in adjoining room bathroom. *Not warned about handicapped room. *Biggest pet peave - hallway filled with dishes, etc throughout each day of our stay (3 days). These were not picked up until later in the night, I would say after eight pm. I think this should have been monitored better. One night it was an awful site to see the number of dishes in the hallway, especially when our breakfast dishes were in the hallway later in the evening. *The pool looks like it's picture on the Marriott website, except the view is not the same as the picture - they must have photoshopped the buildings. The picture view from the pool was an exciting one for us, but the reality was nothing like the picture on the website - I think this was very deceiving by Marriott. The view from the 32nd floor was amazing and worth staying in our room for and having a few drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a shopping mall”
Reviews.Author: Medstrike
Reviews.Content: If you want the feel of staying in a shopping mall, this is the place for you "Just OK" was used in an earlier review and that was our reaction after two nights here over President's Day Weekend. Not bad but not as nice as other Marriott's in which we have stayed. Location is great - nice walk over Newbury Street to the Commons, close to three T stops. The staff was helpful and pleasant. Room was small but had a nice view of the Charles River. BUT - having a drink at the bar is hardly relaxing when you are among crowds of shoppers coming through from adjacent Copley Place and there are uniformed security gaurds patrolling the area. It was like having a drink in the atrium of a large mall. If you want coffee and the Starbucks on the 2nd floor is not open, you're out of luck - no coffeemakers in the room or the lobby. And while the room rate was good, some of the prices were outrageous, such as $44 per night for valet parking and the cost of breakfast. With tax/tip included the basic "healthy start" breakfast of juice, coffee and cereal would have cost almost what we paid for two full-sized breakfasts at a nearby insitution, Charlie's, on Columbus Avenue. There was a charge to use the computers - a service that budget chains usually provide free. The hotel gift shop - which sells the local paper - was not open when it was supposed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: suresh_2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a prime location in Boston - Copley Place, and has indoor connections to the Copley Place Mall and the adjoining T station. The staff are very courteous and helpful. Couple of negatives - depending on the season and offers, the rates are sometimes too high. Also, for a hotel of this calibre, they could offer free internet and complimentary breakfast, but they dont. Apart from these, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Million dollar renovations means smaller rooms.”
Reviews.Author: elmcitytraveller
Reviews.Content: Look its the Copley Marriot. It's gorgeous, it's in a prime location, it has a high end mall attached to it, what's not to love? Well, the rooms have been chopped down after renovations. I get it, more rooms, more guests, more revenue. No pool, ok. But really, did you have to take away the robes? I love the robes. Luxury should mean luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely room and high standard of service.”
Reviews.Author: Barbinan_11
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and well appointed. We enjoyed the coffee maker in the room, the line of cosmetic products, the lovely linens and the abundance of towels. The entire hotel staff was friendly and helpful. A truly enjoyable stay at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: KittyGritty
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about the hotel because after we had booked I read some mediocre reviews. However, overall we were very happy with our stay. Check in was fast. I had requested an especially quiet room (light sleeper) and they chose well, 26th floor, very quiet. The housekeeping staff was very good, and yes, quiet--I didn't think about that until I saw it in another review. Very efficient and thorough. We were disappointed that not only was the in room internet WIRED (!) but $13 a day. We were attending a huge conference and we were surprised that they didn't at least give attendees a discount. We chose to go to the lobby area a couple of times a day to use the free wireless. We were also disappointed in the eating options. There was a noisy Sports Bar, even television sets in the restaurant part. Of no interest to us. The separate "lounge" was out in the open, not pleasant to use, and didn't even have the same beer options as the adjoining sports area. They lost a lot of business from us during cocktail time. We went elsewhere every day. Almost forgot--FABULOUS bed!! And SO convenient to major sites (both walking distance and close to subway stops)

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster!”
Reviews.Author: JoC56_9
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to the Boston area for business as well as pleasure. I began using this hotel over 20 years ago but in the last three years had opted for a change of hotel. Given the rates I opted to return to the Marriott Copley. Checking in after a long drive I was informed there was no valet parking available for hotel guests as there was a holiday party. I left my luggage with the one and only doorman and headed for the adjoining self-park garage. My daughter began the check-in process. Upon returning from the garage which took some time given the minimal number of spaces available there, I observed our luggage unattended in the lobby in the midst of random people from the party who it was clear had imbibed too much. (In the interim while checking in my daughter commented that the response she received to the parking situation was, â€œat least itâ€™s less expensive.â€� I called my daughter, mentioned the luggage situation to find out that she had been informed there was only one bellhop available that evening. The evening did not end there as we had to call security twice given the noise level on our floor. Lastly, amenities that had been above par on past visits were fairly invisible in our room although when housekeeping was called, they did arrive. Upon arriving home I dashed off a note to the manager detailing the dissatisfaction, I have yet to receive a response. The situation and stay was unfortunate to the least and the term â€œguestâ€� a stretch to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “good location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: billyclyde
Reviews.Content: At the Boston Marriott Copley Place, you are paying for a big-city hotel with an downtown, upscale location. It is in the Back Bay area, and is part of the high-end Copley Place mall. The views of Boston and the Charles River from the upper floors are nice. This is what you are paying for. My room was nice -- slightly above average but not that much different from some of the other Marriotts I frequently stay at, including the Courtyard and other lesser lines within the Marriott chain. The bed was very comfortable, and I slept very well. A nice flat-panel TV and coffee maker were in room. The bathroom was standard size, but nice and clean, and everything worked. Besides the location in the Back Bay area, the hotel is also close to the Back Bay rail and subway station. I did not have a car, but I doubt that parking is anywhere close to free. Internet cost about $13 a day; expensive, but typical for a hotel like this. The front desk staff was a bit confused with my room assignment, but after patiently explaining my situation several times, they overcame their reluctance to listen and finally realized that I did indeed have a problem that needed to be straightened out. However, every night when I would walk through the lobby, I'd see a line waiting to check in. On my last night there, there were at least a half-dozen people waiting in line. This should not happen at any hotel, especially one as upscale as this Marriott. For a hotel this size (there were well over 30 floors), they clearly need to put the customer first and hire more front-desk staff. The fitness center, which is on the 5th floor, was very good, and was one of the best I have seen. There seemed to be plenty of treadmills and ellipticals, some strength machines, and even a small pool. I was on the 28th floor, and would often have to wait a while for an elevator. Not too big of a deal. They did provide me with the WSJ at my door each morning, which was very nice. Each day my room was made up without any problem.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Attentive Staff - a recent make-over adds modernity to the property”
Reviews.Author: PBRD
Reviews.Content: The building itself, along with the W and the shopping plazas are a horrendous concrete blight on the Boston skyline; however, the review is about the Marriott Copley ! Uber friendly check-in, with a new lobby that speeds up the process. Associates are well trained and can genuinely anticipate your needs. Brandon was awesome. Franco as the Concierge knows Boston and is the quintessential gentleman - he should be at The Four Seasons. I have read reviews where guests complain on this forum; I have had a couple of issues in the past with this property and if you advise the Front Desk, they do all in their power to accommodate. It would appear that a lot of the associates from the past are no longer at the property- that may indeed be a blessing. The hotel has a new lease on life. Downside -- housekeeping staff is predominantly chinese/catonese - this is not, in any way a racist remark, just it's pretty hard to ask for extra towels - perhaps I should learn the language :) - if you stay, you'll understand.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - again.”
Reviews.Author: Rainmn
Reviews.Content: My son and daughter-in-law live in Boston, so my wife and I average two or three trips per year. For Christmas this year and last, we have stayed at the Marriott Copley Place and have been very impressed. We have stayed at other Boston hotels rated four stars or better on Tripadvisor, but the Marriott is our favorite. I will review our most recent trip, but our 2009 trip was basically identical. Check-in was quite easy and courteous. On each of these visits, I had booked through a major travel consolidator and paid an absurdly low rate of under $100 per night - tax included. Yet treatment at check-in was as if I were inner circle paying full price. I was asked if I had any requests. I asked for a non-adjoining room. I was given a corner room on the top floor. I was given a corner room the previous year, also. The room was of a good size and in good condition. Though it has been some time since the last refurb, it was obvious that maintenance was done regularly. Repeated use keeps any room from being perfect (our room had an iron burn on the carpet from guest use). Three examples point out care to me. First, the HVAC vents were clean, obviously vacuumed. I find this a rarity in hotels. Second, caulk and grout in the bathroom had been maintained. Third, no scuff marks on walls. These are just three indicative samples. One minor complaint - towels were average at best. Good bedding, TV, safe, good coffee maker, and fridge/chiller. Good desk set and separate lounge chair. The room was quiet by hotel standards. Service - The front desk has been covered. Our room safe could not be opened and our fridge seemed warm. We called the desk. The units were replaced within 15 minutes. Housekeeping worked at a stealth level. They did not make noise in the halls as they worked. We had a late start each morning and they had already done the first shift in our wing and moved on to another wing. Each day we would go out in the late morning for about one to two hours and the room would be done - done well each time upon our return. Vacuuming each day. No hand prints on the floor-to-ceiling windows. Well done. Bell staff we encountered within the building would always say hello. Doormen were a bit more stoic. Facility - There are different areas in Boston one may wish as a starting point. The Marriott occupies an excellent one. As mentioned in most reviews, it is enclosed attached to two malls, very advantageous as we were bombed by the recent blizzard. One allows access to a branch of the MBTA Green line; one to the Orange line. Public transportation got us to our terminal at the airport in 40 minutes for $3.40 for two, and this was the day after the blizzard. A large Shaw's grocery store is directly across the street for supplies. In good weather, most all main attractions are within walking distance. The second floor of the lobby has a giant sports bar/restaurant complex. It serves better than average bar-style food. Slightly pricey, but not too bad. Our servers have always been good. Starbucks and a candy kiosk there, also. There are two computers and printers in the lobby for boarding passes only. Very convenient. The elevators to the upper floors can be a bit slow in arriving. *Of special note - the indoor pool, hot tub, exercise facility, and locker rooms are phenomenal and well cared for. A year had passed since my last visit and there was not a single sign of additional wear and tear - very well maintained. We noted that there was an attendant there who WORKED. In the hour I was there, I saw him straighten furniture, collect and distribute towels, dust workout equipment, and dust windows. I read one reviewer's complaint about the hours of the gift shop. I noticed the unpredictable hours, also. When the reviewer was told by a front desk worker that she could not be sure if the shop was open, I can understand. It strikes me not as a lack of knowledge by a Marriott employee, but rather the unpredictability of what is probably a privately leased facility. One final note. The blizzard ground things to a halt in Boston the night of December 26. Marriott put up their employees that needed to stay that evening or were stranded. I know that some might say that it was also to guarantee staff at the hotel the next day, but I see it as a quality gesture on this Marriott's part. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Poor value”
Reviews.Author: crowrobot
Reviews.Content: The Copley Marriott is in a great location in downtown Boston and is attached to two indoor malls. However, this hotel is quite overpriced and under-staffed in my opinion. I had to wait nearly 20 minutes in line to check in. My room was not cleaned until four pm. However, the interior and lobby of the hotel is very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, did not blow me away...”
Reviews.Author: NY414
Reviews.Content: Had set high expectations for one of the largest hotles in Boston. Doorman, with the exception of one, were not engaging at all. Walked throughout the lobby multiple times, stayed for three nights, and was only greeted once by a younug man at the front desk. I believe his name was Airel? Champions servers were rude. Food was decent, gotta try the pulled pork nachos. Called to ask if their gift shop was open the lady who answered the phone said "Uhh...I think they are, but I am not sure" of course I went down to discover they were indeed closed. Bottom line, I was disappointed with their service, I understand with such a large hotel it is sometimes difficult to be personable but a better effort should have been made.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is location. Wifi is worthless.”
Reviews.Author: barinr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not up to Marriott's standards and I have stayed in Marriott properties over 30 nights this year. The rooms seem worn and ours was very noisy. More importantly their complimentary wifi is worthless. I never could log on with my iPad. My wife got on once with her iPad. That's over a four day period. Even the Lobby Starbucks lacked viable wifi. There is none in the rooms. There are far better options elsewhere in Boston for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Major Mold Problem”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLal
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, this hotel has a great location, especially in the winter because there is a skywalk to the Prudential Center, a major shopping mall with some mid-range restaurants (e.g. Cheesecake Factory). But we had major mold in our room. We stayed on the top floor, which was billed as being a perk when we checked in. When we got off the elevator, the smell of scented room spray was overwhelming. It got worse when we opened the door to our room. The ceiling had been patched for a water leak. Within two hours my husband had respiratory problems, extreme fatigue, aches and pains. A day later, after three inches of snow, water was streaming out of the ceiling in the hallway and the staff had put out four waist-height trash cans to collect it! Clearly, this is an ongoing problem and we now realize the room spray was to cover up a musty odor from mold. We had just joined the Marriott Points program. The joke was on us. Never again. (You can also use the skywalk from the Westin).

Reviews.Title: “Walk your way around Boston”
Reviews.Author: Tamster-62
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided the primo location for our trip to see the Rockettes in Boston. It was only 7 short blocks away which made it very convenient. The hotel was accessed easily from I90. We parked Valet (note additional charge for parking) and walked the entire time over the weekend. We were right in the heart of Boston; and we took advantage of it. Walked to Boston Commons, Quincy Market and everything in between. Hotel was very nice. We had a corner room which gave us a wonderful view. I was told the corner room was more spacious; yet it seemed pretty compact. We were also located next to a service room - so more noise than normal. The bathroom was very small - especially for 4 people. Not much wiggle room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: traveler1234567890
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in October. It was very busy when I was there and still received excellent service. The room was clean. Great location for shopping and restaurants. The only complaint would be that you can never get just a drink at CHAMPIONS. You need to get food to sit at a table and the bar is always too crowded to sit at or to get a drink. Food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ambiance, clean, and pretty but the two worst night's sleep I've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: suchaskirt
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent. There was PLENTY of light, lots of windows with a great view. The set up of the room was wonderful. The safe was large enough to keep my laptop in there. Plenty of good lighting. The bathroom was small but fine. However, the mattress was the worst I've slept on, ever. And the heater made enough of a noise each time it came on that I thought someone was at the door. Both nights, I had very little sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: apsinpdx
Reviews.Content: Great location when traveling on business. Plenty of evening walking options, and food options within vicinity. For the price they charge and not include in room internet is a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Business Hotel; Beds Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: pvmkmyer
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for $100 on Priceline. We only stayed one night as most of our trip was in Plymouth for a family wedding. My wife needs a handicapped room and we were given a large room with 2 double beds on the 32nd floor with a fabulous view overlooking the Charles River. My only problem with this hotel was the bed. I slept, but other reviews about the beds sagging are accurate,and they need to be replaced. Our room was clean. Service was very good. We ordered a rollaway bed for our daughter and it arrived in 2 minutes. Our hair dryer wasn't working and it was replaced with a new one in 10 minutes. Concierge got us last minute reservation at Atlantic Fish Co for dinner, which was an excellent recommendation. I would have no problem staying at this hotel again, but do hope they replace the beds soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are horrible. Didn't sleep for two nights”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom25
Reviews.Content: The beds are old. You can actually see the "dip" in the mattress in the center of the full beds. Both us and our kids were falling to the center during the night and kept waking each other up. Also, the sheets didn't fit and they kept coming off the mattress. There was dirt and dust balls inside our drawers as well. Otherwise, the service was good. They need to replace ALL of their beds as all 5 rooms our families stayed in all had the same bed issues. And, we were on different floors.

Reviews.Title: “Required for my business trip, but I'd never recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AlliBum
Reviews.Content: I am an Elite Marriott member and have stayed in Marriott properties in major cities around the world. The Boston Marriott Copley Place is the dirtiest Marriott property I've ever stayed in. There was hair in the bathrooms (stuck to the ceiling, light fixtures, shower curtain and floor), dust on the hair dryer and wood moldings... the bathroom door was splattered with many unidentifiable sprays and gunk... I was afraid to touch it and used a washcloth to wipe it down. The King size sleeping room on the 15th floor didn't have wireless Internet access and there was no breakfast room service menu to hang on the door at night nor was there an in-room dining menu for other times of the day. Being that I was in the city on business, these things aren't necessary luxuries but necessities while I am working and attending meetings. At $12.95/day the internet was just slow and the cable was broken. In other areas -- the main hallways were frigid -- so cold that our guests from warmer climates were shivering in the elevators. And, might I say that the only other Marriott with slower elevator service is the Marriott Marquis in Times Square, NY. I certainly hope this hotel gets its act together soon, the location cannot be beat but there are so many other options in the area that I won't be returning anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: bpol
Reviews.Content: Was able to get this hotel for a reasonable price on Priceline for the weekend we brought our son to move in to Northeastern.
