This hotel is in an awesome location in Boston and the accomodations were impeccable. The room wasn't very big, but it was very comfortable. I really like Marriott hotels and this one is so nice. I look forward to staying here again if the Priceline gods are good to me. The only drawback is that parking is expensive, but that's expected in the middle of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average convention hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel025
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this huge convention hotel for two nights at the beginning of a wonderful trip to New England and Upstate New York. The front desk staff was very helpful and the late check-in (23 pm.) was really fast, what we really thanked, as we were tired from the flight. Our room was big, silent and had a very comfortable bed. Even that it is a very big hotel, the service is perfect and it has a perfect location with a lot of restaurants nearby. It also has a sports bar called Champions that is real fun. All in all, as we had a very good internet offer, staying at this hotel was a anice start for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say anything bad about this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: arthanial
Reviews.Content: Can't say anything bad about this hotel. The staff was awesome very genuine. I lost my phone charger and they gave me a new one. I stayed on a high floor and had a great downtown view. Great marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: Melissa45582
Reviews.Content: You have to park in the Mall parking garage which they share with the hotel since its connected its $30 a day. Check in was fast, hotel was clean and nice. We stayed on the 33rd floor facing toward the river. We paid $120 a night and it was excellent. I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: dsegers1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel almost every time we have gone to Boston. It is within walking distance to Fenway Park, has a great mall attached to it and is easy to get in and out of. All attractions are in close proximity and the rooms are always clean.

Reviews.Title: “I love Boston!”
Reviews.Author: lovinalmond
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Copley place for three nights during September 2010. I was lucky enough to get this through priceline as a name your own price. We were thrilled when we checked in and the agent offered to upgrade us to a suite on the 36th floor. The suite was the size of a one bedroom apartment with a kitchen! Floor to ceiling windows with a view of the Charles River. And he upgraded us at no additional charge! Wow, were we impressed. Definately had a great experience for the price that we paid and the view as fantastic. The pool and hotub area are nice and it was awesome to have a Starbucks in the lobby. We did ride the duck which was so easy to get to as it is across the street from the Marriott. Walking distance to pretty much everything in Boston: Little Italy, Boston Commons, The Freedom Trail, Paul Revere's house.

Reviews.Title: “SURPRISINGLY pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveler40
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal for this hotel online. I lived in Boston, and always stayed away from this hotel... It was GREAT! The location was perfect for dinner and shopping after my work was done. The people at check-in were unbelieveably nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A conference hotel, not for holidaymakers”
Reviews.Author: Jon_1556
Reviews.Content: We were on holiday and we decided to go for a top-rated expensive hotel in Boston. We first tried the Lenox, which was delightful. The Boston Marriott couldn't have been more different. From the 20th floor you get a superb view of Boston, but your room is box-like with thin walls and noise can carry from the neighbouring room. The decor is smart and pleasant but the rooms have no character. Internet isn't free (which I think many holidaymakers find infuriating) and costs around 12 dollars unless you use the lounge area where it is free. There is no proper residents' lounge - it resembles an airport departure lounge and at around midnight an officious hotel employee shouted at my sons (aged 18 and 21) to leave the lounge because it was closing. There was in fact little sign of respect or consideration for the customer - we might as well have been at an airport. Lots of people on conferences were drinking and networking and maybe it's ideal if you're on a conference with an expense account. For a family on holiday it felt unpleasant and unwelcoming. Breakfasts were excellent and there was plenty of good food. Valet car parking at 40 dollars a day but I hear it's worse in some other US cities. If you have the choice, choose the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at Copley square”
Reviews.Author: NB-Advisor
Reviews.Content: Excellent location Expensive parking. I booked on priceline. Very good rate. Large hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: winodino84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott 3 nights after our oversea flight from Europe. We arrived a little bit too early and parked our car in the Prudential Center Garage. First, it was not so easy to find the right way to the hotel from there but we found it quickly. The staff at check in were very nice, it was no problem that we were there before the official check in time. I asked for a room on the upper floors with a view and the woman at the reception gave us a nice room on the 31th floor. Although we booked the hotel via Priceline, we did not get a typical Priceline room (e.g. behind the elevator). The room was not that spacious, but had a great King bed with 6 pillows, a desk and an extra relaxing chair, a LCD TV with variuos TV stations and a nice bathroom. The room was absolutely clean and as a welcoming gift we received a plate with cheese and fruit and a bottle of wine - nice idea. We saw the Prudential Tower from our room, also some not so nice roofs but we liked the view. Some reviewers wrote about the slow elevators, I would say the waiting time is average, depending on the time of day. They were not exceptionally slow but if they were on the first floor and you called them to the 31st - well, it takes some time, even for an elevator ;) I liked the connection to the Prudential and the Copley Mall, everything was so near, e.g. the food court in Prudential Mall and the Au Bon Pain in Copley Mall, which I can recommend. We never ate at the hotel, but the Champions Bar looked nice and there is also a Starbucks. Newbury and Boylston Street are a 5 minute walk away and there is a Shaw's supermarket right across the street. The next T-station (Prudential) is about 3 minutes away and the Old Town Trolley stops right in front of the hotel (tickets can be bought at the Concierge or the special Trolley counter besides the entrance). To the Trinity church it's a 10 minute walk and another 10 minute walk to the Boston Common. Everything that you need is right in the neighborhood - liked that a lot. What I did not like so much was that you had to pay for the internet in the room, okay, but that's common. At least there was free wi-fi-connection in the lobby, but the sitting area there was always crowded. Until 4 pm we could sit in the Connexion loung on the second floor, which is much more comfortable, but they close at 4 for paying audience. All in all I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Park in the Prudential parking garage and try to get a voucher, we saved about 15 Dollars a day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: luv2run
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here for a short vacation. Although the area and lobby are very busy, the rooms are very quiet, comfortable and well appointed. We stayed in a king room on the conciere level. An excellent hot breakfast, afternoon tea and evening snacks, soft beverages and bar were available on this floor only. Ahhhh, the beds....if we weren't in such an interesting town, we could have slept in them 24/7! Incredibly comfortable. I have a bad back and they were not too soft, just right! Beautifully appointed rooms w/ appx. 42" flat screen t.v. w/ plenty of channels. We had a view of the Charles River (downside-costs $30 extra to face river). However, you can request view of the bay for no extra charge. Bathrooms clean but small for two people. Safes in room, good visible security ie: cameras, guards...good section of town. Excellent large workout facility. Many cardo machines each had t.v.'s ie: incline ellipitals & treadmills, had everything you could want including free weights, fitness balls, mats, etc. We used it every day. Nice pool w/ separate lap lane. Large hot tub. GREAT customer service everywhere in this hotel. Bar had dozens of large t.v. screens. Although very busy, it was a great place to watch your favorite sports games. Got this room on Priceline for $120- a steal! You just enter the different amenities/the area: Copley Square and you'll get this Marriott or the Boston Sheraton which also gets rave reviews. (We were upgraded to the conciere rm. because other wasn't available). The Old Town Trolley -Hop on-Hop off, was great for seeing the city on the first sightseeing day. Guides were entertaining and informative. The second day is free which is perfect for going back to the places that interest you the next day. Stops just outside the door. Buy tickets on-line to save money. Duck tour is across the street-would recommend for families w/ young kids. However, it is a non-stop tour w/ no free second day. Kind of silly for adults only. The "T" subway is 2 or 3 blocks away. We took it from the airport ($2) and back to save the $30 cab fare each way. Very good for getting to Waterfront, Freedom trail, Cambridge, USS Constitution, North End (Little Italy-be sure and have dinner, pizza by the slice for lunch and Mike's Pastry's Cannoles here!) and other outlining areas. Busline is confusing for visitors. Downsides: Internet in room $12 a day, 59 cents a min. in business center. However, there is a Kinkos in adjacent mall for about 26 cents a min. Must pay to park. We did not rent a car as Boston is too busy to navigate....parking almost impossible to find and then parking time very limited. Plenty of taxis and great public transportation. Besides, this hotel is centrally located, just a few blocks from Isabella Gardner Museum, Museum of Art, Fenway, Trinity Church, Newberry Street Shopping and public transportation. Best location for vacationers. Oh, the AMAZING mall connected to this hotel by walkways... has hundreds of excellent stores for every taste. Plan a day for shopping here and on Newberry Street, a few blocks away. Ask the front hotel desk for a complimentary refrigerator brought to your room....there is a huge grocery store/deli across the street. Has everything imaginable. We got hot meals from the deli, snacks, water and wine/beer and brought back to the room. Be forwarned that alcohol in bars is very expensive! Glass of Beringer wine-half full= $8.00, beer $6.00 or more almost everywhere in Boston. Only reason you may not like this hotel is if you prefer quaint, cozy boutique-like hotels. Or if you are traveling with small children and are primarily visiting the aquarium and other child oriented venues and need a hotel with complimentary breakfast. I would recommend you stay nearer to Freedom trail, child museum or the Aquarium in a chain hotel which offers complimentary breakfast. Military retirees and personnel can stay at The Constitution Inn for $99 per night. My military son-in-law/ daughter stay there and say it is great for the price. Otherwise, you cannot go wrong with this well-run Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave the room!”
Reviews.Author: sikodelika
Reviews.Content: The rooms are yummy. The beds, pillows, blanquets, and so on... it was hard to want to leave. Also, it had an HDTV with HD channels!! The bathroom is nothing incredible, but it was clean and decent. The location: perfectly close to everything. The only thing that wasn't awesome was the parking: 44$ a day! Oh and it had internet, but no wireless (sad for iPad only travellers!)

Reviews.Title: “THE SUITES ARE AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: ledox
Reviews.Content: I have been to Boston with my girlfriend several times and we tried many hotels in this area and the Marriott Copley Square didn't disappointed us at all. They upgraded us to a suite and the view was incredible!! The staff was nice and helpful. The only bad point is that they don't have their own parking so we can't have a in and out pass. The hotel is directly inside the shopping mall and there's plenty of restaurant surrounding the hotel. If you have a chance to try that Hotel don't hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jwlsTrentham
Reviews.Content: Impressive hotel. We had a super corner room on one of the upper floors with great views over the water at far as the Kennedy Library. Decent sized rooms, efficient staff, impressive gym and nice indoor pool (aimed at fitness rather than for the kids). Good supermarket across the road, they'll make you very nice pizzas to take back to your room.The trolley buses that stop outside the hotel are very touristy but worth the money- buy tickets from the concierge. and the Mapparium is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: dhkssm
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and amenities that were more than enough to meet my needs. I have nothing more to add to previous reviews, especially on the negative side, except that the carpet was somewhat damp and smelly and the pool was usually crowded with other families when I was there with my family. Fitness facilities were excellent. We were even offered free in-room internet, which usually cost +$12/night, through the conference that I attended.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Serena1959
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel last year. One year later we enjoyed our stay as much as the first time. Guest services are top notch and the rooms are very cleaned. Great location for shopping and plenty of good restaurants around the corner. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice escape”
Reviews.Author: Lmcintyre
Reviews.Content: My 2 daughters and I stayed in one room while my 2 sisters and niece stayed in the neighboring room. Would have liked for an adjoining room but this was the next best thing. The woman at the frontdesk accomodated this request with no problem. We even were able to check in over 2 hours early. We booked this hotel via Priceline, ended up to be an incredible savings - especially for all they have to offer. The location can't be beat, in the middle of everything. Loved being attached to the mall and the Pru. When we wanted to get off of the busy Boston streets we just hopped through any door nearby. The parking was easy and self park was less than valet ($35/day). The rooms were plenty big enough for the 3 of us. Having the fridge made life easier with leftovers. The beds were big and comfy. We had breakfast at the restaurant on the 2nd floor. The buffet looked good but for $18 was too pricey for what I'd eat. The kids were only $5 so that made more sense for them. I ordered off the menu and was satisfied. Loved all the elevator options. Never seemed to wait more than a couple of minutes. The girls liked the pool but they prefer steps rather than a ladder entry, a small negative. The main negative was the lack of free wifi. I really dislike paying for wifi. I believe it was available in the lobby but you had to pay in the room. Overall, a great stay and wouldn't hesitate to make a Priceline reservation there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: top_mom007
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel, and what a great choice we made! Skywalk connected you with tons of shops, and just across the street is a 24 hr grocery store, perfect for quick muffins, yogurts for breakfast, and star bucks is also on 2nd floor of hotel. Duck tours right outside the building, as well as subway, and taxis always available. Stayed on the 30th floor with great views! Service is wonderful. Called concierge couple times for info, and very professional. Called to inquire about bar fridge, and in minutes one was brought to our room. Called for extra towels, and again quickly towels were brought up. Pool and hot tub were great after a long day of shopping and sight seeing. Did not use the gym but it seemed to be a good size, and quite clean. Had a drink in the Champions sports bar when the red sox game was about to start. Tons of screens and one big screen, so would be great place to be during a game! If I had any complaints, it would be how soft the beds were, altho some in our group loved the beds. Also, room service trays were seemingly always in the hallway, for a good part of the day. I also think that paying to use a hotels computer in the business center when free wifi is offered is odd.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: patl123
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel and I agree with all the reviews about the excellent location (easy walk to 2 subway stops, restaurants, shops, the Public Library, Dunkin Donuts & California Kitchen across the street). This is a great location (walking distance) to the Public Gardens and a couple of subway stops from the North End. The fitness center is excellent, but the small-ish pool was quickly packed (after 5 pm) with young families. They should not allow small kids (esp. under 12 yrs.) in the hot tub. We got a great deal on Priceline and the room was impeccable, with a fabulous view of the river/skyline. The bedding was really comfortable, but the mattress sunk a little (not exactly uncomfortable, but noticeable). Housekeeping was excellent. The parking garage is next door ($35 per day; that seems to be the going rate for that area) and since the main entrance was packed with cars, we parked first and walked through the mall with our luggage to get to the registration area. There is free wi-fi in the main lobby area, which was always crowded with business people, but I was able to quickly check my email on my iPod. I didn't notice any smokers by the entrance, as mentioned in a previous review. The elevator system (and the wait) is slightly frustrating. We figured out that while people are getting off the elevator, you should put your arm out to keep the door from closing, or it will slam shut in your face. Overall, for the price/location, I really liked this hotel, but I think I prefer smaller hotels that are a little less overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_America
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July and was quite impressed. It had a good location, ideal for walking to the freedom trail and other nearby places to see. We spent quite a bit of time in the room, due to being so tired from the flight. We had a little look through the mall which is attached, but that was it. The room was very clean and tidy. the bathroom was clean too. I have only stayed in one Marriot hotel before and, as you would expect it is quite a high end hotel, in terms of location and cleanliness.The only thing that we found to be quite annoying is the breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. We had breakfast there once and it was nice, but it was expensive! after that we went elsewhere. We had a car throughout our stay in Boston and we paid $30 a day to park in the car park attached to the hotel. I guess that this is typical price for a City and, turns out that we did not really need it as it is a walking city. It is a shame that the hotel does not offer a discount for guests staying in the hotel. Overall we had a great stay and the staff were friendly! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: marqtte
Reviews.Content: this hotel has nice rooms, good breakfast buffet good location, very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Shopping and Going to Fenway”
Reviews.Author: 96traveler
Reviews.Content: If you like high end shopping than this location is for you. You can walk from the hotel right to the Copley Place Mall. Neiman Marcus, Legal Seafoods are all right there. Also, the Duck Boat Tours were right across the street so it made it very convenient if you wanted to take the tour of Boston via a duck. If you want to catch a game at Fenway, it is about a 20-25 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the rating fool you!!”
Reviews.Author: mkrhon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 15th anniversary and wanted to go away for a couple of days. I started researching hotels. There are sooo many hotels to choose form in Boston. I got a good price using my AAA. (189.) for this hotel. I was so concerned because of the reviews that I had read and because it was rated #43 out of 73 hotels. I decided to take a chance. We already loved the location of the hotel when we got there. So central! Shopping Mall attatched, Shaws across the street, walking distance of shops and restaurants, and walking distance to the T. We stood in line to check in they had a plate of freshly baked choc. chip cookies. Jason checked us in. My husband mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary and if there was anyway he could give us a complimentary upgrade. He upgraded us to the hospitality suite which is double the regular room size and he sent us a complimentary bottle of wine and cheese tray! Now that was great first impression! (Go Jason!). The room was clean and spacious. We had a really nice view from our room The bed was comfortable. The fitness room was great which was important to us. Negatives: The air conditioner was noisy but it didn't keep us awake. The bathroom was small and there was no seperate vanity. All in all it was a great place to stay and Jason really made our stay more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great show, great weekend”
Reviews.Author: CFraser
Reviews.Content: We won the Boston Copley by chance with a Priceline bid. We took the Downeaster from Maine and a taxi from North Station to the hotel. You can easily take the T or subway, but we didn't want to deal with luggage on the T so we treated ourselves to a taxi. They are right there outside North Station and the fare was about $15 for the 10 minute ride. Luck was with us and the room was ready when we arrived at 11 am. We settled in and found the room clean and up to Marriott standards. We ate a very pricey breakfast buffet at the hotel on the first day because we were hungry and didn't know where else to go yet. The next day we found a great little restaurant further down the street called Thorntons. (Take a left out of the hotel and walk down Huntington and you can't miss it) The hotel is connected by an enclosed walkway to the Prudential Center mall and considering it was very hot when we where there, it was nice to stay in air conditioning as long as possible. There is a Starbucks right in the Hotel, and a Dunkin Donuts across the street. In the mall is a food court and a few sit down restaurants . From the mall you can access the Prudential Skywalk and the Top of the Hub restaurant and Lounge. You can also buy tickets for the Duck Tours. Tours depart across the street from the hotel. The Shaws across the street was a great place to get water and other snacks for the room. The theater district is about at 15 to 20 minute walk down Stuart Street. The Wilbur, Wang and Shubert are all right there when Stuart and Tremont intersect. The comedian we saw at the Wilbur theater was hilarious as expected. The Wilbur is a grand old theater and they are doing a lot to restore it. However, the air conditioning could not keep up with a packed house and it got extremely hot. As is the case with most older theaters, the seats are small and very close together so be prepared to get very cozy with the person sitting next to you. And while I expect to spend more in Boston at a show, $4 for a small bottle of water seemed a bit much to me. Everything we needed for this trip was in walking distance, but if you are interested in other areas of Boston you might need to use the T more. All in all we had an enjoyable couple of days and found the hotel to be more than expected. We would highly recommend it to others and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: KathySShermanOaks_CA
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Sheraton, but wanted to try the Marriott because it was a slightly more convenient location and about $40 less per night, but I will be returning to the Sheraton on my next visit. The lobby of the Marriott is nice with a wall-sized big screen TV in the sports bar. Location is also excellent for Prudential Center, Back Bay and parents visiting their students at Berklee or Northeastern. The decor in the rooms definitely needs an upgrade and hallways and rooms were not super clean. Staff was helpful and friendly. Because it's a non-smoking hotel (good thing) everyone hangs out around the front entrance smoking, which I thought was pretty disgusting. I also don't like when hotels charge you to use the computers in their business centers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TW66
Reviews.Content: The best thing with this hotel is location. As it was very warm and humid when we visited Boston the location of this hotel was great, we could stay in aircontioned areas for long times as the hotel is connected with two malls on each side. It is also near to public transportation from this hotel. And there is a lot of nice restaurants, pubs and so on nearby. The gym was also really good and its open 24/7, a good thing for us with jetlag and wake up to early... The only bad thing with this hotel is the elevators, I donÂ´t think I ever been in a hotel with so many elevators but still having to wait for a long time for a elevator. But still I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: lorarose
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful location. Right on the subway, close to some amazing restaraunts and great shopping. Malls are connected to the hotel by walking skywalks. There is a food court in the mall attached to the hotel for cheap, quick meals. There is a full service grocery store across the street. Go there for sodas, etc. The store at the hotel is expensive (actually the soda machines on each floor are cheaper than the store). Super close to all of the wonders of Boston. Several tours leave right from the hotel. We went on the duck tour, went to the top of the Prudential Center, shopped on Newberrry Street, ate at restaurants on Boylston and more just within two or three blocks of the hotel. Revere Beach and the aquarium are easy to get to on the subway. Actually, everything is easy to get to from the subway in Boston. The beginning of the Freedom Trail is not far from the hotel and is a MUST. Rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. Staff was very nice. I asked them for a room with a view because I had never been to Boston before and they put us on the 34th floor with a view of the Charles River, the Harbor and the city. It was great. Security was wonderful. They let me in my room when my key wouldn't work and were very pleasant to deal with. I was disappointed that they did not have wireless internet and charged for the wired internet but my only real complaint is that the elevators were very slow. I waited ten minutes at one point. Otherwise, great hotel with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but please clean up the halls.”
Reviews.Author: Mr-MrsB-MN
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott Copley Place for a convention. The hotel was nice, clean rooms, friendly staff, wonderful job with serving a meal for a group our size. My only complaint about the hotel was that there was constantly room service left in the hallways. One evening I went into my room around 8pm, when I left the following morning around 8:30 the same trays were still in the hall. Dirty dishes constantly in the hallways is not something you want to see everytime you walk to/from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location: Horrible Beds!”
Reviews.Author: zarkster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here and thought the location, service, and cleanliness was top-notch. The staff was helpful, the elevators ran smoothly, and the exercise room was the best one my wife and I have ever encountered in a hotel. There is tons of shopping nearby, and you're in walking distance of many famous landmarks. If the room were a little better, we'd be giving this 5-stars. The marshallow fairy came to this hotel and replaced all their mattresses and pillows with marshmallows. If you like sinking into your bed like a rhino sinks into quicksand, don't sweat it. Also, the shower's pressure was minimal, and the AC was not cranking out cold air. We would come back to the hotel based on price and location, but we both felt we didn't have a good night's sleep due to the heat and the exceedingly uncomfortable mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected!!”
Reviews.Author: sheridan_10
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Tripadvisor, I was very aprehensive on staying in the hotel, but I found it a very pleasant stay. I arrived at 1pm and asked if there was any chance of getting in early. That was no problem. I got my king size room and a room in the 8th floor as I asked for a room high up. I was asked if this was ok for me or I wanted one higher but I was fine with this. The staff were very friendly helping with any requests and help. All except for the man at the old trolley tours who was very grumpy. The room was nice and decent. room service was good. Check out was easy and had an express check out so didnt have to queue up. I also got this through priceline so cost me $150 per night. The only bad thing about this was starting from about 5am, some sort of loud noise vibrated through the room every hour. it sounded like a boiler of hairdryer. other than that, it was a very nice and pleasant stay. I would recommend it. It was also prime location with the tour buses stopping right outside or with the T stop a short walk away. Its also joined onto the local mall.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION IN BOSTON”
Reviews.Author: travelagentnancy
Reviews.Content: On a whim, my hubby and I booked the Marriott Copley during the July 4th festivities. I have to totally disagree with a recent reviewers comments on the front desk staff! Our experience was fantastic! EVERY staff member was helpful, gracious and went out of their way to assist. The hotel was packed for the July 4th weekend and yet the service given was prompt and with a smile. Also, for those who complain about the parking fee...get over it! You are in a major city! In fact, the valet parking at the Copley was one of the best we have experienced. The Olde Towne Tours stop at the Marriott Copley, another plus for the hotel. You are within walking distance to so much and the subway is on the other side of the adjacent mall. Our only slightly negative comments would be that the concierge lounge was way to small and oddly set up. Glad we came to Boston for the fireworks and especially happy that we stayed at the Marriott Copley!

Reviews.Title: “nice city view”
Reviews.Author: crabbie000
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for a conference. My room was on the 33th floor, which had a nice view of downtown Boston. The room was spacious and had a flat screen TV. Most importantly, the bed was pretty damn confortable. I normally have difficulties sleeping in new places, but I ended up having three good nite's sleeps there. I didn't like the bell services tho. The bell man looked annoyed when handling my luggage. I didn't know if he was just tired because the last days of conferences are always so busy for them.

Reviews.Title: “For what we paid, good”
Reviews.Author: fielding
Reviews.Content: Priceline, $120 a night, king room on the 24th floor, great view of the south end and harbor islands. Room tidy but undistinguished otherwise. Could use updating, as others have noted. No way would it be worth $300 a night, but I suspect a lot of guests come in on discount. It's a bustling hotel, attached to a busy shopping galleria that at times seems to meld into the hotel's public spaces. No big deal -- gives it an urban and eclectic feel. Can't beat the Back Bay location, plenty to see, do,eat, drink nearby. Staff seemed friendly and helpful, but we didn't really need much assistance. If you can get a decent discount and don't mind a big place, this is a pretty good bet all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: etzv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and is in a great location. Connected to a Simon Mall- Copley Place and the Prudential Center. A lot of shopping. Grocery Store across the street. Elevators were fast. Rooms are large and nice. I got the hotel through Priceline and was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Go_Cubs_Go_Titans
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel with a good deal on Priceline, so the "value" question is tough. It seemed to me to be primarily a business hotel, but that offered no problems for my family of four using it for vacation. Despite the "stigma" of being a Priceline customer, we were given a choice of one king bed or two doubles, and our room had a river view. The hotel was nice, the staff was courteous, etc. Even though it is a business hotel, the attached mall seems to make it an obvious pick for vacationers. One drawback was the lack of free WiFi in the rooms -- you had to go into the lobby to get free WiFi. The parking is steep at $35 per night ($42 for valet and to be able to take your car out), so figure that into your price, but that's typical of any hotel in a city such as this.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stop for Business”
Reviews.Author: journeymeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days while on business. Hotel staff was very accomodating, and the location was in close proximity to the Hynes Convention Center where we met for daily activities. Hotel is in a good location for walking to local restaurants, and the T is close by for trips to Fenway Park and Logan Airport. Mall type shopping at Copley Place and the Prudential Center as well. Room was quiet and very comfortable. Hotel rates were reasonable for a convention setting. Would consider staying here for a leisure trip to Boston as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ne_quine
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently spent a week in the Copley Place Marriott and really enjoyed ourselves. Check in was a breeze esepcially after a long transatlantic flight and we were allocated a room on the 31st floor overlooking the Charles River. I wouldn't say the room was massive but there was enough room for the two of us for the week especially given the amount of luggage we had and the stuff we bought during the week! We had a wonderful maid on our floor, Ping, who kept the room brilliantly clean despite our attempts to undo her hard work! We ate at Champions Bar a few times during the week as it was a great place to watch sports, especially Game 7 of the Lakers v Celtics game where the atmosphere was superb. The prices were very reasonable given it was a hotel although we didn't buy breakfast here as we ate in the executive (concierge) lounge. A nice new plus is that Gold members now receive free internet which was a nice boost given this hotel didn't have a PC with internet in the lounge, so that saved me paying their charges or buying a PAYG dongle to use with my laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and Old”
Reviews.Author: Dad820
Reviews.Content: Despite two advance calls, at check in was told rooms were seven floors apart; Happy Father's Day! Reception was indifferent despite Platinum status. It was 1 am and I had two children but got a shrug and "you could stay elsewhere if you want.". Given it was 130a now, we stayed the night. Rooms are small and old, to match the cold staff I guess. This is a big meeting hotel and maybe impersonal is the mission. If so, they are pros.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously Overpriced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmtaggie05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but so overpriced, $450 for a double. I was traveling for work and paid the discount rate of $269 which was still way too much for this place. The rooms were old, nothing was updated. The breakfast in the hotel restaurant was about $18 per person and everything was swimming in butter. This was the crappiest Marriott I have ever stayed in. Your best bet is to stay across the river. It is about 2 miles from Copley Plaza. We moved there on our 3rd night and stayed at the Eliot Hotel. Beautiful hotel, I would receommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay-thank you!”
Reviews.Author: am10
Reviews.Content: From the check in desk to the drinks and room service this was a great hotel in a great location and everyone was lovely even though its was a hellish convention time for all.Try getting this level of service in Europe-haaaaa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Hotel and Great Room”
Reviews.Author: MaineMan2Maine
Reviews.Content: Wife and I took my sister and her husband for an overnight for her 50th. Got to the hotel early and rooms were ready. I asked for an upgrade and for 100.00 more we got a King bed with a separate living area, plus breakfast for 4 at Champions the next day. Breakfast buffet was very,very good...manager was very ,very rude. Room very modern and clean, bathroom a little but come seriously your in there a max of a half hour total. This hotel has access to Prudential stores ans short walk to Boylston for shops and dining. Train station also close by. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Modern, nice rooms, great views.”
Reviews.Author: pigletpuff
Reviews.Content: I stayed for only one night to tide me over until my five day reservation kicked in at Parker House. I was glad I did. It is a nice hotel and I agree with a previous post that it feels like a four star hotel. I was in room 2212 with an awesome view of the Charles. One of the great features is the location, right across the street from a 24-hour Shaw's grocery store with an amazing selection of groceries and sundries. I'm the kind of traveler who loves to have a nice grocery store nearby for incidentals and snacking and this place really fit the bill. The only unpleasant issue was that someone called me at 10am and said "sorry, but we're calling to check if you got your wake up call." Problem is, I didn't ask for a wake-up call. I commented about this when checking out and they waived the internet charge. Wireless WIFI is free in the lobby. In the rooms, an ethernet cable is provided and there is a $12.95 charge for use. There was a courtesy tray of chocolate cookies at check in which was nice. I totally would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Workers Are Not Nice”
Reviews.Author: Naptown2
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 4 nights. Location is great. Hotel is realatively clean. The only problem is that all the workers I encountered are rude. It is a bother for them to help. Everyone from the Hostess at Champions to the three different front desk workers I experienced to the concierge to The Starbucks employees (I know these are not Marriott employees, but if you are going to advertise, you have A Starbucks then you better make sure they are somewhat civilized. With all the choices you have in Boston, my advice is stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference a year makes”
Reviews.Author: Sbroadhog
Reviews.Content: There could not have been a more beautiful time to visit Boston for a mixture of business and leisure, We were traveling from Santa Barbara through Denver to arrive at Boston at rush hour. Many of the cabs are now hybrid, and it was a pleasurable ride from Logan, with tulips and trees in full bloom, to the Back Bay Marriott Copley Place. The moment we arrived everyone from the bellman to the front desk was extremely courteous and attentive. Last year at the same time of year the hotel had a homicide and we arrived a day or two later and nothing was smooth or enjoyable, especially since they were refurbishing, and fire alarms kept going off at all hours. This year they have there game together, with an excellent sports bar, Champions, at night, that converts to the best Marriott breakfast restaurant by day. The selections and service were top notch. The refurbishing out of the way the hotel sparkles and the rooms have better ventilation and comfortable beds. When the Back Bay is your destination, although a large hotel, the service was unmatched, the location was ideal, and the rooms have great views and are business friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lowest Common Denominator”
Reviews.Author: HarryfromLA
Reviews.Content: With all the great hotels in Boston, regretfully I don't think there's much reason to ever stay at the Marriott Copley Place. I chose it out of convenience since it was close to the Convention Center where I attended a meeting. In today's recession, very few hotels are worth $259/night (my "promotional" rate). For that, I got: - Long lines at check-in - Appalling $12.95/day for low-speed wi-fi internet (which was quickly and courteously waived at check-out) - Spotty cell service in my 6th floor, ballroom roof-view room - 1980's Colonial decor in the small room and smaller bathroom - Long enough walks to get everywhere outside the hotel that I might as well have stayed anywhere else to be equally conveniently located to my event Boston is a great town, and there has to be a better hotel room for that price or much less. To be fair, it wasn't all bad. - Newly renovated lobby which was bustling with activity - Immediate, enclosed access to vast Prudential Center shops which is especially good at night/in rain/cold - Within walking distance to the Convention Center, Boylston St., etc., though lots of hotels fit this bill - Consistently friendly and accommodating employees In the end, I deserved what I got. I didn't do my homework. I thought it would be easy, especially for one night. It simply wasn't the hotel for me, and I missed a great opportunity for an outstanding night somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Time to retrain the staff and management”
Reviews.Author: Fontaine
Reviews.Content: Decent enough hotel - location, rooms, bedding, TV, breakfast. The weakness is in the staff from rude (front desk, bellmen) to incompetent. Conceirge gave out incorrect information, took two hours to get bedding for a sofa bed, dinner trays left in the hall were not picked up by 9 the next morning - smelly, ugly sight. There is absolutely no excuse for a hotel to be run so poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler82560
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 1 night. The staff was accommodating, taking care of my requests. My room was very clean, no problems at all. I definitely plan on staying at this Marriott again. Nice location also, plenty of restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Copley Place - We're Comfortable Here Each Year”
Reviews.Author: overthehill35
Reviews.Content: My wife and I for each of the past several years have stayed at the Marriott Copley Place for several days during the Fall. All of our stays here have been pleasant and memorable. We've met many who are on the staff of the Marriott Copley and every one of them has been a genuinely nice person who handle their responsibility admirably. This is a good hotel for those arriving by car as it is easy to turn into their entrance from Huntington Avenue, on which they're located. The hotel is within easy walking distance to most of the places you'd like to see as a visitor. They are also attached to the Copley Place shopping promenade so one can visit about 100 shops without ever having to to out on the street. An up-to-date hotel that is very clean, attractive, friendly and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Boston”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: This Marriott was excellent. Clean, comfortable updated rooms, excellent concierge room, close to a grocery store and restaurants. Part of an enclosed mall - perfect for winter, when you don't want to venture outside in the cold. Tere is nothing I can fault this hotel with.

Reviews.Title: “This Marriott is Subpar with Bad Service and Questionable Safety”
Reviews.Author: Mattsaab
Reviews.Content: Hands down this was the worst major city Marriott we have ever stayed at. The photos of the standard room on Expedia and Marriottâ€™s Web site are very deceptive and do no reflect the tiny sized rooms and closet-sized bathrooms. The location is great, but there are many more choices. When asked to be moved to another room, the first three visits to the front desk were met with rudeness and an overall attitude of "I could care less." The decor in the rooms was also tired, worn and smelled like a retirement home. This property needs to be gutted and redone from top to bottom. To make matters worse, a high school group was allowed to take over the hotel, ruining the elevators, escalators and restaurants--all and all this is a bad hotel and should not be branded Marriott Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor security”
Reviews.Author: Murggy
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed here many many times. We've always had good experences before our last one. The rooms are nice and a great feature is that the hotel is attached to the Copley Place Mall. We were staying here on April 10th 2009 when a masseuse was murdered a floor below us by the "Craigs List Killer". I know that this can happen in any urban hotel but I have to say that there is unrestricted access from the mall into the hotel. Absolutely no security at all,nothing. Anyone can walk in from the mall and go right into the hotel unobserved. It's no different than a roadside motel where the doors of each room open onto a parking lot. In contrast, when we visited the Westin Hotel at the other end of the mall, everyone coming in from the mall had to pass in front of the front desk and bell captain stand and was scrutinized by hotel staff. In the future I will staying at the Westin. I would never stay at the Marriot again. I would not feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: IULynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel this week. The hotel is very nice. It is conveniently attached to the Prudential Center and Copley Place. The Prudential T stop is two blocks away. Convenient location to walk to shops on Newbury Street and Boston Common. We had a corner room on the 37th floor which had a great view of the city towards Fenway and Christian Science Plaza and a smaller window with a view of the Charles River. The room was clean. The bathroom had a generous counter that was big enough for all our toiletries. The fitness center was recently redone and was as good as my gym at home (all Precor machines with individual TV's). We had pool to ourselves every night. We only paid $90 a night using Marriott's Price Match Guarantee and it was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent quality and frendliness year after year”
Reviews.Author: roblinick
Reviews.Content: The Copley Place Marriott is one of my favorite hotels in Boston. They gave the place a facelift last year and the public areas are very nice. You can't beat the location for shopping, restaurants and night life. It's all outside the front door. Champion's is their sports bar/restaurant and it is beautiful. Plenty of TV's, great bartenders and wait staff, good food and great times. The rooms don't have much personality, but they are very clean and comfortable. All in all a good choice in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: lawdogs1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Mariott Copley Place on business. The room was comfortable and clean - the lobby and bar areas well appointed. Connected to both Copley Place and the Prudential - so able to walk around and shop. There are also restaurants that you can get to by walking through the maze of the mall areas, which isnt the most unique way to go - but is a great choice for a female business traveler like me who always has personal safety in mind. Nice lounge area - sports bar with big screens for watching sports. Starbucks on site. Wireless internet is a charge here - even in the lobby. This location is excellent - close to Newbury Street - the T and other back bay locations. Concierge lounge well stocked for both evening drinks and dessert, as well as breakfast in the morning. Although the rooms and decor are really nothing special in terms of luxury, I would stay here again, especially if traveling for business and needed this location as a base.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not really anything special”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a conference. When I checked in at 4:30, they had no rooms available. After waiting a half hour, I finally got a room on a low floor. The view wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. The room was OK but nothing spectacular, noise from the hallway was pretty loud though. Location is great if your event is at the Hynes Center but it's really awful if you're at the Boston Convention Center. The charge of $12.95 a night for Internet is ridiculous. I probably would not stay here again as there as plenty of other good hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Angiebelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Copley for business and leisure with my spouse. I have to say this was a wonderful hotel! The location was fantastic and the rooms were great! The beds were absolutely heaven! The service was also wonderful, they were very helpful with billing issues and any questions we had. I also liked that the hotel was connected to a mall and the T, which made it easy to travel without paying for a taxi. The hotel is within walking distance to downtown, the library and the Boston Commons area. I truly can't say enough about this place. It was a relaxing and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sleepyjuli
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. You don't even have to go outside to get to the subway or to the Prudential and Copley malls. Our room was very nice, larger than I was expecting. I know a lot of times this hotel is very crowed because of conventions, etc, but it was not the case while I was there. I was very satisfied. I would say the only negative point is the parking prices, but that is to be expected in Bosto

Reviews.Title: “Average for Boston, good location”
Reviews.Author: golfersc
Reviews.Content: This is pretty much your basic hotel room for downtown Boston. The reason I chose it was for the location and ease of parking being in the city, garage is attetched. The room was well maintained, clean and we had a great view of the Prudential with it's Christmas lights and south from the 32nd floor. The buildng part of an inddor mall which was great considering that it averaged 25 degrees while there. The mall was the best way to find free internet connections, since the hotel charged $12/day, and it offered a great variety of fast food and decent restaurants along wiht climate conmtrolled shopping. The hotel was also a short walk to a T station, Boston Common and Public Gardens, Symphony Hall and many other historic landmarks and sites. The only negatives were that the bathroom lights were not very bright, the room was very diffucult to fit in the rollaway that we needed, the mattress was not the new Marriott pillow top that we expected and the concierge was not knowledgable as to what would be open to eat on both Christmas eve and day. The location did outweigh the negatives so I would stay again for just one night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Central”
Reviews.Author: Oryctolagus
Reviews.Content: Went on shopping trip and stayed in this hotel, lovely and clean, concierge was very helpful. Nice lively bar with good fast food ... The tower of food has to be tried!! It was yum.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; small room”
Reviews.Author: ScarboroughFoodie
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome - convenient to Newbury Street, Fenway Park, and connected to a shopping at Copley Plaza. Starbucks in the lobby is good for our morning coffee fix. The room was very small though. Barely enough room for the two full size beds (which is hard with 2 kids and 2 adults) and not much room to move around.

Reviews.Title: “Very Adequate”
Reviews.Author: UCONN_Fan
Reviews.Content: The Marriott at Copley Square is decent city hotel. There are some positives and some negatives but overall is a good choice if you need to stay in the Copley square back bay area. Positives: Very good location â€“ easy indoor access to the Prudential Center, Hynes Convention Center, Copley Place shopping Clean room â€“ comfortable bed Negatives: Regular rooms are somewhat smaller and out of date compared to other nearby hotels $13 charge for the internet $42 charge for valet parking If you are looking for a luxury hotel this is not the best choice. This hotel is a very typical city hotel that will adequately meet the needs of business travelers as well as those traveling on pleasure. If you are looking to stay in a hotel with indoor access to the convention center, Prudential Center and/or Copley Place I would shop around for the best rate at the Sheraton, Hilton or the Marriott and pick the one with the best rate. Your experience will be pretty much the same. The Westin is a step above these hotels but usually has higher rates. If you donâ€™t mind a 3 min walk Iâ€™d also recommend dropping off your bags at the hotel and then park at the garage at 100 Clarendon (look it up on-line). We arrived on Friday evening after 5 and left at Sunday afternoon and paid $27. This compared to $82 for valet or $70 to park yourself at the hotel garage

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Service. Highly Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer097
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Boston Marriott Copley Place was a very enjoyable experience. The location to the nearby convention was excellent. The service was great and the view was beautiful... I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Below par”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGirl1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and rooms are comfortable, staff is fine. My complaint is that there is only one restaurant, and that is a super, super noisy sports bar. I was there for a convention and people who wanted to have serious business conversations or catch up with old friends could not find a place to sit and talk or have a quiet, decent dinner. A real disappointment. Great place to be if you want to shop till you drop as it is attached to two indoor malls, and come back to the hotel to watch football. Because believe me, you will have to HEAR football all through dinner whether you like it or not. Will never stay there again. And, they charge $13 day to plug in your laptop to the internet, and there is no wi fi unless you go to the business center! Unbelievable, in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “decent enough”
Reviews.Author: douji
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner and some friends for a conference. Although the lobby and the conference center floors were constantly crowded, the service we experienced was swift and polite and our room on the 32nd floor was pleasant, clean and quiet. The place doesn't have much character though, and the only spectacular thing to report would be one of my friends getting a free upgrade to a suite - although it was just as bland as the standard rooms, only bigger. The curious lack of free Internet service is a definite downside, but the location seemed pretty good to me.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - convenient for conference center but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: company_vp
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel conveniently for Copley square shops and connected to the Hynes Convention Center by a covered walkway. Negatives aspects of my stay were a mattress that sagged in the middle, a maid who did not vacuum for several days while I was there (crumbs from my muffin stayed where they were) and bell staff who were unhelpful on arrival. On the plus side, I really liked the large swimming pool and hot tub. Overall, I thought it was an average, high volume, anonymous convention orientated hotel where a guest is treated pretty indifferently.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: janegf
Reviews.Content: We arrived to our room and were greeted by the smell of vomit. Soon discovered the smell came from the hall right outside our room, rather than inside, which smelled fine after the offensive odor dissipated. Phoned housekeeping for help. Two hours later, no help. Phoned again, and they never phoned to say that they had been by to clean, but upon leaving the room it now smelled like carpet fresh powder AND vomit. As it was late and once inside the room it was ok, we stayed in the room and the hotel was able to move us to another room the next day. Throughout the hotel it smelled of carpet powder, rather than actual cleanliness. The hotel has supposed to have undergone a renovation, which isn't apparent in the rooms other than the new granite counters. The room decor screams 80s hunting lodge with a blend of plaids, paisleys, stripes and solids in hunter green, burgundy and yellow. Wow! Your designers can mix colors and patterns--only it's rather garish as opposed to pleasing. The newly renovated lobby doesn't look sleek and modern, it just looks bland.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: Kreta99
Reviews.Content: I have NEVER IN MY LIFE slept in a more comfortable bed. If I could have I would have bought it and brought it home with me! It was unbelievable! Also the breakfast was fantastic,especially the omelets made "to your liking". And the staff was very serviceminded. I will absolutely stay here again...and so should you :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: lhj7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Copley for a conference. The rooms were nice and spacious. But there is no wireless access in the hotel accept for the lobby/lounge area. For a conference hotel, this is appalling if you ask me. You have to pay $13 a day for a cable modem connection. The gym was very nice, with updated equipment and fruit for after your workout. But get there early, as it gets crowded quickly. Food was decent in the lounge but with the amount of great restaurants in the connecting malls, I'd say venture out. Daily Grill in the Prudential Mall is great. and a little spot call Cafeteria which is about 3 blocks away had a GREAT breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Not the most personable staff, but great for a business stay”
Reviews.Author: peacefrogdog
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to get a lot of traffic, with people checking in and out for various conferences given its connection and proximity to the conference center. Having said that, things were never so bad that elevators were crowded or check in lines were long. But the overall feel seemed hectic in the lobby area because there was a sports-bar-restaurant one floor above (that looked down over the lobby) and the walkway to the nearby mall area and convention center was on the 2nd floor. Concierge seemed pleasant and helpful although I didn't need to ask them much. No problems getting a cab, and the airport was only around a 15 min drive away (~ $25). The room itself was nice and clean with great views. no complaints there. Had a quick glimpse of the pool and gym areas - seemed to have nice equipment but with the sheer size of the hotel I wonder how crowded they would be in the mornings. Easy access to Starbucks, a supermarket right across the street and nice walking areas and shopping nearby. Overall would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel for people who don't care about hotels”
Reviews.Author: GrantParish
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Copley Place is a convention hotel. There is no reason to stay there unless you are attending a meeting. It is a warehouse for people. The most pedestrian decor I have seen in a major chain hotel in a while - not even a whiff of style. The lobby is dominated by a huge "open air" sports bar with multiple massive screens. The hotel entrance is also the mall entrance so there was a huge crowd coming and going all the time. The front desk and bell staff seemed frazzled and inattentive. Other than the sports bar, there is no restaurant so we had to go out even for breakfast. Apparently they also have a rat problem. I was early for a meeting in one of the ballrooms on the 4th floor and arrived while the room was still being set up and found the back corner of the room was filled with baited mouse traps. When I returned later, a folding door had been closed blocking off the corner and obscuring any pest control activities from view. Since there was a convention in town when I was there and space was tight, the rates were high. The "discounted" conference rate I paid was $342.20 after taxes. For this princely rate, I had a plain room with a tiny bath. The one really nice feature in the room was the bed - very comfortable, lots of pillows, and you didn't even have to ask to get the sheets changed daily. The location is great but at the other end of the same block (via the interior mall) is the Westin - so for the about the same price in nearly the same location you can have a much more upscale experience and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ZAGSRULE
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night at this hotel and were very pleased. We really liked the location as it was close to the subway, attached to a mall with high-end stores, and across the street from a grocery store. It also has a great sports bar attached. The room was very big with a great view of the water. It was clean and the staff were great. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It also had an outstanding gym and pool/hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Marriott Platinum - This is the Worst Marriott I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: BeachyLady411
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a recent conference. The hotel is busier than Grand Central Station, and the service is horrible. Waited 20 minutes to checkin. Room service arrived cold and order was incorrect. Screwed up my receipt. Forgot toothpaste and called for two hours to have them deliver it - the giftshop was out and they told me to walk across the street the the supermarket. I travel on business every week and have never written a review on a business trip - but this place was bad. I stay in Marriotts almost exclusively so I know what to expect - this one missed the mark by a long shot.

Reviews.Title: “The way to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: 1pamd
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Comfortable, Convienent, Clean. All you need while in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A little nervous at first, but hotel was a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Dallas1972
Reviews.Content: Being my first trip to Boston, I was very nervous about choosing this hotel because it was not decidedly positioned in the very heart of the tourist area. As a matter of fact, I am completely glad I choose the Marriott, both, because of its location (which proved to be ideal and more upscale than I expected,) as well as, its appealing appointments and amenities. We enjoyed not having the heavy foot traffice out front, while being only a few minutes from the major attractions and EXTREMELY easy and efficient train system. I would definately stay at this hotel again for several reasons. One, I love having the Galleria mall attached. Its a great, free distraction; and I loved have a full service grocery right across the street (I must have my water, etc for the room without paying high hotel premiums for it.) Finally, this is the tallest building in the area so its very easy to find after dark and the views could not be beat!!

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A VIEW!”
Reviews.Author: JL7869
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriends to Marriott Copley Thursday night for my best friends birthday to surprise her... and I was the one who wound up surprised! I work in hospitality in the area and was amazed with our stay here. Paula at the front desk was exceptionally friendly and welcoming. After telling her it was a birthday stay, she put us on the 36th floor in a corner room with a view of everything!!! The beds were like sleeping on clouds and it was awesome to watch the planes take off from bed in the morning! Bellmen/valets could be a bit friendlier though- since I wasn't valet parking with them because I have a garage pass for the area, they weren't too interested in helping us out. Sad.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in much nicer hotels for a lot less money”
Reviews.Author: mgray9999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights while attending a conference. The price was quite high ($249 conference rate) for the value of room. I had stayed at a Hilton Hotel two weeks ago in a small city and the quality, comfort and size of the room was far better than this room at one half of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing horrible, but nothing extrodinary either”
Reviews.Author: delilah1310
Reviews.Content: Marriott Copley Place is up to the standard one would expect for a business hotel in a big city like Boston. My room was spacious, pillow and bed comfortable. Didn't try the restaurant but room service was pretty good. The elevators can be somewhat slow, but with a place this size, that is to be expected. My only criticism, really, is some of the bell staff. No one helped me with my luggage as I was getting out of a cab to check-in, and another time I had to hunt someone down to call a cab. But all in all, it is a nice, clean, hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dsegers1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so centrally located to everything we wanted to do. We could walk to Fenway Park, the duck tour boats were right outside, fabulous restaurants attached in the mall and the rooms are clean and comfy. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Conference”
Reviews.Author: greedyflynh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Marriott during a conference that was also held within the hotel conference section. As always, Marriotts are never a disappointment. The hotel was booked, however, they were able to accomodate me with a one of their newly renovated 34th floor suites. The room was very nice and the view was grand. This new suite had a murphy bed, which is a bed that folds down from the wall. I was nervous at first. However, the bed was very comfortable. And I had a great night sleep. I will not hesitate to stay again at this Marriott. The only draw back to staying at a Marriott is that they do not offer free Internet. Which is odd - since the Courtyard typically does.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-worked perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Anaps
Reviews.Content: We came to Boston to visit friends and used points to stay here. We thought this Mariott was totally fine, your average Mariott. The location is what makes this hotel so great. The hotel was bustling with conferences and college football fans and there was a great mall attached. We found the service at the front desk very friendly. Our room was a handicap accessible room so the bathroom was oversized as was part of the bedroom. Overall it was a nice weekend and the hotel worked out perfectly for us.

Reviews.Title: “Schocking staff behaviour”
Reviews.Author: bugaboophil
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel on a regular basis and this is your typical Marriott in looks and feel. Nothing to be excited about it. What really shocked me on this occasion was the way I was treated by one of their staff while using their gym. I had barely started to work out when one of the staff cleaning the floor stopped and told me in a very aggressive tone to stop dropping weights as it was very noisy. I thought it was some kind of joke but no. He said there was a conference downstairs and I was too noisy and that the weights were obviously too heavy for me. He told me very to stop or he would call security. I could not believe my ears. Calling security? Where was I? In a 4 star hotel or in jail? I have been training for more than 15 years and know about gym etiquette and would never drop weights in an inconsiderate way. It is a gym not a library and it is meant to be noisy every now and then. I was so gobsmacked that I left and went to the Front desk and had a word with one of their managers. Don't think they will do anything about it. I have been travelling extensively for the last 15 years and cannot recall being treated in such a disrespectful manner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and sports bar”
Reviews.Author: kristi11876
Reviews.Content: I cannot stress how excellent the location of this hotel is; easy access to the T and within walking distance of so many shops and restaurants. The staff was very helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable. Also, Champions, the sports bar is AMAZING. Over 40 plasmas, a gigantic projection tv , and excellent food/drinks. I cannot wait to stay at this Marriott again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghGraemekidd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times.Staff always pleasant and willing to help.Rooms decent size and have all mod cons..Good buffet or ala carte breakfast.Pool and gym ok.The hotel public areas are being revamped at the moment so there is a little disturbance but no noise heard from guest floors.The sushi bar was always worth a visit.The hotel is joined on to a mall so is handy for shopping and has all usual big American name shops.Mall also contains good food court and a Wagamamas which is a relatively new British owned noodle bar!Never had cause to complain at The Copley.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THE COPLEY MARRIOTT, ALWAYS HAVE GREAT SERVICE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sabrinacat
Reviews.Content: We always come to the Copley Marriott when visiting Boston, whether it is with the kids or just adults, we always stay here, it is centrally located, clean and the staff rocks... oh and so does the chowder.. we've been coming here for years and have never had a bad experience... love copley!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base for a visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: nikki2007England
Reviews.Content: The hotel was what you would expect from a good quality Marriott style hotel. The rooms were large and clean. Our room was on the 26th floor and the views over Boston were great. The hotel is attached to a shopping centre with loads of eating options so on the days we were feeling a bit jet lagged you could just grab something to eat really fast. The Duck Tours also go from right oposite the entrance to the hotel and I think that the Trolley tours call at the hotel as well (though we didn't use them). The buffett style breakfast in the hotel was not too unreasonably priced and the quality of the food was very good. But the best thing about this hotel was its central location, very well placed for accessing all the sights and also near to an underground station which made trips around Boston and to Cambridge very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok hotel.”
Reviews.Author: aorton
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this Marriott. The hotel is just an average Marriott property. It was clean. We only encountered staff members at check-in and she was friendly. The hotel's location is great for shopping and dinning. It is also an easy walk to Beacon Hill and The Commons. Backbay subway stop is about a block from the hotel's lobby, making the hotel very accessible to all areas of Boston. Although we didn't encounter any problems during our stay, I'm not sure that I would stay here again. There are many other hotels in Boston in the same price range that are not only nicer, but have staff that go out of their way to welcome you. Plus it's location, between two shopping malls, does feel a little odd when you are in the lobby area and elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, about what I expected”
Reviews.Author: chbruce
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty much what I expected for a Marriott in the middle of Boston. Nice location -- shopping center right across the street. It's a very large hotel, and the elevators can take some time. My view from the 30th floor was very nice. Main complaint would be the very high cost of internet access (I think it was $15 for wired internet from the room). Other than that, everything was as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here...”
Reviews.Author: viajeelmundo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business with a corporate rate of $170/night which seems very reasonable for a big city like Boston. Hotel is generally filled with business travelers. It is located across the street from the train station and has direct access to a large shopping center. The room was large with a nice city view of Boston. The bathrooms are small and awkardly configured. The toilet is too close to the door. They need to be remodeled completely! Also, housecleaning needs to do a better job. My bathroom had significant amounts of hair in the sink and some in the tub. Currently, they are doing construction in the lobby area, so its dusty and messy. Also, they were checking the elevators and they were not functioning at certain times of the day for fire alarm inspections. All of it was very annoying. Took a taxi to eat near the sights and every cab ride was on average about $12-15/one way

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service, Rude front desk and excessive charges !”
Reviews.Author: Subrotham
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Copley Marriott for almost a week. There are no services offered despite the high charges. NO internet services unless one pays extra in this day and age !! Even the smaller hotels and hostels in Boston apparently were offering Internet services. The front desk was very rude to say the least...appalling for any kind of hospitality services not to speak of a hotel of this scale. They laugh off your queries almost making fun of you ! and the final icing on the cake was a sudden appearance of a security Guard at your hotel room at about 9 PM asking you to report to the front desk immediately for they had some weird problem with the Credit card. We were told that we had to go with him immediately or else he would stay at the door till we comply ...sounded like being at the Police station !! Afterwards on reaching dowstairs (27 floors) we were told that all was well and that they had some initial problem with the card !! This I thought was a very rude behaviour from the staff overall when facilities were available to call us on the phone or even sort it out at a more suitable time !! The swimming pool/GYM / Jacuzzi faicilities for a big hotel of this size looked to be of a miniature size !!

Reviews.Title: “This costly hotel leaves much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: rapod
Reviews.Content: I stay in Marriott hotels almost exclusively, and I find this hotel to be inferior in almost every regard. Granted, the location is excellent and the Champion restaurant and sports bar is very good, but there are many aspects of this hotel that are unacceptable for such a costly property. There are extra fees for everything. If you arrive at night, the valet parking ($40.00) will most likely be filled and you will be forced to park in the Copley Place mall parking. There is an hourly rate for that parking structure and can cost well in excess of $50.00 per day if you take your car out even once. The hotel fails to tell you that you can get a validation in the mall that will reduce the cost (albeit slightly). The internet charge is $12.95/day and if you want to use your computer in the restaurant or other areas of the hotel, you have to pay an additional charge or go to the Sheraton where it is free (according to Marriott personnel). We took a red eye flight from California and they could not accommodate an early check-in, but assured us that they would call us as soon as a room became available...let me say that the call never came. I didn't find most of the concierge staff to be friendly although they were, in general, competent. In addition, the hotel is in need of renovation. The carpet was stained, the furniture nicked and the "grips" in the bathtub were dark and in general looked unclean. The furnishings are very plain and the room was not particularly attractive. In general, this hotel is neither typical of the quality I expect from Marriott nor worth the cost. I don't understand why this hotel has received such high ratings...this hotel has only one thing going for it...location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but a great location with food and shopping galore”
Reviews.Author: JKlassic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights while I attended a conference for work. The location is great for business travelers, shopping, and attractions. We had a corner room which was an unusual shape. Our room had a nice, large flat-screen tv with several high-definition channels, but the tv was tucked away in a corner and difficult to view from most of the room (I think on account of the room shape). Our room seemed pricey for a conference rate, but after checking, any decent hotel in Boston is in the $150-$200 range. I probably would not have stayed here on my own, unless I got a much better rate. The conference facilities were very nice, although spread over three floors. Fortunately, there are several escalators in a large atrium, which makes accessing the various conference facilities very easy. The hotel is linked to two shopping malls, one of them upscale. There are also plenty of restaurants nearby (try the crabcakes at Legal Seafood!). Also, if you venture out into the neighborhood, there are several nice shops and restaurants within a few blocks' walk to Boylston Street and Newbury Street. Be sure to walk the extra block over to Newbury, as it turned out to be full of quaint shops and restaurants in some very neat old buildings. The hotel is also close to Copley Square and the beautiful Trinity Church. Finally, the Duck Tours board right across the street (also highly recommended) and there is also a large Shaw's grocery store across from the hotel. My only complaints about the Marriott were 1) charging extra for in-room Internet access. While we were checking in, someone else was complaining to the front desk and asking to have the charges removed from their bill. This service is an extra $12.95 a day and considering the cost to stay here, should be included. We stayed at five other less expensive hotels on this trip, and NONE charged for Internet service! I was able to pick up some weak unsecured wireless networks in our room, but barely enough signal to check e-mail; and 2) for all of the elevators in this hotel, waits for an elevator were often long and then the elevators were often full to capacity. Otherwise, the Marriott Copley Place is a very nice hotel in a very nice area of Boston with access to plenty of attractions to keep you busy for days.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: night_traveler1
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. excellent location and a friendly front desk. I had asked for a room with a view and we got a really nice view of the harbor. our room was very clean. I'm very happy we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: ct3408
