We had Easter Lunch at Upper Crust since many places in Little Italy had special menus or weren't open yet (never made it to Giaccomo's due to timing on our part). I loved Upper Crust's pizza. And we also ate lunch one day in Little Italy at Caffe della Sport (it was very, very good...paninis and pizza and very good). Finally, we ate dinners at The Pourhouse (on Boylston and maybe ten min walk from hotel). It is a pub, and we had good wraps, wings and cheesesteaks. Dark though and the service wasn't great. I would go again, because of the size of the menu and the proximity to the hotel, but it wasn't "all that". Firefly was AWESOME. It is on Dartmouth and literally twenty yards maybe from a mall entrance (so you aren't outside for very long if you walk through the mall). I had Pumpkin Lasagna (!), my daughter had the special (ravioli---very good), and the steak was good as well. I enjoyed that restaurant a lot. Easy to get to, quick, efficient and good service. JP Licks was endured since we walking Newbury Street and just had to stop in for some odd flavored ice creams (we just had to). We had gelato in Quincy Market, and of course we ate many cannoli's in Mike's Pastry. We also gave in to one other chain and had cheesecake in bed from the Cheesecake Factory. I hope this helps a bit...email me with any questions. I have enjoyed reading Trip Advisor and hope to be able to help others, like I have been helped along the way from other reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: akeezer
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed at a suite in the Copley Marriott while we went about our Christmas shopping. Even though it was one of the busiest times for the hotel, we did show up 3 hours early and the quickly brought us to our room which had been waiting for us for several hours (not too often you can book into a hotel earlier than requested). The hotel was amazing clean, pool was clean, restaurant was clean, upscale and they had live entertainment (piano player who was quite good). The only thing I would suggest is to stay with what you know on the menu. I was taking by the small portions in relation to the price. I paid $45US for a glass of wine and 6 pieces of cheese thinking it was going to be something that could tie me over for a bit. I recommend going to the Hard Rock Cafe. We ate at an Italian restaurant (can't remember the name but it was the only Italian restaurant on Clinton Street) a few doors down as well which was also amazing (probably the best meal I had while I was in Boston). The Cambridge Galleria is a must for people who shop. Also Macy's. We lucked out because Filenes was closing its doors (because Macys purchased them) so we found some spectacular deals. Also, check out the Quincy Market, some sporting events, they have great museums, China Town. All in all The Copley was the place to stay because it was so central to everything and the service was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel: hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: dom_nique
Reviews.Content: This hotel truly is hard to fault. I stayed here for four nights in February. The location is hard to beat- in the heart of the Back Bay area, about 15 minutes walk to downtown along lovely streets with lots of shops and restaurants close by. There is a Subway stop very close to the hotel. The nice thing about the hotel is its connection to two shopping centres (Copley Place and Prudential Centre): if it`s raining or snowing, you don't even have to step outside. You could litterally spend days in this huge complex, shopping in mid to high level stores and eating at the numerous restaurants (mostly food court type of places but also a good number of "sit down" restaurants). I took a cab from the aiport to the hotel, which cost about $40 (note that although the hotel is actually very close to the airport, there is a $12 toll fee for every car driving through the Logan Aiport and this is added on to your cab fare). At the end of my stay, I returned to the airport via shuttle bus, just as quick as a cab and only cost $15. The shuttle leaves the hotel for the airport every 20 minutes. Check in was very quick and easy. My room was located on the 26th floor. The room was a good size and absolutely spotless. There's a refrigerator in the room, so that was quite handy for keeping my water bottles cool. The best part of the room? The bed! It had a pillow-top mattress and was very comfortable. I slept like a baby (also helped that the room was very quiet- I was not once disturbed by noise in other rooms or in the hallway). Service at the hotel was very good. The concierge was quite helpful as was front desk personnel. I asked for a late check-out (flight in late afternoon) and this was no problem whatsoever. There's a Starbucks on the second floor which was handy. I had the breakfast buffet one morning at the restaurant on the 2nd floor. Although a tad pricey (about $20) it was worth it. I'm not usually a fan of buffet anything (usually large quantities of disgusting food) but the food was actually really good. I didn't have dinner at the hotel but ate a few times in some restaurants in the Copley and Prudential Centre. Legal Seafood- pretty good for a chain-type restaurant, nice atmosphere, great service and decent seafood. California Pizza Kitchen- give this a miss- worst pizza I've ever eaten. PF Chang's China Bistro- not bad, not great. There were several good restaurants just outside the hotel as well. Overall, this was a great hotel to stay in and I would definitely return. My only complaint was having to wait a while for the elevator on occasion (but the hotel was fully booked with a huge conference going on during my stay so that was to be expected).

Reviews.Title: “excellent convenient location”
Reviews.Author: KP58
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference- second visit to Boston and this hotel- and would highly recommend it. This is a wonderful part of Bosotn to stay- Back Bay- with plenty of choices of restaurants not too far and very convenient for the T to get around. Breakfast is absolutely fanstastic though I've never been able to figure out how they come up with the cost as it varied from day to day even though I always had the same thing more or less.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: My review will be short compared to previous hotel reviews. I would say that it's mainly because I don't have much more to say beyond what others have already said. Five of us shared a room on the 24th floor, facing the river, and really enjoyed the hotel. I do agree that the lobby was a bit chaotic. My other gripe would be that the elevator situation just was not great. There was an AAS (I believe) conference at the hotel the same weekend we were there and at one point we had to wait about 20mins for an elevator. It seemed like only 4 of the 6 elevators to the 1st 26 floors were working and it was really a pain to get up to our room. Also with 5 people in the room we showed up in our room that had 2 double beds to find 2 towels. That's just a silly number of towels for a room with 2 beds. My other complaint would be the collection of beer caps under the beds and the two 40oz Corona bottles behind the curtains. That to me either says they didn't clean very well, or the maids were getting drunk in our room?? (2nd part is more of a *wink**wink*). Other than those issues, the hotel was really nice. The ability to walk via Skywalks to places in the area was really convenient since we were there in February & it was quite cold. Also, the Shaw's grocery store across the street from the hotel was really convenient for picking up snacks, bottled water, etc. I'd definitely choose the same location again, probably even the same hotel. The T line stops were very close. We actually avoided the sky-high parking at the hotel by parking off of the Orange line on our way in from Manchester Airport. Everything went well, definitely a good deal for Boston. The rate was even good for a hotel in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: cbus77
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was near perfect. We walked all over the city from the hotel. The Freedom Trail starts close to the hotel. If you enjoy history, this is a must. In the evening, we caught a Sox game. The hotel was very clean. The staff was courteous and very helpful. When we go back to Boston, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: rgd1227
Reviews.Content: Okay, here's the deal...I loved this place...I had some friends in from out of town and we were in the city to ya know throw down and I wanted to treat them well so I booked the Marriot Copley...The place is gorgeous inside and out, and I especially loved to front foyer when you walk in, 3 tier level combined with a mall/shops and a nice pub down on the first floor the rooms were above average and the prce is standard to better than avg. for boston... great views of the city from the upper levels... hotel staff was excellent, the lobby generously found us a hard to find 6 person minivan cab... all told i loved it and will stay there again in the future

Reviews.Title: “***Absolutely wonderful experience!!****”
Reviews.Author: welovethemarriott
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the BMCP. My husband and I were traveling with our 11 month old son who had some appointments at Boston Children's Hospital. We always do some research before booking our hotels and found this one to have great reviews. We had a wonderful experience here. We had a corner room on the 17th floor and had a nice view of the city. The internet connection was good and the room itself was very spacious. The bathroom seemed a little smaller than most hotels, but still very nice. The beds are super comfy too! The staff was very helpful with the baby. They brought up a baby bed with the works (crib, bumper pad, sheets, baby blankets, etc.) They also brought us a warmer to use for the baby's milk. We really appreciated this. I believe this is the cleanest place we have ever stayed. The housekeeping is superb. Each day we were out, we came back to a very clean room with fresh bed linens and fresh towels. As we walked down the hallway to our room, my husband and I always commented on how clean it smelled. The staff is very nice also. Check in was very smooth. We are not sushi people, but food from the sushi bar looked and smelled very good too. One important reason we decided to stay in the Back Bay area was to be close to restaurants, shopping, etc. Since we had an infant, we needed things to be as hassle free as possible. We also didn't want to have to drag the baby in and out of the cold so the walkway to the Prudential and Copley malls were nice. We did eat at Legal's Seafood (at the Prudential.) It was very good. I had calamari for the first time and it was very delicious. We also ate at the food court quite a bit inside the Prudential and the variety was very nice. Having a grocery store across the street was nice as well, since there is only one snack machine (on the 31st floor) in the entire hotel which was usually empty. There are soda machines on every floor though. The only thing we didn't like was the elevators. There are plenty of them with hardly no wait, but only some of them go to floors 1-27. The others go to higher levels and didn't go to our room level (on the 17th floor.) We accidentally got on the wrong one and had a difficult time getting back to the right one. We had it down pat by our second day. This was a little bit confusing. But other than that, we loved this place and definitely plan on staying here again when we return for more appointments. The room service is fantastic, too! We didn't have any problems with getting transportation to the hospitals or airport! We highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to the Boston area!! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: sunrisewatcher74
Reviews.Content: It was a bittersweet experience at the BMCP.The hotel itself is a sorta of skyscaper close to the Prudential center and our room on 27th floor had a stunning view but the room looks a little bit old and the walls were incredibly thin that you have to put earplugs on if you don't want to listen to every single word said in the nearby room.However the room was very clean and the beds comfortable;plenty of eating places are available because the hotel shares a part of the building with the Prudential mall so you can simply go out from the elevator and find every eating place you like.The real nightmare was the pool/fitness center room:instead of relaxing you can easily losing temper going there because tons of children, accompanied by careless parents, ran around the pool and the jacuzzi diving into both of them simply forcing us to going out.The most disappointing thing is that nobody checked the situation so the rudeness domineered.Anyway I do think that the Radisson was a much better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jetsetMar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for 4 days and I was very happy about it. The rooms are clean and well-appointed. Everything you need is within easy access including a starbucks, business center and walkway to Copley Mall. Great since it snowed while I was there and never had to go outside. We walked to Newbury street, trinity church and all the way to Quincy Market. I recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of Copley Square”
Reviews.Author: mony1mony1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with lots to do. Hotel lobby is located in between Copley Place and The Prudential, which means shoppers heaven!. We had a corner room and the view of Boston was spectacular. They also run very good deals at this hotel, especially for Marriott Rewards members. We got our corner room on the 23rd floor for just $129! For sushi lovers, you must try the Philadelphia Roll at the sushi bar in the lobby. My husband is a sushi fanatic & he says it is some of the best he's ever had, anywhere! The Cheesecake Factory food was terrible, but the Banana Cream Cheesecake was fabulous. Skip the meal here and just go for dessert! Also, just a 5 minute walk to Copley Station Green Line. Trust me, that is the station you want to pick up the T. It is very safe to travel in Boston on the Green & Red Lines. Stay away from the Orange Line (on the MBTA). It's a little shady.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boston”
Reviews.Author: onekstar
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful experience here, just loved everything about this place., great hotel, so close to everything! A must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cloud Nine Marriott Copley”
Reviews.Author: callieq
Reviews.Content: High up on the 23rd floor in a corner room, you feel like you are actually on cloud nine. Hint- Ask for a corner room, we were told they were a little bigger. The bed was wonderfully placed facing the window. The white linens added to the cloud nine experience. The pool and jacuzzi are just what the doctor ordered, as well as the workout room which was equipped with up to date machines. Champions, the bar/ restaurant downstairs was packed due to the Pats 16-0 game. nachos were decent. Prices were high. But what do you expect, it's the city. It's connected to the mall which is always great. And, if you need water or some snacks head over the the Shaws market across the street. Marriott Copley was a great experience! I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone. I know at certain times, this hotel can be pricey, so if you get the chance, (paid w. AAA $149 + tax) go for it! Have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: JoMark
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay at Marriott Copley Place - I travelled with my wife and her parents to spend Christmas in Boston and we all absolutely loved it. It was my in-laws' first time in the USA - suffice to say that Boston made a sufficiently good impression for them to be considering returning there next year ! As for the Marriott, I would recommend it on a number of fronts. Firstly, location. We arrived to heavy snow - a wonderful way to arrive and very atmospheric at Christmas time, but a bit of a pain to navigate on foot. This is where the Marriott location excels - right in centre of Back Bay with easy access to T stations and connected to 2 malls - upscale Copley Place and the Prudential centre. This meant, despite the cold, we could shop & dine without the need for a coat. Our allocated rooms were on the 35th floor and we were lucky enough to be in a corner room - with fantastic views of the Prudential Tower, Hancock Tower, city and Charles river views. I'd recommend asking for a room on a high floor for this reason. There are also dedicated lifts for floors 27 and above, so we didn't encounter any of the delays reported in previous reviews. Previous reviews have commented on the quality of the beds and I absolutely agree. Boston's a fantastic city with lots to see and do, but it was difficult at times to leave the supreme comfort of the Marriott beds !!! Staff were also very friendly and professional and the breakfast buffet (included in our rate) was good, with a great eggs station. Only slight downside is that no special effort was made on Christmas day - the breakfast buffet was the normal fare with no variation and most of the hotel dining options closed for the day, so unless you wanted to spend Christmas Day in the (rather loud) Champions Sports Bar, you had to find alternatives. It wasn't a major issue for us - we enjoyed a leisurely breakfast, a stroll through Boston Common and the Public Gardens, found a nice bar en-route back to hotel (Sola's), then headed to Legal Seafoods for Christmas dinner. In summary, I'd thoroughly recommend the Marriott Copley Place - it's a huge hotel, so it's unreasonable to expect personal service (in addition th the sheer size of the hotel, the fact that it's connected to 2 major malls, means it also gets a lot of through traffic), but that aside, the rooms are extremely comfortable, the facilities and staff great and the location is perfect - easy access to all the sights, the option of staying indoors if the weather is inclement and great sound insulation both from other rooms and outside. Well done Marriott - I certainly intend to return - hopefully sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCDottie63
Reviews.Content: I flew up from DC to see a show and wanted a hotel in close proximity to the theater. After doing some research, I decided on the Boston Marriott Copley Place. After speaking with someone at the hotel about getting information on transportation from the airport , I knew I was going to the right place. I decided on the T (Boston's Metro), and the directions I was given were absolutely perfect. The Marriott is right across the street from Back Bay Station. The concierge was great at giving restaurant recommendations and overall directions. Although my plane landed early that morning, I did not think I'd be able to check in. My room was all set (which was even better). The room was comfortable, the staff extremely friendly and the hotel was in a great location. Next trip to Boston, I definitely plan on staying here again. For someone who likes to walk, I found the hotel conveniently located to some great neighborhoods and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ncdene23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just stayed here for one night. We live outside the city but had plans for a weekend getaway. The Copley Marriott is a great location! We had tickets to Blue Man Group in the Theater Distr. and it was a short walk there. The staff was very friendly. Our room was clean. The beds were a bit on the softer side. The elevators were extremely busy (but you'd have that on a Sun. morning). We actually walked the stairwell from the 5th floor to the 21st! There is a nice indoor pool to take a quick dip and the workout room was great. There is a Starbuck's in the lobby which is key when I travel - love a good cup of coffee in the morning! I highly recommend this hotel if staying in Boston and taking in the sites. You couldn't be in a better location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travellingtuba
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The location was awesome-- connected through indoor hallways to a mall on one end and a huge upscale shopping center on the other. Through the shopping center and indoor walkways it is connected to the Hynes Convention Center (where I was attending a conference), so it is quite convenient. It is also very close to many restaurants and other attractions. The hotel bar is nice with good calamari, and there are always people bustling around (which can be good or bad, depending on your tastes). The beds were comfortable but a little soft and the coffee maker didn't quite work right, but overall I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: trishwall
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for a conference and got the incredible rate of $89/nt at the Marriott Copley Place. Incredible! Not one, but TWO malls are attached to this gorgeous hotel. Had a fantastic Thanksgiving buffet meal at Gourmeli's at the hotel. The Sushi bar is fabulous too. With a refrigerator in the room, it's so convenient and helps save money to buy groceries across the street at Shaw's. So much to see and do, that we couldn't do it all. The Discover Boston trolley car comes right to the door if you'd like a casual, guided and comprehensive tour of all of Boston. The attached upscale mall has a subway station near the Westin, and is on the bus line. Everything is SO convenient. Boston was much less expensive for us than NYC. LOVED it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Marriott Copley Place”
Reviews.Author: Kamtini
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at the Marriott Copley Place - the hotel is well-situated (a fantastic shopping mall is attached to the hotel on the second floor and a 24 hour supermarket is across the street), the staff is professional, and the rooms well-appointed with great views of downtown Boston. The gym was exceptionally well-equipped and it was wonderful to have a Starbucks in the hotel. The only downsides were its lack of free internet (come on, major chains!) and the need for a bit more light in the room. This property is great for a Boston visit and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “conference hotel extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: senejay
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Marriott Copley place from the 22nd of october for a week. check in was prompt, directions to the room could be better. room was clean,beds were comfortable.decor lived up to the rating.bath had seen better days but ok.well stocked with quaity toiletries. tea/cofee making facility was a plus with request for tea bags prompt but not DILMAH tea.(my favourite unblended tea) linen adequate amounts. lifts busy had to add a few minutes for the journey. Breakfast was waiting for.on sight chefs made the breakfast a real treat. location was good for shopping,travel Duck tours(groceries next door) The champions bar was full of Redsox fans on the days of play ask for a room with a river view

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff, good food, bar and location awesome”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelexplore
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the location and as I always do, based on Trip Advisor comments. Our rate was okay, the standard $349 for a standard room, so I wasnâ€™t expecting much and we didnâ€™t really mind because we were there to see Boston and catch up with some good friends. We arrived early at the hotel and wanted to leave our bags. The concierges met us at the front door and were so welcoming, as were the reception staff. They gave us the keys to the room, but said that the room we had requested was still occupied, so we could have a look at the one they gave us. When we went up there, it smelt of smoke. When I went down stairs they then gave us the choice of two other rooms. The first was really lovely and relatively spacious, view great, the second, a suite, was incredibly spacious and a stunning view. We chose the second and moved our bags in, but it still needed cleaning, this was fine as we were just about to meet our friends. After spending most of the day outside, we headed back to our beautiful room and then I hit the shops which were in a Mall adjacent to the hotel. I am living in New York and so I can go to all of the same shops here, but I always seem to find more things on holidays. Shops included (Dior, Tiffanys, Max Azaria, Ralph Lauren, Salvatore Feragamo, Barneys, Coach etc). We had some nice drinks in the bar downstairs and then good room service for pretty reasonable prices. We headed down to the pool with our toddler the next morning and had a nice swim and sauna. We then met friends for the yummy breakfast. It was a really good breakfast, but for me, the only thing missing was, bircher muesli. Our hotel stay was great. Really good service, good food and bar and really friendly staff. The only negative comment I would make is that the towels were really old (probably the oldest I have ever come across in a hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and friendly for a big city”
Reviews.Author: SophieG1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in October. We obviously did not do very well on the rate compared to other reviewers, we paid $429 per night. My husband expected a little more from the room because of this rate such as robes and slippers which were not included. However, I was very impressed, the Marriott brand very rarely disappoints, and when it does, it always makes amends in my experience. We had requested a low floor room which we got. It is true that you may have to wait some time for the lifts. We also requested extra towels which were there on arrival. We wanted a late check out and were given until 6p.m. for $75. The concierge was friendly and efficient and Lifestyle limos (recommended by the hotel) provided an excellent return transfer from the airport. We ate at the hotel restaurant, Gourmelis and service was very efficient and friendly. We were staying with our three year old daughter and all of the staff were very good with her. The place felt very friendly. The staff at the pool were also very helpful and efficient. Overall the hotel and Boston provided a wonderful weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Lack the details”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. The service was fine but the two issues I had was the information in the guest directly was not up to date and the elevators were scary and not reliable. The hotel only had two out of 9 elevators running at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: docbrownBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on vacation for five days in middle to late September. Our room was on floor 38 so it was very quiet and we had a great view looking towards Symphony Hall. The room was tidy and clean and the elevators were fast and frequent. One lamp in our room wasn't working but the low energy bulb was replaced within 30 minutes of us reporting it. The location of this hotel is excellent. It is possible to walk to the two nearest T stations without having to cross a road and there is plenty to see and do in the immediate area. There are good local restaurants - we particularly liked Atlantic Fish on Newbury Street. We ate breakfast in the hotel at Gourmeli's. This wasn't cheap but it was convenient, there was a wide range of good food and the service was excellent. Coffee and fresh orange juice were topped up regularly. This is a really good hotel, the best we stayed at during our vacation, but unlike other hotels there is no computer with Internet access for guest use so we had to go to an Internet Cafe to check our emails.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler89
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was the highlight of my stay. Copley Place has everything one could imagine and there is plenty to do in Boston. The hotel itself was not worth the money. My room was dark and had stains on the floor. The bed linen was not the cleanest and the bathroom was not clean effectively during my entire 5 night stay. I would not recommend this hotel. They nickel and dime you for everything and the rate is astronomical for what you get. The pictures online are decieving as well. I wouldn't return unless nothing else is available in town

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: New_Yooper
Reviews.Content: A very disappointing stay! I stayed here for a convention in October 2007, but missed the convention room rate by a couple days. I needed to go, so I got stuck paying the $549/nt rate. I stayed at the hotel once before in 2000, and it's starting to show its age. My room was small for the price. I requested a king and got two double beds. The carpet had a 2 x 10 inch burn at the foot of one of the beds. They gave nothing for free -- you need to shell out an extra $10/day for wired internet. The exercise facility was nice, but packed every time I tried to use it. The water fountain in the exercise room was out of order, though you could buy bottled water at a machine next to the sauna. I volunteered for the committee that sets up future conferences -- we won't be coming back. If you can get a rate in the $200 range, it's worth it based on the location. If you get stuck in the same situation as me, you have several alternatives within a couple blocks. Try the Sheraton or Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Marriott..what a great stayed !!!”
Reviews.Author: asiantraveler-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Marriott in for 5 days back in September,2007. What a great choice ! We're very happy right from the start. From the staffs at check in to the maid that came and cleaned and made our room..it was 1st class "ALL the WAY". We couldnt asked for more in the sense of services that were shown to us during our short stay. The room were big enough for 4 of us and the view from the 27th floor was breathtaking. We didnt request for a floor so high up but the lady at check in was more than happy to assign us to the 27th floor...that's" walking and extra mile" for the guest. Boston Marriott is located close to all major attractions. The duckboat tour was just acrossed from the hotel. The Boston City Trolley has a desk in the lobby and the hotel is one of its many stops. Now that's convenient ! Major shopping malls are walking distance and so as the many parks around Copley Place. Best in location,services and friendly staffs... as far as my family is concerned. Boston Marriott is TOP notch all the way ! We'll be back. One of our family members was interviewed by your Marketing Sales Manager name "Brooke" (hope Ive the right spelling) when we were waiting to board the DuckTour. I think he was very impressed with my sibling. My sibling did not only received not only 2 luggage tags but a t-shirt from TRIPADVISOR...that's was the highlight of our trip to Boston. Enclosed are pictures from our trip. As always...we like to keep intouch so we can be intouched !! Kam

Reviews.Title: “4th of July Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: ftlsb85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Copley Place over the Fourth of July. Although it was raining miserably, the hotel had plenty of windows on the highest floors to view the spectacular fireworks. We requested the highest floor and, as a result, we saw fireworks from every suburb of Boston from our room. It was one memorable experience and the sports bar was inexpensive and very good. Also, the Marriott is walking distance to Fenway Park and it is connected to the Prudential Center. I highly recommend this hotel over any in Boston. The Valet staff was also friendly and pleasant. Lastly, the Boston Duck Tours begin directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “No regrets only wonderful memories.”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiem45
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise! This hotel is absolutely fantastic and I compare it to some of the best in the world. No, it is not stuffy nor aloof. It thinks it is a convention hotel that has luxury and great customer service. It is all that and more. Staff could not have been more helpful or friendly. It is in the Back Bay area so it is not close to the Freedom Trail but Boston has so much more nearby. You will not be disappointed. Great property for Marriott. We stayed 4 nights on the 36th floor. Amazing view of the city and the Charles River. No complains whatsoever. Hotel food was excellent too. Close to great shopping and wonderful small local restaurants nearby. The "Ducks" are across the street and are a "must." I had initially been relucant to book this hotel but having stayed there, I now know my fears were unfounded. I'd stay here every opportunity I'd get to go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service - They Get it!”
Reviews.Author: BeachWizard4U
Reviews.Content: Empowerment. That's the key word here. The Marriott management at this hotel has empowered their staff to assist guests in overcoming problems the guests encounter. Because the staff are given the power to help you, this is a great hotel to stay at. How many times have you been treated badly by a customer service rep who was wearing a pin that said something like,"You're Number 1 with me?" The point is that corporate America is great with slogans, but generally lacking in fulfillment. Not so at the Marriott, Copley Place, Boston. During my 4 night stay here, I had a problem with Internet access. Though it took awhile to resolve the hotel's system failure with Internet access, the staff I dealt with were wonderful. It was clear that each of them was empowered to do things on there own to compensate me for my loss of time, and the difficulty I experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location!”
Reviews.Author: WhatMickyEats
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with the Boston Red Sox package. We were able to check in early on day of arrival and were even upgraded to a suite for the same price! We were on the 34th floor - amazing views. Very convenient location to the T - Orange Back Bay Stop. We walked everywhere - followed the Freedom Trail right out of the hotel. Breakfast each morning was better than most hotels. Overall, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, incredible views”
Reviews.Author: booklover123
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night at this hotel. Our room was on the 33rd floor and the view of the city was incredible, especially at night. We overlooked the Charles River and much of the city. The service was excellent also. The parking is expensive but it is the same in any large city. I would definitely recommend this hotel-the price was also very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Some great - some not so great”
Reviews.Author: Melston
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. When we arrived they didn't have our reservation, and since the Sox were playing in town there was no room in the Inn! They were ready to send us out into the street when I went into my EMail and came up with a reservation number WITH the correct date. Still no room, but they set us up with a room at the Colonade just down the street at the price we were quoted for the Marriott Copley Place. (when we checked out of the Colonade the next AM, they tried to charge us a MUCH higher price! - got that worked out, though.) They gave us a really big corner room when we checked in the next day - likely to make up for the fuss. Like some other reviewers, we did notice that the sheets weren't changed every day, but ours were clean with creases the first day. The foam mattresses and down bedding is lovely, and the room smelled like they had just cleaned the carpets and drapes. The bath was spotless, plenty of towels - just as I'd expect for the price. The conceriege was quite wrong not once but twice when he gave us directions to places that weren't right around the hotel. Ask the workers at the "T" station if you really need to know how to get someplace. The breakfast at the restaurant was good, but I was expensing it, otherwise we wouldn't have eaten there.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakast service”
Reviews.Author: EmsmumDublin
Reviews.Content: we stayed in another hotel in boston but had breakfast at the Marriott each morning. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and buffet breakfast was only $4.95 for kids

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: cb35
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel for a wedding on a Saturday night. The hotel made about $50,000 on this large wedding yet they continuously nickeled and dimed their guests. 1. They charged $7.00 for a beer and $9.00 for a mixed drink at the wedding - ridiculous. 2. The entree portions were so small that my whole table went to Champions bar after the wedding to get some $12 appetizers because we were starving. 3. The "special" wedding guest rate was $199 a night - real special. 4. They validated parking which cost $16 but expired at 3AM. So, if you stayed over night, you had to pay double to park. And valet overnight parking for a guest of the wedding was triple. The most disturbing part of our experience happened in the hotel room. The bathroom in our hotel locked while I was inside. My husband called to have maintenance let me out, and he said it happens all the time. So, good luck if there's a fire and you're traveling alone. Overall, we were VERY disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Boston Marriott Copley Place Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wyzgirl514
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Boston Marriott Copley Place and were pleasantly surprised! Everything we saw on the website about this hotel was correct! What a great location - this hotel is in the nicest part of Boston that my family and I saw! Connected to this hotel was a skywalk that was perfect for entering and leaving the mall across the street with many shops and restaurants, including California Pizza Kitchen and The Cheesecake Factory (what could be better?)! This hotel had a Starbucks, a few nice restaurants and a gift shop in it. It looks beautiful from the moment you enter it! The room was nice and decorative, not gigantic, but roomy enough. The beds were VERY comfortable and the room was clean! The indoor swimming pool and jacuzzi were very nice! Parking our rental car in the garage adjacent to this hotel proved to be costly! We paid a total of $88 for almost three days of parking the car and couldn't leave to go out to dinner one evening, because we were told we would have to pay another $30 or so! This is much more than the average family can afford, but we just ended up charging it. All in all, we had a great trip and I would recommend staying at this hotel! Walking around Boston was a lot of fun and we saw so many great sites. We did the duck tour, which I would recommend to all families. It was well worth the money and we learned a lot. Being on land and then water was a lot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “The Complete Package”
Reviews.Author: Anrmd
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here previously and this was for a short stay on our way home from Europe. The Marriott is well located and is connected to two very nice malls (Copley and Prudential) with restaurants (Legal Sea Foods among others). We had a nice clean, quiet room with a great view (15th floor). They had already sent up the roll away bed for our daughter (nice, because we were tired from a long flight). Check in was friendly and fast. The hotel has many nice amenities to include an indoor pool and jacuzzi, a Starbucks in the lobby, a sushi bar, and a nice restaraunt. A full breakfast buffet for our daughter was $4.95- a great deal. Hotel is in a nice part of town. You can easily walk to Newbury St. (great shops and restaurants), The Boston Public Garden (swan boats), and to other interesting sites. The subway is also very close by. I would recommend this hotel as a very good overall value and good location for Boston. I would definitely stay here again. Only (very) minor negative comment would be that the hallway carpet was overdue for vaccuuming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ejan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night after bringing our daughter up to Boston U for their summer program. As a Marriott rewards member, we got a complimentary upgrade to the club floor which included continental bkfast and hors d'oerves and desert in the evening. Great deal (we only payed $149 for the night)! The room was small but very nice, with a fantastic view of the city. Boston is great and this Marriott is in a really nice area, we walked everywhere - to Copley Square, the Public Garden, Boston Common, etc... The hotel is also connected to an incredible mall, which was fun to walk through even at night after the stores were closed. Overall, an excellent stay, highly recommended. Tip: keep checking back to Marriott website, the rate kept going down closer to the date, and we got it adjusted a couple of times!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelinsider
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel with three children, 16, 13 and 7. We had a great time. Pretty good location, close to subway stop, right on Duck Tour, two attached Malls and high end street shopping, OK pool. Very accomodating to family travel. Parking is over $40/day, expensive but not expected for a large inner city garage. Valet service was very slow. Great view from the room. Elevators a little slow. We had a great deal on pricing. PS, Boston is very hard to drive in...don't suggest it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay When You're In Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Suzy_Shopper
Reviews.Content: All I can say is for $95 with Priceline, (plus taxes of course), this place is a gem. It's in a great location, near all sorts of shopping, restaurants and in a great neighborhood - I can't say enough. There's even a Shaw's grocery store right across the Street. Our room was HUGE! They gave us a corner room which was ginormous! The hotel was very clean and well-maintained. The only thing that bothered me was a rather long check in time at the front desk. I guess that's because the hotel is huge and it was a holiday weekend. I'll just let that one slide and just be thankful that my two nights were very enjoyable. I'd go back there in a second when I'm in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thesmarttraveler
Reviews.Content: I must say that the the Boston Copley Place is one of Boston's nicest hotel properties. I found it on Boston's Best Hotels (bostonsbesthotels.googlepages.com) and definitely agree that this is one of Boston's best hotels. First of all, the location is fabulous. The hotel is in a (safe) neighborhood close to many shops, restaurants, attractions, etc. The rooms are clean and nicely furnished, as are the many public spaces. The hotel has over 1100 guestrooms, but the service is still great. Dining at the hotel is OKAY but there are many dining options nearby. Prices are a little steep, but I heard you can get the hotel on Hotwire/priceline- would definitely be a great option if you could. All in all, this is a great hotel in a great location and is worth the $$.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay”
Reviews.Author: mctrees02
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline a day or two before for $85 on a Sunday night. Arrived early in the afternoon and were given a high floor with a nice view as the concierge levels were sold out. Very helpful staff and the lady checking us in tried to upgrade us due to my Marriott status even though she knew we booked through Priceline. Room was nice and clean. I realized a day or two later that I had left my charger in my room. While housekeeping couldn't find it, the head of that dept (JoAnn) offered to let me come by the hotel and look through the other chargers that were never claimed as we were still in town due to bad weather cancelling our flight back to Dallas. One other thing of note, each day there is a water dispenser placed near the check-in counter. Each day it has something different added to it for flavoring. We tried orange, lemon, and orange with mint while we were in town. I must recommend the orange w/ mint!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times, when in Boston and always found the hotel excellent. Rooms good, spacious, clean and with nice views, gym good and shopping center just a short walk away. Good concierge desk and staff always pleasant. Shall look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: UkGMan
Reviews.Content: Not much to add over the other reviews - great location, well maintained. Didn't see much more because in a conference in a nearby hotel. I guess the only things to add is that the rooms are relatively small, though the bathroom was good. Being tall normally showers come up to my shoulder at best, but could stand under this and was a good shower. Layout of lobby areas bit weird and soulless - seems to be floating between the road level and bridge into the shopping centre proper - could do with a proper entrance from the shopping centre and signage to mark where it starts and finishes.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: MVY
Reviews.Content: I got this room via Priceline and was in Boston seeing family for one night. It was just perfect for the price, even though this is a big chain and could have been dismal. The bed was among the most comfortable I have ever slept in, the room service was outstanding and I had a beautiful view, looking south, in a very large room. I have stayed here before and am always happy with the location, which is right in the middle of Copley Square, attached to two malls and near just about every restaurant one could ever desire to visit. (Just check your bill if you order room service.......like other hotels, this one adds a large tip automatically and you do not need to add more.) I needed a late check out and they were wonderful about that, giving me more than the time I needed. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lastiki
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our Memorial Day trip to Boston and stayed at the Boston Marriott Copley Place. It was our first time in Boston and we could not have picked a better hotel. Our room was super - a wonderful bed, great shower, and terfrific view. One of the best qualities was its location. Only a few blocks away from the T station that took us everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel is also connected to 2 malls and as many restaurants and a Starbucks inside. We did eat at the Championship restaurant on the main floor and found it to be very good. Across the street from the hotel is a Shaw's grocery store. Perfect for picking up snacks or breakfast items since our room had a refrigerator and a coffee pot! When we return to Boston we will not think twice about where to stay. It will be at the Boston Marriott Copley Place.

Reviews.Title: “New bedding & great views!”
Reviews.Author: sebie
Reviews.Content: I returned due to a stay 2 years ago. It has a fantastic location with connecting skyways to 2-3 malls, food and businesses. Over all, the prices will vary, but considering its a mass market convention hotel, it was clean, constantly busy and the staff encounters were actually friendly! I found the upgrade in bedding a "10", the bathroom a bit small, but well stocked. The room is true Marriott business functionable but with great views. Due to my schedule, I am unable to report on the pool or other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: butterpuff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Copley Place for a weekend recently and was very impressed. The room was clean ( and I am very picky about cleanliness at hotels) and everything worked properly. The view was great and the bedding is very nice with washable duvets. My children enjoyed the swimming pool, which was nice and warm and not too crowded. The restaurant was good for the breakfast buffet. Location was very close to shopping via covered walkways and also close to T stops and Boston Common and area restaurants. I would definitely stay here again while in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Sofie765
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that makes you feel like you are one of the family, then the Marriott Courtyard on 88 Exeter Street is for you! This hotel has the amenities of a large hotel with all of the benefits of personalized service. The Hotel Manager, Rene, takes a genuine interest in the experience that each of his guests has. Every night there is a Boston related activity designed to engage the visitor in the feeling of being in Boston. This ranges from afternoon tea to the chocolate experience to the Sam Adams Beer tasting to the free 10 minute massages on those stressful Monday nights. The rooms are spacious, quiet and high speed Internet service is included. The hotel is just a quick walk from Newbury street, and there are many fine restaurants in the area. All of the Staff are friendly and helpful. This courtyard offers the best of Boston with a home town feel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: YOW76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mariott during a conference in Boston. I was very impressed by the hotel and the location. I usually stay closer to Fenway or Faneuil Hall during trips to Boston, and was concerned that staying here may be too far from the sights. But, many sights were within walking distance. The room was great, as were the beds. But, I think the biggest perk is not something to do with the hotel itself, but the fact that there is a grocery store right across the street! It was extremely convenient. I have only two minor complaints about my stay: 1) You are not allowed to bring alcohol into the hotel, which is pretty lame (although the concierge winked at me and said to just bring my wine in concealed in a grocery bag) and 2) that despite the above restriction on alcohol, the hotel still was more than happy to give us a wine opener......for a charge of $4!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Always Great”
Reviews.Author: TexMarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a conference and were not disappointed. Every Marriott we have stayed in has been excellent. The room was a king with refrigerator, safe, and coffee/tea pot. The hotel is connected to two malls which can be reached without going outside (it snowed two days while there so this was appreciated as we left a warm climate.) The hotel cafe for breakfast was excellent, many shops and restaurants are nearby in addition to the malls, a grocery store across the street, the historic trolley stops at the hotel, and the train station for travel throughout the city is convenient. The staff was excellent, friendly, and efficient. Rooms were gone at the conference rate at the time we booked, but after arriving and speaking to the manager, we were given a reduced rate.

Reviews.Title: “very good experience”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: Wanted to be in Boston for Easter and had the Marriott points and we were able to get into the Marriot Copley for 2 nights. very good time. parked in the garage $32 (not valet which is $41) and it was easy to let the family off and pull right in. Parked in garage, walked through the copley mall and I was in the hotel. Did not have to step outside. Copley and Prudential Malls are fairly high end and provided good shopping for 2 days. We went to the starbucks on the second floor of the hotel every morn and it was very convenient. Room was very clean. Was w/ family and they put in an extra cot in the room for my 12 year old and it was very comfortable. beds were very comfy, TV worked great w/ a very good selection of shows, and water was HOT every morn for showers. used the pool which was warm, sauna warmer and hot tub was very nice. plenty of towels in the pool area, and while crowded it felt nice. used both metro stops at Cop and Prudential which are right outside mall and it was nice. plenty of cabs waiting for us over easter and whisked us all over the city. we were on the 24th floor and view was spectacular over the river and Cambridge. no shortage of good restaurants on Newbury and we even ate the sunday Easter Brunch Buffet at the hotel restaurant and it was very good. Pleasant check in, elevators very slow at times but a really enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelSchmavel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many other surrounding properties in Copley, and this is my favorite so far. I booked through Priceline, got a great deal, and was treated great! Asked for a room with a view and received it. The in-room cooler wasn't working and they brought me mini-fridge to use right away. The location is excellent for everything in Boston and very close to the T (public transit). Pros: - Location - connected to Copley mall, within walking distance of many attractions - Outstanding service - Many restaurant choices on-site and close by including a grocery store right across the street - Clean rooms, non-smoking property - Excellent choice for both business and tourist travel - Starbucks in lobby Cons: - Parking is tricky and expensive here

Reviews.Title: “Stay here in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Car1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic stay in this hotel - very central location. Slap bang in the middle of two shopping centers - great for shopping - Victoria Secrets, Saks 5th Ave, Barneys, etc. etc. etc.!!!! Fab restaurant 'Top of The Hub' in Prudential Center - homemade warm baked cookies - delicious!

Reviews.Title: “a retreat from it all”
Reviews.Author: rlf1981
Reviews.Content: the stay at boston Copley Place was better than anything expected. it was for a business trip, a conference being held there, and the service was phenomenal. the staff was great with directions, the bedding and rooms were thoroughly turned over each day, and a wealth of resources was available to me as a first time visitor to Boston. a great place to stay right in the middle of the city! a shopping mall and several eateries are within walking distance, and attached to the conference center - so no need to go outside!

Reviews.Title: “Boston Marriot Copley Place”
Reviews.Author: sharon17
Reviews.Content: The fridge did not work and the extractor fan in the bathroom did not work and of course like all hotels there is never enough free milk for the coffee but now on to the good points. The beds are the best I have ever slept in, so soft I did not want to leave mine. Staff were smiling, courteous and helpful. Such a joy when you arrive tired and just wanting to be pointed to your room. The sports bar is a great place to eat and drink and is very reasonably priced. You must try the pulled pork sandwich. We spent many a happy hour there. Again the staff were prompt and helpful. The views are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kayti5555
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, attached to a shopping mall and within walking distance of several tourist sites. The rooms were clean and about average in size. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: mintrob
Reviews.Content: The best service I have received at a hotel in a long time - the front desk went out of their way to be helpful. The room had a view that was to die for looking out over boston and you could watch in the distance airplanes arriving at the airport. The sports bar in the hotel was very good and so was the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrippingMa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple times in the last few months. This is a very large hotel that caters to conventions. What I don't like: The lobby area is constantly crowded Housekeeping is only fair (candy wrappers left in the corner of the room, stains on chairs, etc.) Threadbare towels Windows leak Refrigerators don't work Lousy cable TV Long waits for packed elevators on busy checkout days You're supposed to be able to call in advance to get your car from valet parking, but when it's busy they don't answer the phone and make you go downstairs and stand in line for 20 - 25 minutes Ripoff $39 per night for parking Small pool with few chairs gets crowded What I like: Good size gym Great beds and plush bedding One side of the hotel has great views of Boston Super location in the middle of Boston Indoor access to shopping malls, restaurants, convention center Immediate access to Mass Pike if you're traveling by car Prompt, courteous bellhops Courteous desk clerks I would suggest staying here if you either get a great rate (under $120) or just want to be in a hotel attached to the mall but don't care about getting a top luxury hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK location, but nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: seekingfun
Reviews.Content: I have travelled happily many times with Marriott over the years but this has not been one of my best trips. As with so many mediocre hotels, this one looked great from the outside, lobby is fine, elevators refurbished, but the hallways upstairs were painted over, worn out looking and rooms were older too with updated furniture. On to the nickel and diming, $40 for parking. $10 for internet access. $5 for cheap bottled water in the room. $60 to allow us entry to the hotel bar after 8:00pm on new year's eve. Security guards checking guests at the elevators to confiscate beer and wine carried in from the grocery store across the street. Disgrace, and insulting to a Marriott rewards customer of many years, I'm sorry. Other than that, the location is good, just like dozens of high quality hotels on the back bay in Boston, who probably include all of the above for free and dont post dozens of security guards at their entry points. Stay elsewhere if the rate is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: davechri
Reviews.Content: We used the Marriott as our base for our vacation to Boston and it worked out perfectly. The location is central and access to the T is super convenient. The ability to get to the T on a rainy day while staying dry is fantastic. The hotel itself was very nice. We were simply looking for somewhere clean with some basic amenities and were more than satified with the Marriott. I'd gladly stay here again and really can't think of a better hotel to stay at for all the convenience it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled, this is a very mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendywendy
Reviews.Content: Don't be other reviews saying how great this hotel is - it is maybe one level up from a glorified motel 6 but if you expect anything more you'll be disappointed. We booked here instead of the Sheraton (which is also connected to the mall and convention center) based upon the reviews here but we were very let down. Immediately in the lobby area we noticed how shabby it felt. The lobby has only a small area for sitting around and the couches are so worn and old that you can see them sag even without anyone sitting in them! You know when you see an old couch that's been on a front porch exposed to weather - they have that look. Also everything looked kind of dirty, for instance in the elevators, they didn't vacuum the edges only the center, so the edges all looked dusty and there was old dirt. Just sloppy. We stayed at in a regular room for a few days and then a "suite" which is just an extra large room with a sitting area. We found an old grape, a bottle top and some old vegetable right in the middle of the floor - it obviously hadn't been vacuumed and that I would say sums up the way it felt. One had the feeling that instead of providing you with new water glasses and coffee mugs each day that they wiped out you used ones with one of your old towels and put it there as if it was clean. The furniture was okay but not great. The rooms appear to have been renovated within the last 10 years but it just didn't feel nice. Also the bathroom isn't really renovated, they saved money by leaving the bathtub area so it has an old bathtub and wall tiling from the 60s I guess, pretty depressing. Two pet peeves - they only give you 2 sugars and 2 creams for your in-room coffee maker which makes 4 cups, I can't imagine why they try to economize on such an insignificant detail when it makes one so annoyed. Also they ask for you only to put towels you need washed on the floor to save water etc but they don't give you any racks to put the towels on! The only towel rack is in the bathtub - hardly a practical place to put one's towel to stay dry when someone else will be taking a shower. The lobby of the Sheraton looked much nicer, bigger, cleaner, more elegant, more places to sit and work etc. Next year we will stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Marriott Copley Place was FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: loan030778
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from staying at the Marriott Copley from a 3 day shopping spree. Was quite dubious as generally stay in a 4*+ accomodations, no problems at all as thought it was higher than a 3 1/2*. Hotel is in a very good location, located in the Back Bay area and right next to the Copley Place shopping Mall and Prudential Centre, Newbury Street is only 2 blocks away. Hotel staff and the concierge was very helpful and polite. Gym, Pool facilities were good. Hot tub was clean and very relaxing!! Rooms are clean and beds were very confortable, went with a friend and got 2 Queen size beds in our room, which is standard when booking with a travelling companion. If travelling with your partner get a King size one. It was nice to enjoy a whole double bed to myself!! :0) One of the hotel restaurants was the Champions bar, really good buzzing atmosphere, typical american sports bar, good to experience the culture. Food was very yummy and cheap with good size portions!! Very Pleased with Boston Marriott Copley and would definately return. Also Boston itself was absolutely fantastic!! Fell in Love with it. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Marriott Copley Place!”
Reviews.Author: TheFab5
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a wonderful stay in Boston. I had never been to Boston before and was not sure which hotel to pick for my husband and myself. Boy did we pick a winner! The location of this Marriott can not be beat. So many restaurants and shops all at your disposal. We had a room on the 29th floor-2914 a beautiful corner room with a view that was amazing! The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast in the Marriotts restaurant was delicious with plenty to choose from. We walked all over the city and saw where many of the other hotels were located and were so happy we picked the ours. If it rains you don't even need to go outside as two huge shopping centers are attached to both sides of the hotel. Legends Seafood, and The Cheesecake Factory are just some of the restaurants attached to the hotel. The next time we go to Boston for a getaway weekend we will definately stay at the Marriott Copley Place!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: amygt1104
Reviews.Content: Good location, connected by covered walkways to stores, restaurants, and T (subway) stops. They gave us the perfect room on the 23rd floor on the corner so we had a marvelous view of the city, the Charles River and much more. They even let us check in when we got there which was 11am--we were so happy that we could unload our bags and hit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel above average and Great Boston location”
Reviews.Author: World_Hiker_Dallas
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the Marriott Copley, Boston. This is a big convention hotel (we think it is the largest in Boston), so there are a number of impersonal touches from a big property. We liked the location, connected to the Pru Center and near all the best that Boston has to offer. The view from the room was great. The room quality is pretty good overall. It is not a Hyatt/Westin, but not shabby either. There are nice shower amenities though the water flow leaves alot to be desired. The beds are great, though we got a sore neck from the foam pillows. Web service costs money. Based on the location and overall acceptability, we would go back and stay at the Copley Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: bellaire1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days there Oct.14-19. A great hotel, a bit pricey but no more expensive than any other comparable hotel in Boston, that's just Boston. Great service and assistance from hotel staff. Great location, close to the T, (subway). You can walk to the T in about 8 minutes without ever going outdoors. Starbucks in the lobby, close to the Prudential Bldg. and losts of shopping and food. Located in the Back Bay area, it is a very nice place in a great location which makes it easy to get just about anywhere. My suggestion, do not rent a car in Boston unless you need to travel outside the city. Traffic is horrible, parking is worse and very expensive. The T will get you just about everywhere a tourist would need to go. The Boston Duck tour is also worth the $25 dollars or so for a quick overview of the city. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel, but quite nice”
Reviews.Author: wondertrev
Reviews.Content: Probably the nicest Marriott I've stayed in. Rooms and bathrooms are fine, though not terribly large. Comfortable beds. Gym has several treadmills, C2 rower, some Precor cross trainer, essential Cybex equipment. Salt-water pool. Large lobby with free wifi. Was able to get free wifi connection in my room on 10th floor, probably from nearby apartments. Efficient and helpful staff. Expensive parking. Hotel connects directly to 2 nice but small malls, so there are 2 Au Bon Pains for b'fast, Legal Sea Foods, etc... Well-stocked Shaws with good wine selection across the street.

Reviews.Title: “best beds ever”
Reviews.Author: TAMember1234
Reviews.Content: after a delayed flight from the U.K. and a rather unfriendly "welcome " from a Boston immigration official, this hotel was a welcome sight. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept in in any hotel. Breakfast was very good value, and we had the pool to ourselves early in the morning. Very well situated for all the tourist attractions, would definitely reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Marriott at Copley!!!”
Reviews.Author: cancercaregiver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property for one night while in Boston to see a doctor. We called the Marriott 800 number from our car, booked the room, arrived less than 10 minutes later and checked in. Front desk very helpful. We were given access to the Concierge Floor even though we were not staying on this particular floor. A great added bonus. Our room was located on the 35th floor with a prime view of the Prudential Center and other buildings. Room was nicely appointed with new bedding. The bed was super comfy and the room was of good size. Bathroom was updated with a rainfall shower and larger size bottles of shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and body wash. The concierge floor is WONDERFUL. The lounge at 3pm when I went in to grab drinks had home made cookies, tea, coffee, and fresh fruit at that time. The selection of complimentary drinks was amazing. Diet pepsi, pepsi, ginger ale, Sierra Mist, bottled water, Red Bull, Snapple Green Iced Tea, and Snapple Diet lemon iced tea. Of course they had the honor bar open as well. When we went up at 6pm they had crab cakes, potato puffs, veggies with dip, crackers and cheese, and a few other things. The best part of that floor was the unbelievable view of the Charles River from the enormous windows. Beautiful. In the evening they were serving brownies, cookies, and truffles. It was a nice touch and more extensive than some of the other Marriott concierge floors in other properties that we have been to. We ordered room service for dinner and were happy with the food and the price. It wasn't too bad for a hotel in the city. Dinner with salads and soups ran us $60 with a dessert to share. It came within 35 minutes and was better than expected. There is a Shaws supermarket right directly across the street from this hotel. I ran over there to grab a few items that I had forgotten. If you are looking for snacks or drinks, buy them here and skip the gift shop. It is a very nice market with everything that you could want at a fraction of the price. This hotel is right at the entrance to the Shops at Copley Place, it is nice to be able to walk out into the mall with all the great shops and then head back to your room. Finally in the lobby there is a UPS business center that has internet access that costs $5/15 minutes along with other business services. My only complaint with this hotel is that the hallway on our floor was always dirty - dishes left outside the doors and they remained there for a while. Also, the valet charges $39 a day. I know that parking in Boston is expensive, but that seems a little steep, especially when there is no other option for parking. No self park in the garage or anything. Not a huge deal, but if you are not expecting it, then it can be a surprise. All in all, I would definitely stay here again. This was not my first time here and it won't be my last. Have fun and request one of the top floors for the best view.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Conference Center Marriott”
Reviews.Author: TheImproperBostonian
Reviews.Content: Quick one night stay at the Copley Marriott. It's a conference center hotel, but we were there to celebrate our anniversary. The location is very convenient to the Boston Convention center -- and is in the heart of Back Bay. Our room wasn't spacious, but it is a city hotel. The new Marriott beds and linens are very comfortable. Concierge was very helpful in selecting a restaurant for dinner. Would recommend again - although if you're coming to Boston as a tourist I would recommend staying at the Long Wharf or Customs House instead as you'll be closer to the water and many of the tourist attractions the city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RELady
Reviews.Content: We arrived on September 2nd and had planned on staying only one night. We had requested early check in so that we could get situated and then get to a Red Sox game we had tickets for. Unfortunately our room was not ready and the game had been moved up from 7pm to 1pm so we had to hustle to Fenway. Upon returning at 5:30 our room still was not ready. For the inconvenience they upgraded us to a suite that had a Murphy Bed - which surprisingly was extremely comfortable. We were on the 34th floor with wonderful views of the Charles River. It was too bad that the weather was lousy. We made a last minute decision to stay two nights and not fly home until Labor Day. JetBlue was able to accomodate our change without fuss and the Marriott let us stay in the same room at the booked rate not the suite rate. I quite enjoyed the covered walkways to the shopping due to the rain and my husband took advantage of the sports bar, Champions, to watch all of his games. We ate at the sushi bar which was very good but went over to Giacomo's in back bay for dinner and couldn't have enjoyed it more. The hotel was very busy due to a conference. We found the bellman to be especially helpful and truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Marriott, Copley Place”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyTripper
Reviews.Content: We flew to Boston on jetBlue. I was able to get a ridiculously low air fare and was impressed with the quality of the aircraft. The hotel is in a lovely location. It is a smart looking hotel. I would definitely recommend it to other visitors who travel to this great city. Overall, we were impressed with this hotel. The check-in at the Mariott Copely Place was smooth and quick. There was only one mishap during our stay which occurred as soon as we arrived and it involved the elevator service. Just before the elevator reached my floor the inner door opened. The elevator was a foot short of my floor and the outside door was still shut! The bloak I was with tried to pry the door open but it refused to open. This totally freaked him out â€“ We were stuck dangling up 20+ floors and unable to exit and it was upsetting. We were stuck on the elevator for 7-10 minutes while sounding the alarm bell for help. A very helpful security staff member, tried to calm us down as he spoke to us from the other side. Finally the elevator door was able to open. We were told that there was no mechanism to open the outer elevator door from the inside in case of emergency, which remains concerning. The security staff member was sincerely apologetic and sensed how disturbed we were to be stuck. To make up for the traumatic experience he ordered a wine and cheese tray to be sent to our room. In addition, he arranged for us to use the concierge services on the 28th floor, courtesy of the management of Marriott. Without a doubt the view of the Charles River and Back Bay from the upper levels of this hotel is a marvel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BCMSW06
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to priceline a hotel in the city for the night, rather than driving back to the Cape. For $100.00 we were delighted to have been placed at the Marriott Copley. Check in was smooth and quick. We were given a king bedroom, non-smoking, on the 29th floor with a great view. The room was clean, the bathroom was spacious. The new beds from Marriott are tastefully done and very comfortable. This hotel is in a great area and has plenty to offer the most discriminating traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for our family”
Reviews.Author: mamastrauss
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here while my husband was at a conference. My husband and I and 2 kids were in one room, and my mom and sister were in a connecting room. If we had had only our room, it would have been pretty cramped - standard city hotel room, just big enough for 2 double beds, desk, and armoire. However, the staff was very accommodating - I had called about a week ahead to ask for connecting rooms, and they held them for us, even though they were full and we checked in pretty late. Also, my mom's room was, as requested, handicapped-accessible and much larger than our room. With the connecting door open, we had plenty of space. There also was a refrigerator, as requested, in each room (small but empty, not a minibar) as well as the standard coffee pot (tea bags provided as well as regular and decaf coffee). Of course, the location is great - can go across the street to the grocery store to stock up on breakfast food and snacks, has Starbucks in the lobby, and is directly connected (by escalator) to Copley Place mall and (by covered pedestrian bridge) to Prudential Center mall with tons of shops and restaurants and T stations connected to both (Prudential stop and Back Bay). On really hot days, we used the underground passage from Copley Place to Back Bay station to avoid going outside. Concierge service was very helpful with dinner reservations. Only minus was that we had expected to use the indoor pool, but when told that it was heated to only about 78 degrees, we decided it was too chilly for us Californians.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: NYCandworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. The location can't be beat, the service was great. And the beds -- soooo comfortable. A great choice for Boston. I should particularly note the Valet parking was incredibly fast, which I really appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Clean, Comfortable, and a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: PULauraLU
Reviews.Content: Just a terrific stay. Staff was quick and friendly with tasks, room was very clean and extremely comfortable. A bit expensive to connect to the internet for the week we were there, but the connection was reliable and fast for business purposes. Desk was very nice and large with a retractable shelf/table.. accomodated two laptops and a printer with ease. Shower pressure was lower than I like but still very well kept up. Bathroom was very clean.. and housekeeping kept giving us more tissue (kleenex) even if we had merely moved the box to the main room, which was great considering my allergies. The food was also incredible - Fridays and Saturdays they have a delicious buffet - we saw the menu which looked like a wedding invitation and were pleasantly surprised to find that for a very reasonable price ($22.95) you could enjoy tropical salmon, pan-crusted cheese tilapia, mussels, shrimp, scallops, and I think there was also chicken and maybe beef as well, plus great appetizers and desserts. The best dinner for the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: bloomsday16
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a convention in Boston (during one of the hottest weeks ever in recorded history, but that's another story) and I spent five nights at this hotel. Overall, it's a very good value for the price (I paid the conference rate of $159 a night, plus taxes, which is really a steal for a big hotel in a big city these days). Pluses: great, comfy bed. Nice linens and towels, overall the room was basic but very clean. Great insulation too, I never heard any noise at all and I was only on the 8th floor! (This is a big deal to me as I am a light sleeper.) The front desk was great as well. I was accidentally booked into a smoking room the first night and they told me that even though the hotel was sold out for the convention, they would try to move me to a non-smoking floor the next night, which amazingly enough they did. Minuses: don't eat at the hotel restaurants if you can avoid it. Not the worst food, but there are so many other places nearby that are great (Brassiere Jo just down the block is fantastic, there is a Smith and Wollensky walking distance if you want a great steak, Summer Shack is also walking distance for great lobster in a very fun and lowkey setting). As far as the location, I think this is a great spot if you like to shop, which I do. Copley Square Plaza has a Barney's and a bunch of other shops, but for the best high-end shopping experience you must go to Louis at the corner of Newbury Street and Berkeley. That place is the bomb! Anyway, this is certainly a decent hotel for the price. I am sure there are much fancier places to stay, but I have also paid a lot more and had much less to show for it.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcmerrn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the marriott for a weeklong conference and it is a wonderful hotel close to everything. The hotel is beautiful and everything you would expect for a marriott property. the meeting rooms were comfortable and the hotel is close to the hynes convention center. The hotel is connected to 2 great shopping malls so there is lots to do in the down time. Newberry street is 2 blocks away and is just wonderful for shops, dining and just walking around. You can walk for several blocks and see beautiful row houses. Beacon street is about 5 blocks away and is beautiful too. I would highly recommend doing the freedom trail. We took a taxi (about $12) to bunker hill and walked down to paul revere's house, ate at an italian restaurant and took a taxi back to the hotel. A wonderful walk.
