Another activity not to miss is the Duck tour! You must buy the tickets in the nearby shopping center and buy them early because they sell out really fast. This tour is wonderful and so much fun! If you rent a car, a trip to Lexington , Salem and Gloucster is nice. We really loved Plymouth, it is a very cute little town on the coast, home of the rock and the Mayflower 2. We loved Boston, it is a great walking city and people are very friendly. The history is awesome and the scenery great. I would love to return anytime to this city and especially this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dentalhy
Reviews.Content: We arrived on June 29, 2006 and stayed two nights. Perfect location. We parked the SUV ($39 a day) and left it there until we checked out. The room was on the small side (there were 5 of us), but we didn't spend much time there. The beds were heavenly! The room was nicely decorated and very clean. The location was great: grocery store across the street, malls and shopping right there, right next to the WONDERFUL Duck tour, and walking distance to everything we wanted to do. The staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. The work out room and pool were great too. We did not eat at the hotel: the prices seemed high. We were able to find healthy, good choices nearby in the Prudential center. We would return here: afterall, it is the OFFICIAL hotel of the Boston Red Sox!

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: churchie04
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at Copley Place while visiting Boston with my fiance. We spent very little time in the hotel as our trip revolved around apartment hunting. Location: If you want to be close to the city and near a few T stops, then this place is great. It is located inside a mall so there is a lot of nearby foot-traffic, but it's Boston...there are people everywhere anyway. Service: Only service we recieved was maid service. We didn't order any room service or anything else. The room was very clean upon arrival, and was taken care of while we were away. Food: We did not sample any of the resturaunts. Overall: It is a nice place to put your feet up for a little bit, and the bed in our room came with 9, that's right 9, pillows. Overkill or luxury? You decide

Reviews.Title: “Nice but bland”
Reviews.Author: dkeith
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in a corner room with a great view. Nice spacious room with similar bathroom. At checkin they seemed unsure of type of room booked but no real problem, checkout was seemless. This is large hotel with typical amenities-safe and fridge in room etc. Two distinct shopping areas are readily accessible without going outdoors. The more upscale (with Neiman Marcus, Jimmy Choo, Tiffanys etc) practically runs into the lobby while the more modest one can be reached via skywalk. This means accessible shops but also results in busy lobbies. Location is very close to Boston Library and shops on Newbury Street and a ten minute walk from Boston Common. Some reviewers like this location but I find this area is too much like any other big city and perfer something closer to the Common. Only negative-the elevators were pressed to keep up with demand on several occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Decent large hotel, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: midwestgrrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and extended my stay by a day for sightseeing. The hotel is fairly typical as large convention hotels go -- very large, lots of amenities and conveniences, easy to get a cab, etc. A few problems: - Ridiculously slow elevators - No free Internet access anywhere in the hotel, ridiculous in this day and age, especially in a hotel that purports to cater to conferences and business travelers - Small and very average rooms for the price I realize Boston is a more expensive city than some, but $300 for a room that could have been in any hotel in any city was too much. All that said, the hotel staff was EXTREMELY nice, accommodating, friendly and helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lgelkins
Reviews.Content: The Boston Marriott at Copley Place was a perfect location for a weekend getaway. It is connected to the Prudential Center, so even though it was raining when I was there, I could still shop without getting soaked. The hotel itself has most everything you would expect from a Marriott. The rooms were nice - the beds were very comfortable. We ordered room service, which was prompt and delicious. We did not have any other meals at the hotel. We stayed on the concierge level, but this didn't matter because the services are not available on the weekends. My friend booked a morning massage, while the rest of us enjoyed the pool. The pool area is lovely with a huge skylight to let in natural light. There is a hot tub and a sauna, with the workout area in a room just off the pool. I did try to upgrade to a suite with Marriott points, but was told there was no suite available, which was a little hard to believe - the hotel is massive. Overall, a very pleasant stay with a perfect location for shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Marriott hotel in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: First and foremost the location of this hotel hard pretty hard to beat. You can't be much closer to everything. The hotel itself I found to be a better Marriott hotel with the typical ameneties you would expect from such a hotel. Rooms are spacious and some on the higher floors have a wonderful view over downtown Boston and the Charles river. For a hotel of this size it is well maintained and the staff manages to provide an unsuspected level of service which is not as unpersonal as one might suspect. However it still is a large hotel so one shouldn't expect to much personal attention. The hotel features Marriott's new Revive bedding which I love. There's also a nice fitness center and very well maintained indoor pool area.

Reviews.Title: “With disappointment, okay, I suppose”
Reviews.Author: Falkirkgirl
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at Marriotts and found the Boston Copley hotel to have the usual Marriott amenities, their signature comfortable beds and clean rooms. We were originally booked into to room 1738. The room was small and while the bathroom was clean, as was expected, it too was on the small side. Having only stayed previously in Cambridge I do not know if the rooms are typical in size to other downtown hotels. Only when retiring for bed did we hear the loud hum of the hotel's air conditioning system - and was enough to request a room change at 11.30 p.m because it was impossible to sleep through. We were eventually moved to another room on level 29 which was better, but I would not say perfect. I don't usually complain about hotels (particularly Marriotts) and very infrequently do I ask for a room change - but this one certainly required it. Otherwise a very typical Marriott and ideally placed for downtown with direct covered links to the two main shopping areas - but the next time in Boston it will be back to Cambridge for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but the price?”
Reviews.Author: Victorianrose
Reviews.Content: My companion and I travel to Boston quite frequently and have always stayed at the Marriott primarily due to its location. We were quite disappointed when we planned our most recent trip (4/15) only to find the price for 1 night had nearly doubled in comparison to our previous stays. We were in town for 2 days to see a Red Sox game, hadn't realized it was the weekend of the Boston Marathon. We ended up staying a block down at the Colonnade for 1/2 the price where found excellent service and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaafha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Marriott Copley for a quick overnight & booked our room via Priceline. We got an excellent deal & received only quality customer service in dealing with the hotel staff. We called ahead to ensure booking a room with king size bed, etc... The hotel is located in walking distance to lots of shopping, food, etc... and we even walked to Fenway Park although some may prefer to take the T there. Our room was great, with a very comfy bed & was extremely clean with a great view of the Boston skyline. There are a few restaurants located directly in the hotel, but we opted to eat elsewhere so I cannot speak for food or service there.

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Incidents - Addendum”
Reviews.Author: YBM
Reviews.Content: If anyone cares,(and I'm not sure anyone would)I just want to make it clear that the Marriott Copley Place wrote back and offered to replace my tie. The dry cleaner actually removed the spot without any telltale signs, at a minimum cost; so I didn't feel it was necessary for me to be reimbursed for anything - but I thought it was EXCEPTIONALLY GREAT SERVICE for them to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept on. Great hotel, near to all, always something to do. We arrived back at the hotel at 12:00am to find a great band playing at the bar/lounge. There were a lot of people dancing and having a great time. I have stayed at many hotels in Boston, this was the most fun!

Reviews.Title: “Also Well-Compensated for Mistake”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: Often when reading reviews in Tripadvisor, I am struck by the frequency of reviews indicating that a particular hotel was not responsive to a customer's complaints. I had flown to Boston before a conference at the Marriott and planned to meet up with a friend at the hotel, check into our room, and spend a morning together before the conference. My friend left a written message for me at the front desk indicating that she was at another room at the hotel and I should call her when I arrived. Unfortunately, though I went to the desk on three occaisions to check to see if our room was ready, and though I specifically asked if there were any messages for me, her message was not given to me until our room was ready. By that time, I had waited in the lobby for 2 hours, and our planned morning together was ruined. We politely conveyed this to the staff, and they sent a bottle of wine and a cheese plate to our room. I respected their professionalism both in hearing our initial complaint and responding to it. More generally, I found the housekeeping services to be excellent, and I especially appreciated the range of equipment at the gym and the number of available treadmills. The hotel is conveniently located in a mall complex, and while I normally eschew mall destinations, I appreciated the convenience of walking to Legal Seafoods (highly recommended) and Starbucks (right in the hotel), as well as the high end stores -- Dior, Elie Tahari -- right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Well compensated for minor disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JenonMV
Reviews.Content: Was not told about the pool being closed for painting. Had we been (an over-40 3 moms night away for one night), we may not have booked there. We were still able to access the hot tub and weight room, but I complained and was pleasantly surprised with a 40% off discount for our troubles. Everything else was great--beautiful view of a city we're very familiar with, courteous staff, very clean room, great beds and bedding, one of the best locales in the city. Marriott continues to make us happy.

Reviews.Title: “Overall an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotels for several days while here on business. The rooms were nice, and I had an incredible view of the city. Without leaving hotel, there is access to a major shopping mall and Newbury Street, which offers a wide array of shopping and dining options, is about two blocks about. This works out for the best because the dining options in the hotel itself are subpar, for example, you can get better sushi at the supermaket than at the sushi bar in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott, bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: candy3389
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with very comfortable rooms. Extremely well located. There is a sky walk into 2 malls with some super premium shopping such as Gucci, Bally and Dior. Starbucks on second floor next to a nice little restaurant that does a breakfast buffet. Excellent concierge service. Great beds! 2-3 blocks from Newberry and Boyleston streets. There is a Legal Seafood in the mall. My only problem was the noise. The maid and bellhop in the morning seemed to be shouting in the hall as did people coming in in the evening. I don't really think they were shouting; I think there is little to no soundproofing in these rooms! Take some earplugs!! Would stay here again, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RichDe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to do some xmas shopping. Wonderful access to multiple malls with high end stores. Easy access through enclosed walkways. Hotel room on the 37th floor had great views of the South End and Blue Hill. The bed was super soft. Nice sized room, but fairly small bathroom. Service was friendly. I do not recommed the attached "Champions" resturant. This is a well know sports bar. It was not crowed, yet the service was terrible. We waited over 1 hour for simple pub food. Barely an apology from the flustered waiter. The food was less than mediocre after the long wait. For similar food and atmosphere in the complex, try Chili's or Legal Seafood.

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs - do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for a weekend Oct. 27th - Oct. 29th. The first night I woke up at about 2am itching severely - cause - lots of bedbugs - and I mean lots - riddled with them. We called management who offered a $100 discount - pathetic. We were moved to another room - we were not even upgraded - I stay in Boston 2 weeks a month for business and was not impressed. I was not pleased with the way the management handled the problem and will therefore not ever recommend this hotel to any of my staff or anyone else. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sadandy
Reviews.Content: Comfortable Hotel superbly located in Back Bay. Walking distance from Downtown and close to all transportation. Nice spacious room. I particularly liked the fitness centre and pool and the supermarket directly over the road.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a conference and found few faults. The room was a good size for a city hotel. I was by myself, though, so it might be more cramped for a family. The location can't be beat, especially if you are attending a conference at the Hynes, as I was. One unexpected bonus was the huge Shaw's supermarket across the street--I hate eating all my meals in restaurants so I appreciated the opportunity to pick up light breakfasts and snacks there. The location is very convenient for touring, also. It's an easy enough walk to Newbury Street, the Common, Beacon Hill, etc. and of course cabs and the T are close by. It's a big, busy hotel but the rooms are quiet. My only complaints are the book rate--so, so high!--and the elevators. Six elevators to serve the bottom 27 floors of the hotel, yet there was always an extended wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice Marriot Copley Place”
Reviews.Author: travelmum
Reviews.Content: Thanks in part to reviews on this site, I chose the Boston Marriot Copley Place for a Boston trip in August. Originally was going to stay at the Copley Park Plaza and it was suggested that hotel might not be so great for kids, and someone suggested the Sheraton near by with the outdoor pool. I booked the Sheraton, but then cancelled after reading too many poor reviews. Someone wrote they wished they'd gone down the road to the Marriot so I checked out those reveiws and all were positive, so I booked there. The hotel was easy to get to, with parking right there. We were early, 11am or so, and I left the luggage in the car thinking it was too early to check in, but no problem, they gave us keys to a room right away. The room was a reasonable size for a big city hotel, clean and modern, included a fridge with plenty of room to store supplies. The location was great, a half block or so from Copley Square, near the underground and attached to a huge Mall that we wondered around during the odd evening. It's a bit of a walk from the downtown area and the Freedom Trail, but we walked there several times, walked to the theatre etc. instead of taking the T, a pleasant and safe walk. Now this is not a small cosy hotel, it's one of those big city hotels, huge in fact, attached to the mall, so all sorts of people are wondering around the lobby area - not the type of hotel I'd normally choose. However, the staff were very helpful. The Trolley Tour has a stop right in front of the hotel, and you can buy tickets in the lobby, so that was handy. The concierge people were excellent - they had details and directions for everything. One gentleman in particular even knew which track on the T to take when switching trains on the subway. They also had nice little printed cards on driving routes out of town. One eveing when returning late and hoping to have a light dinner in the Sports Bar, we found that it was not open to children after 8pm. Neither was the Terrace Bar, and the restaurant looked a little boring for what we wanted. No problem, at the Terrace Bar they had a few tables outside the actual bar and offered us one of those, and treated us very well. There's also a sushi bar and a Starbucks in the lobby area. The hotel has an indoor pool and exercise room which we used a couple of times early in the morning or at the end of the day. I'd recommend this hotel, and while busy with conferences during the week, they have awesome deals on weekends. We were there for both and rather enjoyed the more business aspect of it, it seemed less busy then.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Copley Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Ekehl
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay, clean room, quiet, great view, comfortable bed. Great location to walk to Fenway Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but don't park in the parking garage! Radio stolen.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel many times and always enjoyed the service, atmosphere and location. Unfortunately, my last trip to Boston was marred because I parked my car in the garage located next to the entrance of this hotel. It is not affiliated with Marriott. Not only is this garage expensive, but my car was broken into and my radio was stolen! The car was parked on the first floor of the garage, nearly 100 feet from the "guard" station. The thief used a crow bar to rip my door handle off, disconnected the battery to silence the alarm, and took my radio. I reported the incident to the police. When trying to exit the garage, they made me pay my parking ticket! I parked my car in the gate and refused to pay. The manager was terribly unsympathetic and would not let me leave without paying in full. Don't park in this garage! You're better off on the street. Incidentally, the hotel staff was very kind and sympathetic. The security head was very helpful, and the concierge was quick to get me necessary numbers to report the incident.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: taxcpa
Reviews.Content: Lobby was very nice, with a lot of people around, if you like to feel like you're part of the city, although there was always a wait for the elevators (which wasn't too bothersome.) The rooms were very nice, nice decor, comfortable beds & pillows. Rooms were rather small, but not too small for just 2 people. The bathrooms were tiny. We had windows spanning the whole wall that provided great views. If you're on the right side of the building, you can see the river (our view wasn't of much.) Very quiet rooms, couldn't hear noise outside at all. The location was fantastic, walking distance to tons of stuff, right near a lot of great restaurants, and only a few blocks from the subway. We were glad we stayed in Back Bay and took the T-Line to everything else, it worked out the best. Most of the staff were nice, some could use a lesson in customer relations. Concierge was a complete joke. A blond older woman with a foreign accent. Don't bother if she's at the desk, ask the bellmen instead, they had great recommendations. We asked her for help, and had to wait (no problem.) As she was helping others, we watched everyone laughing at her and rolling their eyes. They all walked away saying they couldn't believe how bad she was. She didn't know where anything was, didn't know how to find anything, and generally didn't have a clue. The next day there was a male concierge, and he wasn't much better - gave us the long route to everything. We found everything on our own and were much better off. Otherwise the staff were great, especially the bellmen, who were very helpful and friendly. The rental cars in the lobby were overpriced, we went to Avis in the Westin across the street, and while they didn't impress us for several reasons, they were less expensive for the same thing. Strongly recommend eating in Little Italy, the food was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, and central, but little style”
Reviews.Author: petercbenson
Reviews.Content: The Good: downtown location a short walk to Newberry St. shopping/ Boston Common and even Freedom Trail / Harbor area, very comfortable bed/ linen, clean, quiet, small but nice pool/whirlpool/sauna, $80 / night via priceline was a great deal, supermarket across the street The Bad: room decor not especially stylish for a 4* hotel, room was somewhat small, windows badly needed an exterior wash Bottom Line: A great choice if you need a quiet, clean, comfortable room convenient to downtown area (especially if you catch a deal), but you may want to look elsewhere if you're celebrating an anniversary or other special event and want something with style or luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: propaneKauai
Reviews.Content: A tourist hotel, but not oppresively so. Great location, great views and comfortable beds. We received a good price with Priceline and were very happy with everything, except for a checkout day mix-up (security guards pounding on our door in the mornig, thinking we had already checked out and wondering why people were in the room). Oh well. Still a great place.

Reviews.Title: “There must be something better”
Reviews.Author: jbbb
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. We wanted to be near some shopping and it definitely met our needs in this regard. In fact, given the current construction along the waterfront, this is really the best area to stay for tourists. We were a bit disappointed with the room. It was non-smoking, but the designation must have been in effect just for that day because it was definitely a smoker's room. The room itself was average. It was small, and the bathroom was small. This is not good for families who need to "multi-task" in the bathroom! My biggest complaint about the hotel was the fact that room service must have gone on strike when asked to clean up the dirty trays in the hallway. We checked in at about 5 p.m. and there were probably 10 different breakfast trays laying in the hallway. Scrambled eggs everywhere. It was terrible. We went out to dinner, came back late, and they were still there! Thankfully, they had been removed by the next morning. So to anyone who reads this, I like the Copley Place area, but would suggest a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights in the Marriott. After some trouble getting suitable rooms at check-in, the rest of our stay was fine. Rooms are a little small but staff were on the whole helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Copley Marriott Best in Boston Overall”
Reviews.Author: momentum12
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in July. Staff great from early check-in at the front desk to concierge, bellman, housekeep, and dining. Impressed with the super clean room and bathroom, as well as the neatness throughout the hotel! This is a property that has been kept up well. Very quiet room, despite size of hotel and on-going conventions. Room was a good size with awesome views of Boston and Charles River. You cannot beat the location with the subway, buses and commuter rail at the door. Plus you have 2 malls connected, Boylston/Newbury Streets, and a Shaws Market across the street. Beats even a stay at Faneuil Hall or the Ritz and Hyatt, as there is always somewhere to grab a bite, unlike Faneuil, when that closes, there is nothing available. Also walked 10 minutes to Fenway. Location is important, and this hotel has everything else to go along with it!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: Valdiri
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here in early July after seeing a special for Marriott rewards members of $129 a night. This is a quality, very large business type hotel in a nice part of the city. Note: it seems like every large hotel chain has an offering in this neighbourhood. Things I noticed: There is a full-size Shaw's grocery store right across the street - very convenient. My std. room was spotless with a very comfortable bed and quality linens. One thing I appreciated was the type of ice machine they use - it dispenses the ice much quieter than the ones I have seen before. Good news if your room is nearby. The hotel is part of a complex with a high-end shopping mall... If you want convenient access to Saks Fifth Avenue and Neiman-Marcus, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the heart of things!”
Reviews.Author: iciejan
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel right in the heart of things. Attached to 2 shopping malls with plenty of selection of restaurants - Cheesecake Factory was my favourite! Large, clean rooms with huge windows with views right across Boston. The Duck tour starts across the road from the hotel. Parking is available but check the prices first. In the lobby there are representatives for the trolley tours as well as a car hire company. There is a swimming pool, gym etc on the fifth floor. Large, busy hotel but the staff I dealt with were all polite and helpful and we had no trouble leaving our bags there on the last day while we carried on sight seeing. If I was in Boston again I would certainly use this hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Short, but memorable”
Reviews.Author: bccoreo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the Sunday night before Memorial Day. We had a great room with a great view (34th floor)! We arrived pretty late (well, 7pm) and didn't have much time to venture through the city, so we went downstairs to the Champions Sports Bar for dinner. Boy, was it crowded! The bar was showing the NYY-BoSox game, so it was full of energy. Because there were only 2 of us, we got seated pretty quickly. The drinks were expensive (but it is the city, so what should you expect? Cosmo was $7, beer $4.50). We loved the casual menu (cuz we're casual people). We ordered the nacho platter. The serving was so generous, it was enough for two and we didn't need dinner afterwards! I believe they cost $10, if memory serves me. The room was very spacious as well. See if they have a corner room available when you check in! The view we were afforded was specatular. The bathroom was simple, nothing fancy. Check-in and check-out were smooth as silk. The valet staff was very attentive as well, and when we needed a cab in the AM, it was right there waiting for us!
